loans.name: Azizatou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe AZIZATOU est constitué de dix femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à  Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers et sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. 
Madame SAKI est le membre du groupe qui fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires. Elle est la deuxième debout à droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  3 cartons de cube maggie, 25 kg de sel gemme, 50 kg d’oignons, 2 paniers de choux frais, 3 paniers de tomates fraiches, 2 paniers de d’aubergines, au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The Azizatou Group is made up of ten married women who, on average, are 37 years old, have 3 children and live mostly in monogamous families in Sikasso (Mali's 3rd administrative region).

These women sell a variety of goods and this is their first loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which they are seeking in order to satisfy the needs of their customers.

Madame Saki is the group member who sells foodstuffs. In the photo, she is second to the right, standing.

With her loan, Madame Saki intends to purchase 3 cartons of Maggi cubes, 25kg of rock salt, 50kg of onions, 2 baskets of fresh cabbages, 3 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 2 baskets of eggplants at the large market in the city of Sikasso and in the neighboring villages.

She resells her wares at retail and in cash in a permanent family stall at the large market in Sikasso, to a group of customers made up of men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20,500 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest, while the remainder will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She earns a living through farming. Renita grows and sells rice in her community. She works hard to help provide for her family's needs and send her children to school. Renita's goal is to have all her children finish college.

Renita has requested a loan to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes this loan will help grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Evelyn has a duck pen where she raises and sells ducklings & duck eggs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for her ducks & ducklings.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for ducks & ducklings

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 30, is married and has two children. She lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City.   Her husband helps to support the family by operating a cell phone shop. 

Thao has been in the beauty salon business for three years. She plans to use her loan partly to buy cosmestic products to sell and partly to support her husband's business by investing in cell phone accessories to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business, repair her house and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy cosmestic products and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Carlos Patricio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años, es soltero, vive con su hermana en Atuntaqui que está a 15 minutos de Ibarra en la provincia de Imbabura. Carlos se considera una persona trabajadora, alegre, solidario y con ganas de salir adelante.

Carlos trabaja solo en la carpintería específicamente en la elaboración de muebles. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de madera y laca al por mayor, inversión que será fructífera para Carlos ya que le ayudará a tener una muy buena productividad y en un futuro buenos ingresos económicos.

Su sueño es poder adquirir nueva maquinaria ya que hoy en día se ha incrementado la tecnología, esto le ayudará a que sus productos sean de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Carlos, 25, is single living with his sister in Atuntaqui which is 15 minutes from Ibarra in Imbabura Province.  Carlos considers himself to be a hardworking, cheerful and supportive person who very much wants to get ahead.

Carlos works alone in the carpentry shop specifically making furniture.  This is the second loan he’s requested from Fodemi and he will use it to buy lumber and varnish at wholesale, an investment that will be fruitful for Carlos because it will help him increase production and in future to have good income.  His dream is to be able to acquire new machinery since technology continues moving forward; this will help his products be of better quality.

loans.use: to buy lumber and varnish at wholesale.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en: Enriquita is from the village of Mohon, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Enriquita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Enriquita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as  manure. In 2010, Enriquita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as  manure

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is 39 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. Her husband lives and works abroad.

Fatima is a very active and supportive woman. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients for a reasonable income every month which helps her pay for her children's school fees.

Fatima is requesting a loan from Asasah, which she will use to expand her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her finishing her orders on time as her current machine is old and inefficient.

Fatima is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident that she will be successful in increasing her profits after making an investment in her business.

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is widowed with four children. She is now 51 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

Victoria is a farmer and grows rice and other vegetable crops as a source of income. She has been doing this for 20 years. Victoria earned 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this activity. She has requested a loan of 49,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her farming business.
Victoria has been a member of PMPC for four years and one month. in the future, Victoria hopes to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her farming activity.

loans.name: Loch

texts.en:
Mr. Loch is 60 years old and is a widower who lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. He is a farmer, cultivating rice crops for his livelihood.  He has been in agriculture since 1985 and he has joined a course, successfully studying crop husbandry. He is able to earn an average of $2.00 per day through his business.

At present he is looking for a loan of $500 from HKL and Kiva to purchase a piece of farmland from his neighbor. He hopes to increase his rice crops and make more income to satisfy his family. He has five children, two of whom depend on his income.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru:
Уулкан 41 год, вдова, воспитывает четырех детей.  Уулкан работает санитаркой в местной больнице, но из- за низкой заработной платы, она , в качестве дополнительного заработка, занимается животноводством. Стартовав с покупки одного жеребенка, Уулкан смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее 2 лошади и 20 баранов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух голов лошадей. Доходы Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в дальнейшем - накопить средства на оплату образования для детей.
texts.en:
Uulkan is 41 years old, widowed and is raising four children. She works as a nurse in the local hospital but due to the low salaries to medical workers she also supplements the family's income by raising livestock. Uulkan started her livestock business with the purchase of a foal and has now expanded her herd to include two horses and 20 sheep. 

To further expand her business Uulkan has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS). She plans to use the money to purchase two more horses for her herd and plans to use the profits from this expansion to buy more animals and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase horses

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий с семьей живет в городе Хуст, Западная Украина. Городок это небольшой, многие занимаются мелким предпринимательством, так как это становится единственной возможностью выжить для тех, кто не уехал заграницу на заработки. Виталий арендует торговую точку на одном из местных рынков, а также торгует по селам, занимаясь выездной торговлей обувью в небольшой торговой палатке. У Виталия есть своя клиентская база, в бизнесе он уже 3 года. Виталий привозит недорогой товар, с удовольствием вкладывает в свое дело и время, и силы. На данный момент в товаре имеет 40 000 гривен. 

Виталий планирует вложить кредит в 20 000 гривен в приобретение дополнительного количества зимнего ассортимента обуви, тем самым пополнив оборотные средства на своей торговой точке. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vitaliy and his family live in the city of Khoost, Western Ukraine. The town is small, many people are engaged in small businesses as this is the only way to survive for those who did not go abroad to earn money. Vitaliy rents a store on one of the local markets and also sells in the villages doing on-site sales of footwear in small stalls. Vitaliy has a customer base and has been in the business for three years. Vitaliy brings inexpensive goods and invests his time and efforts in the business with pleasure. At the moment he has 40,000 hryvna in his inventory.

Vitaliy plans to invest a loan of 20,000 hryvna in the purchase of additional winter variety of footwear thereby adding to working capital at his outlet.

loans.use: to purchase additional number of winter variety of footwear.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab is a 44-year-old man who sells animals and milk products. He started his business in 1995, and today he owns three head of cattle and five sheep. He is planning to expand his business to buy more animals in the future. Being a responsible and reliable person, he achieves his goals. Now Rajab wants to obtain a loan of 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to buy construction materials to repair his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Mededjro Group

texts.fr: MEDEDJRO est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Françoise (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 51 ans. Françoise a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Françoise est mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto du nom de Mathieu. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Françoise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Françoise vend de la nourriture à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d’année, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Françoise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Françoise sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MEDEDJRO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs et des condiments.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto es un hombre de 55 años de edad, nacida en el seno de una familia humilde que siempre se dedicó a las actividades del campo y, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, hoy en día se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, actividad con la que genera ingresos para apoyar a su esposa con la carga económica del hogar y para brindar sustento a sus dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad. 

Su espíritu de superación, la tenacidad y la fortaleza con la que se levanta día a día, lo impulsan para buscar nuevas opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar una ternera y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para continuar solventando algunas necesidades familiares y, seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, que se ha convertido en la principal fuente de recursos económicos para la familia. 

Edilberto desea seguir luchando con empeño, dedicación y esfuerzo, para llegar a cumplir el sueño de adquirir más cerdos y bovinos para tener una producción escalonada, que le garantice la entrada de utilidades constantemente y pueda brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Edilberto is a 55-year-old man. He was born into a family of humble means who has always worked in farming. Thanks to his parents' teachings, nowadays he raises and sells pigs. This business earns him profits with which he helps his wife afford the financial burden of the household and support their two children aged 12 and 15 years.

His will to succeed, the tenacity and the fortitude with which he wakes up everyday are the force that drives him to seek new options that allow him to get ahead. That's why he requests the help of a loan. With it he wishes to purchase a calf and feed concentrate for the animals. This will allow him to increase his production so that he can meet the growing demand. As a result, he will obtain higher profits in order to continue meeting some of his family's needs and investing in his business. This business has become the main source of income for the family.

Edilberto wishes to keep on working hard, with dedication and effort, so that he can achieve the dream of buying more pigs and cattle in order to get a staggered production. This will guarantee a steady inflow of profits and he'll be able to provide his children with better education and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and feed concentrate for the animals.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Akossiwa was born in 1976 in Zapomare in the canton of Sanguéra. She has two (02) children and two (02) orphans at her charge. Despite her very low level of education, she has a very open mind in terms business techniques and rigorous management. Her main activity is the marketing of loincloth and beauty products. This allows her to contribute at least 75% of the needs of the home as her husband has no specific revenue. She proved to be a good family mother and a trustworthy woman through the credits she obtained rising from $75 to $650 at the third credit. She reimbursed all credits without incident. She requested a credit of $ 1,000 that will be invested in the purchasing of loincloth and beauty products with views to enlarging her business. This will give her the necessary resources to meet the needs of her children and those two orphans.

Née en 1976 à Zapomare dans le canton de Sanguéra, Madame A. Akossiwa est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants et deux (02) autres orphelins à sa charge. Malgré son niveau d’études élémentaires, elle a un esprit très ouvert en technique de commerce et en matière de gestion rigoureuse. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de pagnes et des produits de beauté. Ce qui lui permet de contribuer à au moins 75% des besoins de foyer car son mari est sans revenus fixés. Elle a fait preuve d’une bonne mère de famille et une femme de confiance à travers ses crédits obtenus passant de $75 à $650 au troisième crédit, tous remboursés sans incident Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui servira à acheter des pagnes et des produits de beauté pour accroître son commerce. Ceci lui donnera plus de moyens pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et ceux des orphelins qu’elle a à sa charge.

loans.use: To purchase loincloth and beauty products

loans.name: Murdiah

texts.en:
Murdiah is a member of MBK who has requested a loan of $150. Murdiah had long been in the business of collecting used/recyclable materials. These are then sold every fortnight by delivery to larger collection/recycle centers. From revenue of IDR700,000, Murdiah derive an income of IDR300,000.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use:
Collecting used/recyclable materials -
Penampungan Barang Bekas

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana lives in her own home and the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of La Paz with her youngest daughter. She's 57 years old and sells athletic shoes for all ages and genders. She started in 1997 selling in the street, and now, thanks to an earlier loan which helped increase her supplies, she now has a sales post and sells her shoes during the afternoons. Along with this business, she opened a convenience store two months ago, and it has done very well. The loan she's requesting would be used to add more products and increase supplies in the store. Her credit history makes her an excellent candidate for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Juana vive en casa propia en la calle Cumana de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hija menor; ella tiene 57 años de edad, vende zapatos deportivos de mujer, varón, niños, e inicio su actividad en el año 1997 vendiendo en la calle, posteriormente se beneficio con un crédito en Impro con lo cual pudo aumentar su mercadería y actualmente ya tiene un puesto de ventas en la calle tumusla, donde vende por las tardes, además de este negocio ella inicio recientemente otra actividad: instalo una tienda de Abarrotes hace dos meses donde le va muy bien. El crédito que ella solicita es para aumentar productos y poder surtir su tienda. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como muy buena cliente por consiguiente puede ser acreedora a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Buy more products for her convenience store.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina has always worked in the mini-market business, but she just started this new one two years ago. With help of her son, she manages this new business. She receives her supplies from a man who delivers them to her door. She started this new business because her old mini-market didn't work as she intended and lost money. In her business she sells rice, beans, and soup, amongst other things.

She lives in the small community of La Cola, is married, and is the proud mother of seven children, 3 girls and 4 boys.

loans.use: To buy food and more inventory

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim R. started his business in 1989 selling food products. Gradually he increased his working capital and changed his business field to selling children's clothes. Naim is married and has two children. His wife is his business partner; she sells their goods when he is away on purchasing trips.

Naim buys his goods from Istaravshan, Khujand two times a week. The turnover of his business is good. As he has two kids of his own and really loves children, he has no trouble choosing clothes children like.

Naim is very satisfied with his business, but for the coming cold season he needs to purchase a batch of warm clothes such as jackets, cardigans, and dungarees. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200.

loans.use: purchase seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero A. deals in soup supplies, a business that she learned from her friend before starting her own in 1996. She has been a member of LAPO for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of $475 to enable her to improve her business. She is married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more soup supplies, palm oil, ogbolor from the village to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel is a young and responsible father who watches over the well-being and health of his three year old child. For Miguel, having become a father is a high honor ; the experience brought him to the decision to strike out on his own and leave the family business in which he had worked since he was very young, and through which he was supporting his family. With the savings he had been setting aside and his natural ability as an orator, he launched his small business selling natural medicines - a business that is now the source of his family's well-being. Miguel offers his products daily and his power to persuade assures good sales results. He has seen significant growth in three years; this growth motivates him to continue working for the betterment of his family. Every fifteen days he travels to the capital to buy the merchandise he will market and sell. He is thinking about creating a natural products shop. To cement his plans for the shop he has been studying. With the shop in mind he is applying for a loan with which to buy a larger quantity of products for the Christmas season, since he has more demand and wants to take advantage of the opportunity to obtain better earnings. With his earnings he will continue supporting his young child, who will start school next year. Support Miguel in this project to launch a natural products shop in his city. Your support is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Miguel, es un joven padre de familia responsable que vela por el bienestar y salud de su pequeñito de tres años; para él haberse convertido en padre es un alto honor y a raíz de este hecho decidió independizarse del negocio familiar en el cual trabajaba desde muy niño y de donde él proviene para sostener a su nueva familia.Con los ahorros que atesoraba y la habilidad innata de orador, implementó su pequeño negocio de ventas de medicinas naturales y con el ahora puede otorgarles bienestar a su pequeña familia. Miguel ofrece sus productos diariamente y ese poder de convencimiento asegura sus ventas es por ello que ha observado su importante crecimiento en tres años y esto le anima a seguir progresando por el bien de su familia; cada quince días también viaja a la ciudad capital para obtener la mercadería y la su vez las comercializa. Él esta pensando crear una casa naturista y para concretar este propósito ha estado estudiando, con este objetivo solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de productos para esta época de navideña en el que tiene mayor demanda y desea aprovechar la oportunidad de obtener mayores ganancias, con el podrá seguir sosteniendo a su pequeño que el próximo año ingresará a estudiar.Apoya a Miguel en su proyecto de instaurar una casa naturista en su ciudad. Tu apoyo es muy importante.

loans.use: Purchase  a larger quantity and wider variety of products in order to quickly launch a natural products shop in his city.

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Rany has been married since 1999 and has one son and one daughter. She has been in the business of running a grocery store since 2006. In addition, she is also weaving silk at home. Her husband, Mr. YOU Khat, is a farmer. He is raising cows in the village. Her husband attended year 9 at high school but Rany did not finish primary school. Therefore, they hope they can send their two children to pursue higher education. They are currently studying at local school in the village.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now she is requesting another loan for $600. She will use this money to purchase more grocery items for her stock to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing more grocery items for her stock

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Four years ago, as she separated from her husband, she was not able to receive money for the support of their children of 10 and 7 years of age because he was not employed. She thus saw the need to obtain income from other sources. While she was looking for a job, she saw newspaper advertisement for an opportunity to sell cosmetics through a catalog and went to the interviews. She currently has a group of more than 30 persons that sell the cosmetics.

However, the orders that her sales people place are many and the money that she has is not enough to fill them all. This is the reason for her request of a loan of USD $650 which she will repay in six months. With this money, Evelia will be able to advance her business as well as her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 4 años al momento de su separación, su ex-esposo no dio dinero para la manutención de sus dos hijos de 10 y 7 años, porque no tenía empleo. Así que ella vio la necesidad de buscar el sustento por otro lado. Y mientras buscaba un trabajo. Vio en el periódico la oportunidad de vender cosméticos por catálogo y acudió a las entrevistas, actualmente ya cuenta con un grupo de más de 30 personas que venden los cosméticos.

Sin embargo los pedidos que le hacen sus vendedoras son muchos y el dinero con el que cuenta no es suficiente para surtirlos todos, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Evelia podrá sacar adelante su negocio así como a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 46 years old, is a long-term member of the TYM Fund in Phuc Yen. Even though other members decided to do businesses near the town center, Mrs. T. chose to breed animals and sell food in the market. Her breeding complex has different sections for pigs, ducks and chickens, and rabbits. Currently, she has 6 pigs ready to be released, several hundred chickens and ducks laying eggs every day, and rabbits that are pregnant. Her income is pretty high and stable. She is not only good at doing business but also is an exemplary social person. Her father-in-law is a veteran. Her husband is working for the aerial authority and is very encourageous about the TYM Fund. Her oldest child graduated from University and is having a good job. Her youngest child is a senior in Hanoi Polytechnic University. She said she joined the Fund to improve her family economy, and also to participate in the Women’s activities in the area. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more animal food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết, 46 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên lâu năm của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh Phúc Yên. Khác các thành viên trong cụm thường làm dự án kinh doanh buôn bán, dịch vụ, tận dụng lợi thế gần trung tâm Thị xã chị Tuyết chọn dự án chăn nuôi kết hợp đi chợ buôn bán. Cơ ngơi chuồng trại của chị khá quy mô với nhiều khu riêng như: Khu chăn nuôi lợn, khu chăn nuôi ngan gà và khu chuồng trại nuôi thỏ. Hiện tại chị có khoảng hơn 6 tạ lợn thịt sắp xuất chuồng, khoảng hơn trăm gà đẻ và ngan cho trứng hàng ngày và vài chục cặp thỏ sinh sản. Thu nhập của chị tương đối cao và rất ổn định. Không chỉ giỏi làm kinh tế, gia đình chị Tuyết còn là một trong những gia đình văn hoá điển hình của phường. Bố chồng chị công tác trong quân đội về hưu, chồng chị đang công tác tại phường rất hiểu về Quỹ và rất ủng hộ chị. Con trai lớn đã tốt nghiệp đại học và đã có việc làm ổn định, con trai út đang học năm cuối trường đại học Bách khoa Hà Nội. Tâm sự của chị Tuyết là tham gia Quỹ ngoài việc vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế, còn góp phần xây dựng phong trào phụ nữ địa phương. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs, chickens

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is the owner and operator of a general store in Obuasi. She is requesting a loan to help expand the variety of products she can sell at her general store. During the day, Diana is a schoolteacher and her mother Rose operates the store in her stead. In the evenings, Diana returns to operate the stand. Rose is pictured above.

Diana is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of products for her general store

loans.name: Ndinagwe

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Ndinagwe M.. She is not married and has been blessed by 2 children, aged 9 and 12. In 2005, Ndinagwe established her rice selling business. She is now requires a loan in order to buy more stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu N. lives at Igbelerin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, foodstuffs, and provisions and has been in this business since 2001. She is 35 years old and married with has five children.

Abibatu has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. She needs a loan of $850.00 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Adilia Reátegui Portocarrero is a very cheerful and enthusiastic 49 year old woman. She is a member of Santo Cristo De Bagazan Community Bank and lives in the San Matin region, Rioja district. With her characteristic unassuming manner, she helps the community that has provided her with the opportunity to progress.

Adilia prepares and sells food dishes from an air-conditioned part of her house. Students from the nearby technical college are her most frequent customers. She decided to start her restaurant business after several years of working in the catering industry. It is something she enjoys and also allows her to share her time between running her business and taking care of household chores without much difficulty.

With this loan, repayable over six months, she plans to buy sugar, bananas, and oil in bulk to reduce her costs. She also plans to sell soft drinks as requested by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Adilia Reátegui Portocarrero es socia del Banco Comunal “SANTO CRISTO DE BAGAZAN”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Rioja y distrito de Rioja se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un ambiente acondicionado en su propia casa, ubicada en el Jr: Angaisa Nº 115 donde diariamente acuden los estudiantes del tecnológico quienes son sus comensales mas frecuentes ya que ella vive cerca de esta institución . Decidió iniciar su negocio de preparación de comida tipo menú ya que es una actividad a la que ella se dedica por varios años y le gusta , lo que le permite compartir su tiempo entre el negocio y las tareas domesticas sin mayores dificultades. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 a cual será pagados en 6 meses, implementará su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar por sacos, plátano en racimos y aceite a granel ya que sus costos cada vez son más elevados , además esta implementando su negocio con la venta de bebidas gasificadas ya que sus comensales lo requerían. La señora Adilia tiene 49 años, es una muy mujer entusiasta, alegre y con la humildad que lo caracteriza contribuye al progreso de la comunidad que le dio la oportunidad de salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mwanahamis's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children, ages 2, 4, and 3. She also serves as caretaker for 2 other children, ages 6 and 8. She began selling food in 2004. She works from 8am to 6pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Mwanahamis now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, vegetables, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in clothing sales and own their own shop.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her small salon.

loans.name: Niño Fajardito Communal Bank Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Niño Fajardito esta ubicado en L. Comunidad D. San Cristóbal en Huancavelica. L. comunidad D. San Cristóbal es un barrio populoso que cuenta con Colegios, Posta, Universidad, y una Zona Turística donD. se encuentran los Baños del Inca y un parque Eco Turístico. Entre las actividades que realizan sus pobladores esta L. ganadería, agricultura, comercio, transportes.

Juana O., esta separada D. su esposo, tiene 2 hijos a los cuales elL. se dedica como padre y madre porque quiere que sean profesionales, su negocio es L. venta D. golosinas que venD. ambulatoriamente. Juana sueña con tener una tienda D. abarrotes. Su préstamo lo utilizará para surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.

Elizabeth P., es casada, se dedica a L. venta D. golosinas en las escuelas, las ventas las realiza en un triciclo D. manera ambulatoria, su esposo tiene trabajo eventual, por cuanto no siempre cuenta con capital para surtir su negocio. Elizabeth tiene parálisis facial debido al estrés, pero elL. sabe que podrá salir adelante. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

TeofiL. C., tiene 7 hijos algunos D. ellos en el colegio y otro en L. universidad, tiene un negocio D. agregados para techo, el cual desea surtir comprando hormigón, confitillo grueso y fino. Su sueño es comprarse un camión, volquete o tractor.
texts.en:
The Bancomunal (communal bank) Niño Fajardito is located in the community of San Cristóbal in Huancavelica, Perú. San Cristóbal is a popular neighbourhood that has schools, medical clinic, university, and a tourist zone where the Baños del Inca (Inca baths) and an ecotourism park are located. The locals work at various occupations including grazing, growing crops, business, and transportation.

Juana O. is separated from her husband, and has two children to whom she devotes herself as both mother and father because she would like them to become professionals. Her business is candy sales, and she sells them on the street. Juana dreams of having a grocery stO.. Her loan will be used to stock her business and increase her sales.

Elizabeth P. is married and earns a living selling candies in schools from a mobile tricycle stand. Her husband has temporary work, so she does not always have the capital to stock her business. Elizabeth has facial paralysis due to stress, but she knows she can get ahead. Her dream is to have her own home.

TeofiL. C. has 7 children, some of whom are in school and another in university. He has a roofing aggregate business, for which he would like stock by purchasing cement, and coarse and fine gravel. His dream is to buy himself a transport truck, dump truck, or bulldozer.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The communal Bank Niño Fajardito requests a loan of US$1600 to benefit its 11 members in the implementation of their businesses

loans.name: Aurea Viviana

texts.es:
Aurea tiene 22 años de edad, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en Jr. Acobamba s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.
Empezó vendiendo pan en la esquina del mercado de Yungay y ahora tiene un puesto en el mismo mercado. Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 50 sacos de harina, 2 sacos de azúcar y 2 bolsas de sal.
Su mayor sueño es ser mayorista de pan junto a su esposo, para lo cual trabajan todos los días. Por Ahora no tiene hijos.
texts.en:
Aurea is 22-years-old and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay." She lives on Jr. Acobamba street in the district and province of Yungay in the department of Ancash. She started selling bread at the corner of the Yungay market, and now she has a stand in the same market. With this loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase 50 sacks of flour, 2 sacks of sugar, and 2 bags of salt. Her biggest dream is to be a bread wholesaler along with her husband, which is what they work for every day. For now they don't have any children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Elvi

texts.es: Elvi tiene 37 años, vive con  su esposo e hijos. Desde hace un año da pensión (menú diario) en su casa, por el momento prepara almuerzos, con esto tiene ingresos adicionales para su hogar, así está superando una situación difícil de salud, de la cual se está recuperando recientemente, ahora sigue adelante, y a la par también realiza diversos servicios, como lavar la ropa de sus vecinos. Elvi a futuro tiene un plan, dedicarse nuevamente a lo que antes era para ella un ingreso más rentable, que es la crianza de cuyes, pero está esperando recuperarse totalmente de una operación de cálculos biliares para seguir con más fuerza. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo de MFP, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos. Está solicitando este dinero como capital para seguir dando pensión a sus clientes, comprar los insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Elvi is 37 years old and she lives with her husband and children. For a year she has provided meals from her home. At the moment she prepares lunches, and this provides additional household income. In this way she can overcome a difficult health situation from which she is currently recuperating. She also offers various services such as washing clothing for her neighbors. In the future Elvi would like to return to a profession that was previously very profitable, which is raising guinea pigs, but she is waiting to fully recover from her gallstone surgery so that she will have full strength. This is the second time she has asked for a loan from MFP, demonstrating her responsibility in her payments. She is asking for this loan as capital to continue providing meals for her customers, buying consumables and ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and consumables to prepare meals

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sun N. is 54, married, and has four children. Two of her children are married; the two single children work as construction workers to help support the family. Her husband is a rice farmer.

Mrs. Sun N. grows vegetables and sells fish, which she purchases from fishermen and then resells at the market for profit. Rice farming is the main income for the family. She and her husband work very hard everyday to pay the family's daily expenses. Mrs. N. is requesting a loan to purchase two oxen, which she hopes will improve her crops and alleviate the hard work of farming.

loans.use: Purchase two oxen for farming

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: El señor Artemio C. P. ya tiene 18 años trabajando en un negocio en el cual vende lonches y tacos llamado "El trompo loco", es atendido por él y su esposa, este mismo les proporciona buenos ingresos. Pero ahora el señor Artemio desea usar este prestamo para poner un negocio de abarrotes y tener dos giros diferentes , para que de esa manera pueda obtener mayores ingresos los cuales son necesarios para que su esposa e hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Artemio C. P. has been running a business for 18 years that sells tacos and lunches, called “The Crazy Top,” served by himself and his wife which provides a good income. Artemio wants to use this loan to create a grocery business and have two different businesses so that he can have higher revenue which is necessary for his wife and children have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply merchandise to start a grocery business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A., the 38-year-old mother of a boy in junior high school, lives with him and her husband in a rented apartment in the small town of Koforidua, in the Ashanti Region. Her husband is a farmer cultivating crops such as maize and cassava, while Comfort trades in maize and bananas, buying her goods from farmers in nearby villages and selling in the market square and by the roadside.

Comfort has been in this business for over five years and is now requesting a loan to buy maize and bananas in bulk. She is working hard to support her husband so that they can put up a building of their own and give their son the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure bananas and maize.

loans.name: Chatarine

texts.en:
Chatarine K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Chatarine is 45 years old and is widowed.   She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Agée de trente sept (37) ans, Mme Akou D. est née à Dalavé où elle pratique la culture maraîchère (légumineuses). Compte tenu de la demande de plus en plus importe, elle sollicite un financement pour élargir sa surface cultivable pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle pourra mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thirty-seven years of age, Mrs. Akou D. was born in Dalavé where she grows vegetables. Because she is faced with greater and greater demand, she is asking for a loan to expand the area she has under cultivation in order to satisfy her customers. In this way she will be better able to support her family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow more vegetables

loans.name: Mustakim

texts.ru: Мустакиму 30 лет, женат и недавно у него родился второй ребенок. Основной его деятельностью является купля продажа скота на скотных рынках Исфаринского района. Вместе с отцом он выезжает на разные рынки искупает мелкий скот. Перепродав на другом рынке извлекает из этого прибыль и расходует на семью. Недавно пришел в МикроИнвест и подал заявку на займ и планирует закупить овец.
texts.en:
Mustakim is 30 years old, he is married and his second child was born just recently. His main business is buying and selling cattle on the markets of the Isfara region. Together with his father they travel to other markets and buy small cattle. Then by reselling on another market he makes a profit and spends on his family. He has recently come to MicroInvest and applied for a loan and plans to buy sheep.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agriculture and rising poultry

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has owned a small shop in addition to selling clothes and cosmetics in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for six months. She belongs to Nia moja group loan (Group code 2032). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $40. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Fatma is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes, cosmetics and other items for her shop to add to her current stock. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use

Fatma is 32 years old, married, and has given birth to a child that is now 11 years old.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, cosmetics and other items for her shop

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es:
GLORIA C. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Adolfo morey N° 665 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 48 años de edad, 6 hijos, y su esposo es carpintero.

Ella tiene una cochera y hace 3 años es socia de Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo empleó para algunos arreglos de su cochera, aunque el préstamo fue pequeño pero la ayudo bastante, ya que de lo contrario no seguiría en el negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una moto bomba, ya que sus clientes le piden que brinde también el servicio de lavado de vehículos, por ello necesita la moto bomba, para que pueda dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Desde que esta con Manuela Ramos, siente que hay un apoyo cercano y está conforme con los préstamos que ha recibido, y por ello ella no se atrasa en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Gloria C. A. belongs to the Communal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos”; her home is located in the District of Calleria, she is 48 years old, has 6 children, and her husband is a carpenter. She has a car garage, and 3 years ago she became a member of the Manuela Ramos program; her first loan was of 300 PEN, which she used to fix up her car garage. Though her first loan was small it helped a lot, given that without it she would not have been able to continue in this business. With this loan of 1,300 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of gasoline powered pump given that her clients have asked her to also offer car wash services, because of this she needs the pump to be able to give her clients the best service. Since she has been with the Manuela Ramos program she has felt that there is support nearby and has been happy with the loans that she has received, because of this she never delays in her loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a pump to provide carwash services.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Lola es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Lola tiene un puesto en el mercado Carmen alto en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Lola necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una computadora para sus hijos.
Lola sueña con educar a todos sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lola is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank, which means Black Eyes in the Kechua language. She is 44, and married with 3 children. She sells vegetables from her stall at the Carmen Alto market on a daily basis with the help of her husband. Lola is seeking a loan of 900 soles, which she plans to use as partial payment for a computer for her kids. She dreams of educating all of her children and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: As partial payment on a computer for her kids.

loans.name: So's Group

texts.en:
There are four people who are jointly taking this loan. Its leader, Mr. So K., is 47 years old and a rice farmer. He also climbs many palm trees to tap palm juice and boils the palm juice into palm sugar to sell in the market. He typically makes around 10 kilos of sugar per day and sells it to buyers at the price of $0.50 per kilo. His wife stays at home and makes a few clayish pots for a profit. This old couple has eight children; one of the children lives separately and the others are living in home and assist in their parent’s works. So K. requested a loan to buy a trailer, which he will use to pick up firewood for boiling palm juice. The other borrowers are:
Mrs. Chen N. will be using a loan to decorate the ladder of her house.  
Mr. Oem K. is a local farmer, who is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his crop.
Mrs. Long B. is a grocer who is requesting a loan to purchase additional essential ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to pick up firewood

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ana del Socorro C. M. tiene la edad de 52 años. Ana no logro finalizar sus estudios académicos, pero esto no le impidió conseguir un medio de vida para salir adelante, con los 2 hijos que tiene a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven  ya que tenía que buscar la manera de generar ingresos para su familia, y poco a poco adquirió experiencia en esta actividad y le gusto mucho el relacionarse con sus clientes y saber lo que necesitaban. Con el dinero solicitado podrá comprar pinturas de unas, estuches de pinturas de labios, ropa para niños, damas y caballeros. Su mayor sueño es establecer un negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana del Socorro C. M. is 52 years old and the mother of two children for whom she cares. She couldn't finish her academic studies, but this didn't prevent her from getting ahead in life.

Ana has a store offering general merchandise. She has been engaged in this business for more than four years. She started at a very young age since she needed an income for her family. Gradually she gained experience in her trade. She loves socializing with her customers and getting to know their needs.

Ana will use her loan to buy make-up and lipsticks as well as clothes for children, ladies and gentlemen. Her biggest dream is to have a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francisco Donato

texts.es:
el seños Francisco Donato B. es un emprendedor que se levanta a las  4:30 de la mañana para salir a cargar su producto y salir a venderlo a varios  barrios de la ciudad.
don Francisco es un padre soltero y el cuida a su hija que tiene 15 años y que la tiene estudiando.  
Francisco espera con este credito salir adelante con su negocio, el nos comento que su meta o sueño es poder comprar un terreno para poder hacer su casa despues y asi poder dejarle a su hija que es lo que mas quiere en este mundo un lugar en donde ella pueda vivir por el resto de su vida.
texts.en:
Francisco Donato B. is an entrepreneur that gets up at 4:30 in the morning to load his product and go out to sell it in various neighborhoods in the city.

Francisco is a single father and he cares for his 15 year old daughter who is studying. Francisco hopes that this loan will help his business get ahead. He has told us that his goal, or his dream is to be able to buy land to be able to build a house later. This way, he can leave it for his daughter. This is what he wants most in the world – a place where she can live for the rest of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of white bread and sweets

loans.name: Gelly

texts.en:
Gelly B. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Gelly is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gelly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Gelly has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gelly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Gelly is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gelly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: La Santa Cruz Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Santa Cruz” esta representado por la señora Olivia  y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales van cursando su primer, pero a pesar de ello han demostrado ser gente trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a actividades como la venta de pan, comida, cosméticos, refrescos con empanadas y al transporte publico de pasajeros. Pese la competencia del mercado los socios saben como salir adelante es por esta razón que requieren del crédito para poder realizar inversiones de nuevos negocios como la crianza de animales que es mucho mas rentable y para ello necesitan mucho material, insumos y herramientas para poder generar mejores ingresos para poderles brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pese a que es su primer ciclo gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital y están dispuestas a sacar adelante a sus pequeños negocios ya que de ello dependen sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “La Santa Cruz” is represented by Mrs. Olivia and it includes 14 members; they are participating in their first loan but have demonstrated to be hard-working people with a desire to get ahead in life. The majority of the members are involved in various businesses such as selling bread, food, cosmetics, refreshments with pastries, and public transportation. In spite of the market competition, the members know how to get ahead; for this reason, they are requesting a loan to invest in new businesses such as raising animals which is more profitable but requires raw material, supplies, and tools. The higher income would enable them to give their families a better quality of life. In regards to their credit history, considering this is their first loan, the members already have experience with solidarity groups and loans from other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital, and they are prepared to make their small business succeed since their families depend on it.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca D. de Ramírez tiene 51 años de edad vive con su esposo el señor Florencio Ramírez que tiene 56 años, con quien tiene tres hijos, dos ya mayores de edad, uno en edad escolar y otro cursando una carrera universitaria, viven en su casa propia donde tiene una despensa, la que formaron gracias al sacrificio de su esposo quien tenia un pequeño ahorro. 


Empezaron con el negocio en el año 2000, y desde entonces han podido llevarlo adelante con mucho esfuerzo, su esposo quien también se dedica a la agricultura, tiene una propiedad de una hectárea en donde realiza cultivos de cañas de Azúcar. 
En el año 2006, se hicieron cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya y gracias a los créditos recibidos su negocio va creciendo motivo por el cual agradece el apoyo brindado por nuestra institución. 
El préstamo que solicita es para poder surtir mas de mercaderías su negocio ya que va en aumenta clientela.

loans.use: Para compra de mercaderías: Azúcar, Arroz, Fideos, Aceite, Leche y Otros

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old and cohabiting with four children aged 3 to 9 years, all of whom go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with seven people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water.

Rose has a stall in the outskirts of Kampala where she sells plastics like cups, basins, plates and bowls. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for nine years and is servicing her twentieth loan. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home.

Rose sells to all categories of people both in retail and wholesale. She buys her plastics from factories in the Nakawa Industrial area, one of the busiest towns in Uganda, and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season as she works in an open space.

Rose wants to use this loan to buy more plastics. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow stronger and to start selling only wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more plastic articles to sell

loans.name: Emeteria

texts.en: Emeteria A. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Emeteria owns and operates a business selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Emeteria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emeteria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
K. Parviz is 25 years old, married and has two children. For the last three years Parviz has been providing transport services. As a rule, he works only in his region. At the same time, with his wife's help, he raises cattle at home, which brings his family additional income.

Currently, Parviz’s truck needs repairing. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 4,000 TJS. Parviz promises to pay the loan on time, and thanks everyone for their support.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his truck

loans.name: Sveta's Group

texts.en:
Sveta is the leader of this group. She could regard herself as the happiest person just because of where she lives. She lives in a beauty spot – Bokonbaevo village. Especially at this time of the year, the trees and fields turn gold, yellow and red. In contrast to this, you can see a multitude of carefree cattle, easily visible against this marvelous background, munching the appetizing weed.
Sveta has had a big ordeal – the death of her husband. Having reached the age of 49, she has been left with their only child, a daughter. Back when her spouse was alive, they used to raise livestock and had a pretty decent life. At that time, her husband took care of everything. After the misfortune, she had to take the initiative into her own hands and, with the help of her friends, she started to raise livestock, feed it, and sell it at the cattle market. Trading in cattle used to be her husband’s occupation; now it has also become Sveta’s way of life.
Five years ago, Sveta invested $230 USD in purchasing cattle, and she has achieved considerable success in this business. On average, she makes $140 USD a month – a stable income, which is 60 per cent of her initial investment. Sveta is eager to expand her trade. She has applied for this loan to enable her to purchase more cattle for subsequent resale. One of her plans for the near future is to buy a two-chamber fridge.

Sveta’s group partners:
Tilek, 58, is a widow. She has four grandchildren. She raises livestock, and needs a loan to purchase cattle.
Erkimbek, 43, has three children. To provide for his family, Erkimbek raises cattle and works as a taxi driver. He needs a loan to purchase hay.
Salyi, 57, is divorced. She trades in cattle, and her only son, 33, helps her in this business. She hopes to obtain this loan to buy cattle.
Nurlan, 46, is a father of three children. He works for the government and combines this work with animal husbandry. He needs a loan to buy cattle.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.
To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for resale

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la  compra y venta de cereales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años atrás y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de todos los productos como: chuño, cebada, arvejas.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que comprarà todos los productos necesarios para navidad.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener una casa en Yunguyo y Tacna.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “San Juan” cooperative bank, in the district and province of Yunguyo of Puno. She is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. She did not complete her primary school education, and dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of cereals. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 9 years, and used her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles to buy: potato flour, barley and peas. She will request a loan of 1,500.00 soles to buy the necessary products for the Christmas holidays. Her wish for the future is to have a house in Yunguyo and Tacna. What she enjoys most about belonging to a cooperative bank are the savings and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy panetones (fruit cakes), milk and chocolate.

loans.name: Manuel Ismael

texts.es: Manuel tiene 28 años de edad, es casado vive con su esposa y su hijo. Manuel vive en casa de sus padres, El adquirió su vehiculo con ahorros obtenidos de varios años trabajando como obrero de campo,junto a su esposa. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda. Manuel sueña con tener con tener su casa propia y así brindarle bienestar a su familia. Manuel destina todos los ingresos que obtiene brindando el servicio a la educación de su hijo, el cual se encuentra en edad escolar. Manuel desea que su hijo pueda tener una buena educación. El solicita el crédito para realizarle mantenimiento a su vehículo ( mototaxi, para si poder tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 28 years old. He lives with his wife and son in the home of his parents. Manuel acquired a vehicle with the savings he accumulated while working several years with his wife as a farm laborer. He now has extensive experience providing transportation services. Manuel has dreams of owning a home and providing for the welfare of his family. All of his earnings will go toward his son’s schooling since he desires for him to have a good education. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi so that he can continue to generate a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina S. is from the village of Barangay Dos. She is 55 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Cristina owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. She is also engaged in selling snacks in the local community. In 2006, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies and as additional capital for her snack-selling business. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.  About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies and to use as additional capital for her snack-selling business

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 24 años, es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en la casa de sus familiares y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

En la comodidad de su hogar, donde implementó su pequeño taller textil, elabora las gorras más coloridas y llamativas del mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca).
Todas las mañanas inicia su actividad diaria y con mucho arte le da forma a los distintos materiales que usa, para convertirlos en las gorras que confecciona. Los fines de semana se da tiempo para distribuir sus gorras entre las vendedoras del mercado, donde ella también tiene su puesto y aprovecha para vender.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que realizar los acabados a sus gorras, ya que es muy detallista. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda muy grande, donde pueda vender sus gorras con más tranquilidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Mariela con MFP y tiene pensado acceder a otros más, por lo cual quiere pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal donde es muy querida, ya que es muy responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más materiales para elaborar nuevas gorras.
texts.en:
Mariela, 24, is a cheerful and unassuming young woman; she lives with her family and her greatest desire is to succeed in life. She set up a small, textile workshop in the comfort of her home. She manufactures the most colorful and eye-catching caps in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She starts her work day very early in the morning and she infuses her items with much art and imagination in the use of the various materials in order to convert them into the caps she makes. On weekends, she takes time to distribute her caps among the sellers in the market, where she also has her own sales stall. What she likes most about her work is weaving, something she does quite ably. She has been in this line of work for 4 years and considers the most difficult part of her job having to create the finishings for her caps because she is very detail oriented. For later on, she would like to have a larger store where she can sell her caps more comfortably. This is Mariela's second loan with MFP and she plans to apply for others. For this reason, she wants to repay in a timely fashion and not create problems for her communal bank, where she is a well-liked member, because she is very responsible. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy supplies to make new caps.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es: Johana es una mujer muy popular, por lo que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, con Fundación León 2000 por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos necesarios de su familia. Este financiamiento que está solicitando es para comprar cosméticos como perfumes, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, cremas y otros productos. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de laborar con este negocio, pues todo el tiempo se ha sacrificado por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El deseo de ella mantener activo su negocio que es el único medio de vida que tiene.
texts.en:
Johana is a very popular woman who is always looking for a way to get ahead in life. This is not the first time she obtains microloans through Fundación León 2000 as she has always been concerned with improving the family income. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase cosmetics like fragrances, nail polish, lipsticks, lotions, and other beauty products. She has been in business for a long time, sacrificing a lot in order to improve her living conditions. Her desire is to keep her business afloat since it is her sole means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Florenda H. is a mother to seven children. She is married and lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She has been involved in rice farming for almost nine years now. According to her, failure was not absent in her years of farming. But, together with her husband, she continues to work hard to be able to provide for her family's needs.

Florenda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which she said she would use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs and also to pay the laborers who help at her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Tsolmontsog

texts.en:
Tsolmontsog is 33 years old and lives with his wife and son in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife, Amarjargal, is a music teacher in a local secondary school and her salary is  220,000 tugrugs (~ 155 USD). 

Tsolmontsog operates a transportation business in his home province, and transports customers between Uvs province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Tsolmontsog has been operating his business since 2003, and has been trading products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, for the local customers. He has been planning to work hard and purchase a new micro bus for his business in the future. 

Tsolmontsog is a friendly person who has great communication skills. He says, “I would like to purchase a brand new micro bus so I will have a total of three micro buses for my transportation business. ” Tsolmontsog is requesting a 2,000,000  tugrug loan to purchase more inventory from Ereen and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina  es una mujer muy responsable, que ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente con Fundación, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Ella se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de costura, hace mas de de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo que siempre le ha gustado mantener a sus hijos ya que ha demostrado que puede salir adelante a pesar de ser una madre soltera, ella inicio este negocio aplicando sus conocimientos y elaborando prendas de vestir que le encargaban. Ella se levanta muy temprano para elaborar los encargos que pendientes de sus clientes, pues gana mucha fama por la responsabilidad de la entrega de las prendas de vestir. Ella solicita este préstamo para la compra de tela, hilo, botones, encajes, agujas y tijeras. Sueña con obtener un taller muy grande en donde fuentes de empleo.
texts.en:
Martina is a very responsible woman, and she has shown that she is an excellent client with Fundación. This is not her first time with a loan. She offers seamstress services. She has been doing this for over 11 years. She has always liked supporting her children. She has shown that she can get ahead in spite of being a single mother. She started her business by applying her knowledge and making articles of clothing that were ordered. She gets up very early to make her customers’ pending orders. She has become well know because of how responsible she is about delivering the clothing. She is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, lace, needles, and scissors. She dreams of having a very large shop where she can be a source of employment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more Garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: San Martin De Umanes Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE UMANES”; Nuestros socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Iscuchaka provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. GREGORIA,  Nuestra socia tiene 53 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,  Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende productos agrícolas, su conyugue es agricultor y siembran papa, maíz, hortalizas, trigo, cebada, Nuestra socia también tiene animales vacunos y animales menores (aves de corral y chanchos), Nuestra socia vende los productos algunas veces en Quillabamaba en esta provincia netamente productora de frutas el producto de la socia es muy rentable. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y llevar sus productos a la provincia de Quillabamba.

Los socios alternan sus actividades con el comercio minorista ellos venden artesanías, ganados, animales menores, venta de chicha, de venta de productos agrícolas, Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los socios  agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partners belong to the communal bank "San Martin de Umanes". They live in the city of Cusco, in the Iscuchaka district, Anta province, and department of Cusco. One of the partners, Gregoria, is 53 years old, a live-in partner, and has one son. She alternates between her domestic chores and retail trade, buying and selling agricultural products. Her husband is a farmer, and they plant potatoes, corn, vegetables, wheat, and barley. Also, Gregoria has livestock, such as cows, chickens, and pigs. Occasionally, she sells her products in Quillabamba, where they primarily produce fruits, and her products are very profitable here. She is requesting this loan to travel and take her products to the province of Quillabamba. The other partners carry out various activities in retail trade, such as selling handicrafts, livestock, maize liquor, and agricultural products. They are requesting this loan to reinvest in their different businesses.
