They are grateful for and value the support provided to them through this medium, and they are committed to repaying their debts in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To travel and take her products to the province of Quillabamba

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
“Por 15 años participó en el banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua”

Florencia pertenece al banco comunal “Mateo Pumacahua” de la Asociación Arariwa, es natural de la ciudad Chinchero, tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos.  Actualmente, Victoria cuenta con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en vender comestibles en su tienda para lo cual a inicio se le hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se presentó la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal y por primera vez se prestó 100 dólares hace 15 años. Su actividad económica complementaria es vender chicha, cerveza y gaseosas los días domingos en la feria dominical. 

Florencia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario sacar adelante a sus familiares. Ahora, que su negocio va creciendo  y cuenta con un capital, ella requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar 120 kilos de maíz pues cada kilo cuesta 2.20 soles.  El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos. 

Florencia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
“She has participated in the Mateo Pumacahua cooperative bank for 15 years”. Florencia belongs to the “Mateo “Pumacahua” cooperative bank of the Arariwa Association. She is from the city of Chinchero, 52 years old, married, and has three children. Currently, Victoria has a small business selling food items in her store. She started the business because things were a bit difficult and she didn’t have much money. The opportunity presented itself to join the cooperative bank, and she received her first loan of $100 dollars 15 years ago. As a complement to her enterprise, she also sells chicha, beer and sodas at the Sunday market. Florencia is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person who is always looking for ways to get ahead. With the effort she puts in each and every day, she is able to help support her family. Now that her business is growing and is generating some income, she needs a loan to augment her working capital. She wants to buy 120 kilos of corn, and each kilo costs 2.20 Peruvian soles. The wish of this member is to help her children become professionals. Florencia is very grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium, and concurrently commits to fulfilling her loan installment payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Florencia requires the loan to buy 120 kilos of corn.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 56 años, vive con su hija en su casa que es propia. Desde muy pequeña observo como se realizaban  las tareas agrícolas,  y luego  decidió que esta seria la mejor manera de  generarse ingresos. En la actualidad se dedica a la agricultura, siembra productos de su zona como papa, maíz, trigo, alverja, cebolla entre otros. Luego vende su cosecha, al por mayor o la lleva  al mercado, y obtiene regulares ganancias. Su hija siempre le ayuda en su labor  y en todo lo que se requiera para la siembra y cosecha, también  contrata a peones para los que le ayuden en las faenas agrícolas. 

Paralelamente se dedica a la  crianza de  animales que compra y vende todos los fines de semana en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene, para que su capital sea mayor. Es la  segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y promete que será muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Gloria tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono, para sus cultivos y también comprará 2 toros pequeños.
texts.en:
Gloria, 56, lives with her daughter in their own home. She has done farm chores since she was very young, and later she decided that this would be the best way to generate an income. She now farms, sowing local products such as potatoes, corn, wheat, peas, and onion among others. Later she sells her harvest wholesale or brings it to the market, and obtains a regular income. Her daughter always helps her with her work, and with everything that is needed for sowing and harvesting. She also hires laborers to help her with the farm work. She also raises animals which she buys and sells every weekend at the livestock fair in her area. Gloria plans to increase the quantity of animals she has, so that she will have more capital. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. She also thanks everyone who are making this loan possible; it will be very useful in the progress of her business. Gloria plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of various bags of fertilizer, for her crops, and she will also buy 2 small bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fertilizer and 2 small bulls

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ly Y. is 40 years old. She is one of four people located in Pring village in Takeo province who are together seeking a group loan. The group selected Mrs. Ly Y. as their leader. With the loans, the group members hope to increase their income to support their family's daily financial needs. Mrs. Ly Y. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She does not have enough money to pay for all of her farming expenses, so she has decided to ask for a loan to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. She also intends to use the loan to buy piglets for breeding. Her husband, Sokhorn C., is a teacher in the local school where he receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To have farm plowed and to buy piglets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old woman from Lebanon. After the death of her husband, she found herself alone and responsible for two children. So she decided to take charge of the operation of her husband's mini-market. She has been working hard to pay her family's expenses. She offers all types of products: food products, cereals, soft drinks, detergents, etc. The mini-market has been established for almost sixteen years and it is known by a good number of clients. She is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory. She hopes that the variety of products presented to her clients will continue to earn profit for her family.

It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets, selling both perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships are an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese micro-finance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in micro-finance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 46 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Dese hace 5 años, se dedica a la preparación de chicharrones y caldos de gallina, que son platillos que tiene mucha demanda en el Perú. Es así que atiende todos los días desde su casa o de manera delivery a diversos puntos de la zona en la que vive. Sus clientes potenciales, son los policías de la comisaría  y aquellos que tienen algún comercio cerca de su casa y ante tanta afluencia de gente, termina por vender todo antes del medio día. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que  lo realiza; tan solo por las mañanas y el resto del día se dedica a sus hijos. Para más adelante piensa ampliar su negocio, y para lograrlo seguirá trabajando como hasta ahora con el fin de brindar una calidad de vida saludable a sus hijos. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y  se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Alejandrina  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, en la compra de un juego de ollas, cubiertos y platos en  general, y de esa manera seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 46 years old and lives in her own home, together with with her husband and their two children. For the last 5 years, she has made chicharrones [fried pork rinds] and caldos de gallina [chicken soup], dishes that are very popular in Peru. She sells them everyday, from her house or by delivery to various points in the area where she lives. Her potential customers are policemen at the police station and people who own shops near her house. With such an influx of people, she ends up selling everything by midday. Her favorite thing about her work is that she only does it in the mornings, and is able to dedicate the rest of the day to her children. In the future, she is thinking about expanding her business. In order to achieve this, she will continue working as she always has, with the goal of providing her children with a healthy quality of life. This is her tenth loan with Microfinanzas Peru and she promises to make all of her repayments on time. Alejandrina is planning to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a set of pots, covers, and plates in general, so that she can continue serving her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a set of pots, covers, and plates

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin B. is from the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 35 years old. Edwin is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Edwin operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing horse-drawn cart services to local community members. Edwin has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Edwin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP for the repair and maintenance of the push cart used in the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Edwin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the repair and maintenance of the push cart used in the business

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia María V. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene 24 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el fin de resolver necesidades económicas en su familia
texts.en:
Silvia María V. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. She works as an elementary school teacher in the Simeón Pereira school in the municipality of El Sauce where she has been for 24 years. This is the first loan that is requesting at CEPRODEL with the objective of settling economic needs in her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Consumption

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia B. is a married woman who lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing and selling dried fish. Her husband, Artemio B., who is 70 years old, also works as a fisherman. They have five adult children. 

Cornelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cornelia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for future business improvements and home repairs. 

Cornelia B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF. In a world full of challenges Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita J. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three businesses: fishing, buying and selling charcoal, and running a general store. She lives in Prk. Catlagan, Brgy. Basak, Cauayan, Negros Occidental and has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004. She has done an outstanding job of using loans from NWTF to improve her life and make her family more stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. In order to improve her fishing business, she is applying for a new loan, her 14th, for PHP 29,500. Her goal is to continue elevating her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon (or honorable) way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to expand her fishing business

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Upendo A. is in her mid thirties and is married with three children. Over the past year she has been running her own charcoal business. The business is open between 8 am and 6:30 pm daily and earns Upendo a small monthly profit.

This will be Upendo's 1st loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She aims to use the loan to increase her stock of charcoal so she can meet the increasing demand for her product. Upendo's dream is to one day open up her own shop from which she can sell the charcoal.

Upendo will share this loan with her loan group Mbogo, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Upendo is seen on the far left in the middle row.

loans.use: To increase the stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
La Señora Zenaida M. M.,  inicia con pequeña cantidad ambulante, con un capital de C$ 5,000.00 producto de ahorros y aporte de su esposo. La señora M. viaja muy temprano de la casa de habitación ubicada en la comarca de Larreynaga hacia el mercado la terminal para proceder a la venta de su producto cuyas labores finaliza a las 12 pm.
Este crédito fue utilizado para  compra de productos como Zinc y Golosos para la mejora de vivienda.
La señora M. se siente muy satisfecha y agradecía con los créditos que CEPRODEL le ha podido brindar ya que ha mejorado su calidad de vida e iniciar el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Zenaida M. M. began with a small amount of traveling with $5,000 Nicaraguan cordobas that she saved and support from her husband.  She travels very early from her home, located in the Larreynaga region, to the market to sell their products, which closes at 12pm.  

She will use this loan to purchase products like zinc sheeting and screws to improve her home.  

She feels very satisfied and thankful for her loans from CEPRODEL, which have allowed her to improve her quality of life and begin improving her home.

loans.use: Purchase zinc sheeting and screws

loans.name: Gilma Rubenia

texts.es:
La Sra. Gilma R. tiene más de un año de dedicarse al comercio y su principal actividad es la venta de abarrotería, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de “Belem” además de dedicarse a la venta de abarrotaría también se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos.
Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, y aqui no tiene competencia cerca de su negocio.
Su negocio luce surtido y los clientes encuentran en el mismo lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, Arroz, Jabones, Manteca, refrescos, huevos, café, espaguetis, carnes, lácteos, etc…
Doña Gilma vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar se dedica a la Agricultura ya que esta zona es la de mas producción por estar ubicado en el valle de jamastran que en años anteriores se le llamo el granero de Centro América.
Del matrimonio han procreado tres hijos dos de ellos están cursando sus estudios primarios y una bebe que esta al cuidado de la sra. Gilma.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio y asi tener mayores ventas, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs Gilma R. has been in business for more than one year and her main activity is selling groceries.  Her business operates under the name “Belem”.  As well as selling groceries, she also sells new clothes and shoes.  Her business is located in her home and she doesn't have any competition nearby.

Her business is well stocked and her customers find what they most need every day such as sugar, rice, soap, butter, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, spaghetti, meat, dairy products, etc...

Doña Gilma lives with her common-law husband who is a farmer since the district in which they live is the most productive in the country as it is located in Jamastran valley which used to be called the granary of Central America.

They have three children from their marriage.  Two of them are in elementary school and the other is a baby who Gilma cares for.

Gilma will use her loan to buy merchandise to better stock her business.  She will thereby have better sales and the profits she needs to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: To buy deodorants, soap, shampoo, conditioners, thread, sanitary towels, toothpaste, toothbrushes, candles, hairpins, hairbands, zips, soups, sugar, rice, butter, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, spaghetti, meat and dairy products

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela lives in Khanewal which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area called Ahmed Nagar in a two-room brick house for the past 24 years. 

She is married to M. R. who runs a grocery store business. He has a small grocery store in the market from where he sells daily use items soaps, toothpaste, sugar, tea, etc. to his customers. He started this business many years ago and improves the financial condition of his family through this store.  

Jameela has 3 daughters and 2 sons. All of them are enrolled in school and are getting their education except the eldest one who helps his father in his business. He didn’t have any interest in studies and left school after completing the 8th class. 

Jameela herself is a housewife, stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity and increase his sales. Jameela is hopeful that a loan investment will have a good impact on her husband’s business and makes it more profitable. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Jameela.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Mercedes Ivania

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes Ivania de 46 años de edad vive con su esposo que tiene un salario fijo el cual la ayuda con los gastos del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos ella trabaja como coordinadora de EGB en el Ministerio de educacion devengando un salario mensual desde hace 25 años desempeñandose con mucha responsabilidad. 

Solicita su 11vo. crèdito para pintar y areglar la cocina.  
Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca bien unida y que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mercedes Ivania is 46 years old and lives with her husband, who has a fixed income that helps with household expenses and commitments.  She works as a coordinator of Primary Education in the Ministry of Education, earning a monthly salary for the last 25 years.  She has carried out her work with great responsibility.

She is requesting her 11th loan to paint and fix up her kitchen.  Her biggest dream in life is that her family remains united and that her children study to become good citizens.

loans.use: Painting and plastering the kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas T., 54, sells Cambodian noodles and fermented fish, earning an income of USD 2 per day. T. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. The family has to spend USD 18 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month. T. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more supplements to sell food to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more supplements to sell food

loans.name: Tukhtasun

texts.en:
Tukhtasun is a young married man. He has owned a small grocery store in Dushanbe, Tajikistan for 5 years. His experience helps him run this business well. The store is open 24 hours a day and offers all kinds of food to its customers. Tukhtasun offers only good and fresh products and is always looking for more ways to improve client service. Tukhtasun would like to borrow 7,000 TJS to increase his assortment of products. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his living conditions. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Eva Tomasa

texts.es: Eva tiene cuarenta y un año, casada, cuenta con 2 hijas  y con el apoyo de su esposo Carlos han logrado salir adelante ya que los dos se dedican al tejido de fajas típicas. Eva tiene 23 años de experiencia  y por esa razón esta solicitando su primer préstamo es un apersona muy responsable y necesita esta ayuda para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Eva is 40 years old.  She is married and has two children.  With the help of her husband, they have managed to get ahead.  They both weave typical skirts.  Eva has been doing this for 23 years, so she is asking for her first loan.  She is a very responsible person and needs this help to invest in her business.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 27 años de edad, reside en Arambala departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, vive en compañía de su esposa y una hija de 3 meses de edad, donde residen es propiedad de un tío, ahí tiene el negocio desde hace un año, lo atiende a tiempo completo y es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería ya que quiere incrementar el negocio comprando granos básicos, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite, café, sal, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a recibir mejores ingresos para seguir reinvirtiendo en el negocio, dándole un mejor funcionamiento y mejores ganancias para su familia.
El sueño de Oscar es construir su propia casa, es por eso que trabaja diariamente para algún día lograrlo.
texts.en:
Oscar is 27 years old and resides in Arambala in the Department of Morazán. He lives on his uncle’s property with his wife and three month old daughter. Oscar has been selling basic necessities for one year. He manages his business full-time since he relies on this source of income.

Oscar is requesting a loan to buy merchandise so that he can increase his business. He will buy basic grains, sugar, beans, rice, oil, coffee, salt, and other items. This investment will help him generate better earnings so that he can reinvest into his business. As a result, his store will function better and produce more income for his family.

Oscar dreams of building his own house. He will continue working until the he is able to achieve his goal some day.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, sugar, beans, rice, oil, coffee, salt, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional rice, oil, sugar and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some tools for his shop and make his work easier

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr:
Née le 22 mai 1982 à Bamako, Kadidiatou C. est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Kamalen Sirakoro, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso.
Kadidiatou C. mène cette activité d’achat et vente de bois de chauffe il y a environ trois ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en saison d’hivernage, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle décida il y environ une année de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle sollicite ce premier crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 5 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso. Elle vend les bois de chauffe à domicile, en détail et au comptant. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour  réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on May 22, 1982 in Bamako, Ms. Kadidiatou C. is a married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their children in Kamalen Sirakoro, an outlying district of Sikasso City. Kadidiatou has been running this business buying and selling firewood for about three years. She enjoys a great reputation in this business and receives many orders, especially during the off-season. 

But her resources cannot allow her to meet the demand. Thus, about a year ago, she decided to collaborate with the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is now requesting this initial loan enabling her to increase her business capital for buying 5 cart loads of firewood from towns surrounding Sikasso City. Accepting cash or credit, she sells the firewood at her house.

With this loan, Kadidiatou envisions making a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering most of her costs, helping with family expenses, and paying the loan interest. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Sarwari's Group

texts.en:
Sarwari belongs to Jaranwala which is a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 20 years. She is 37 years old, married to M. A. and has six children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

M. A. does a private job. After his day job, he operates a fruit selling business. He is a very hard-working person and got a good reputation among his clients for the good quality of his fruit and services. 

Sarwari has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell.  He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Sarwari is hopeful that an investment will be a good step towards the positive growth of his business. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application with Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sarwari.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for fruit selling business.

loans.name: Lloyd

texts.en:
Lloyd is 26 years old and is still single. He tills a piece of land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, where he grows rice crops. He also raises pigs for fattening and sale.   Lloyd sells his harvests and pigs at the market.

Lloyd works hard to improve his farm and small piggery. He is saving for his future family. Lloyd is planning to use his loan to purchase pig feed and farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and farm inputs

loans.name: Dorolea

texts.en:
Dorolea L. is from the village of Bolison, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Dorolea is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Dorolea owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like "katambak", "lapu-lapu" & "magmocat" in the local community. Dorolea has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Dorolea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorolea is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like sardines & milk fish. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Dorolea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like sardines & milk fish.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, age 43, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Mao sells palm products, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Mao has had this business. Mao is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase wood to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood to repair the house

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is a hardworking man. He is married and has 3 children. For 20 years he has been running his cafe. Naimjon has his own national cafe called "Chaikhana."  In his cafe he cooks different tasty foods. In 2002 he had a small cafe but today he has increased size. He is going to receive the second loan from Imon International. For this purpose Naimjon has requested a loan of 3,000 $ USD for expansion of his business. From the profit which he hopes to make he would like to provide better living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to expand his business and increase working capital.

loans.name: Ritah's Group

texts.en:
Ritah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Ritah has a business selling food like matooke (steamed plantain), which she has run two years.
To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ritah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself and for her young brother. In the future, she hopes to open up a hardware shop.
Ritah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business, which has, in turn, helped her pay her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Mackellas

texts.en:
Mackellas is 39 years old. He is a hardworking and diligent businessman. He is married and blessed with three children, ages 6, 3 and 10 months.  He has been selling sugarcane for the last 11 years.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to learn how to save and expand his business.  He supplements this income by cultivating traditional vegetables and selling them. Previously, he worked as a casual laborer. 

He hopes to have a well-established business selling clothes in the future. He has requested  20,000 Kenyan shillings to start a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes

loans.name: La Fatima Group

texts.es:
La Fatima se forma con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santani, actualmente cuenta con 11 integrantes. Ellas se definen como mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras, todas manifiestan estan muy a gusto trabajando dentro del programa.
Ellas trabajan en un ambiente de cooperación y solidaridad. Se unieron con el propósito de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo conjunto realizado por ellas.
La Sra. Maria tiene un almacen hace ya varios años, todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas para abrir su negocio, ya que desde temprano vienen los clientes. Ella manifiesta que gracias a los años que lleva en el negocio, ha logrado tener muchos clientes, lo cual le genera buenos ingresos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas, para el abastecimiento del almacén.
texts.en:
“La Fatima” is the name of a group of several neighbors from the city of Santani. There are currently 11 members. They define themselves as determined and hardworking women. All of them say that they like working with the program. Every one of these members works in a spirit of cooperation and solidarity. They have gathered together with the goal of helping their families through the work they pursue.

Sra. Maria has managed a store for several years. She wakes up very early every day to open her business because she has customers who come early to shop. Maria says that thanks to the many years she has been in business, she has been able to acquire many customers and generate good income.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy food products, beverages, and vegetables to restock her store.

loans.use: to purchase  food products, beverages, and vegetables.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 36 years old. She is married and has 2 children. 

Brenda has a shop that sells frozen foods, like hotdogs & sausage. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old and married.  She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been farming vegetables for 2 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 3 times in the past to sustain her business.

Evelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Yormahmad

texts.ru:
Ёрмахмад 54 года, живет со своей женой и у них 4 взрослых детей. Он всегда хотел улучшить свои жилищные условия. Ёрмахмад занимается фермерством в течение 12 лет. Он начал этот вид бизнеса самостоятельно. Ёрмахмад желает иметь возможность диверсифицировать свой урожай. С помощью займа он будет купить семена и разные удобрения для получения более качественного урожая и продать их по более выгодной цене. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Yormahmad is 54 years old, lives with his family and has four grown children.  He has always wanted to improve his living conditions.  Yormahmad has been involved in agriculture for 12 years.  He started this business on his own.  Yormahmad wishes to have the ability to diversify his harvest.  With the help of this loan, he will buy seeds and various fertilizers to obtain a quality harvest and sells it at a more profitable price.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Married to a fireman and coach, Juliana sells "minerals" (soft drinks) at Akotokyir near Abura. Juliana has received senior high education. She has been in this business for five years and has five children. She assists her husband to provide the basic needs of the home such as food and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to retail. She anticipates reinvesting the increase back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to retail.

loans.name: Elgiz

texts.en:
Elgiz raises animals in order to generate revenue from the animals and the products they provide. Elgiz has earned a living from raising cattle for five years. He's married and has 2 children who, according to Elgiz’s words, are his reason for living. It should be said that the low incomes available to people in this rural area aren't enough to maintain a family and, for this reason, Elgiz works enormously hard to provide a better standard of living for his wife and children. 

Elgiz needs to buy animals such as cattle. He's applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and fodder.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jonalyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jonalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jonalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 36 years old, married, and has two sons. She lives with her husband and sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by repairing sewing machines.

For nearly 12 years, Anh has run a general store in front of her house. She sells beverages, instant food, and household necessities to the local community.   She now intends to get a loan to buy a larger range and quantity of products in bulk for her general store. She hopes that through the loan she will be abL. to increase her income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: buy products to sell

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en: Rakia is married and has four children. Rakia cooks "wakye"  (a dish composed of cooked beans and rice) at Abura, which she has done for 20 years. Her husband is a farmer. Rakia will use the loan to purchase rice and beans to cook to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rakia plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William was born in Isabela and has been a farmer for many years. He is not married but lives in partnership with Ravelin who is a housewife. He lives and works on his land some ten kilometers from the town of Ilagan. He works in agriculture growing corn.

 William is asking for a loan of P 15,000 to purchase corn seed and fertilizer so that his harvest will be good. In this area there is no drinking water and life is difficult as they have to bring the water from distant places or draw it from wells. He has seen the necessity of building a water tank. 

In the future, William hopes that his business will expand so he can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a thirty-one-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He deals in textiles. He started with 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX), which he saved from his salary, and he now has 2,000,000 UGX as his working capital. Price fluctuations, taxes, and transport costs hinder his business. 

Jimmy wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business dream is to diversify and expand into new markets.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is a 21 year old married woman with one child who is not in school. For two years, she has had a business selling groundnuts (peanuts) in Kator, South Sudan.

Silva requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts. she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts (peanuts) for sale.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 48 years old and married with 5 children, with 1 child in school. Concepcion works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion runs a Variety Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 

Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Evergreen Ladies Group

texts.en: This is 29 year-old Letween from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe . She is single with one child. She also cares for one dependent who is still going to school. Letween runs a services business of tailoring ladies' wear. The business has been in operation for seven years. She says the main challenges faced are competition and the market as the market is becoming crowded. Letween has requested a loan of $400.00 in order to buy tailoring materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to be able to complete the building of her house allocated by the local Authority. In the future, Letween plans to own a tailoring factory with industrial machines.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok is 35-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For four years, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan. 

Ajok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell.

loans.name: Salomón Antonio

texts.es: Salomón Antonio de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida; él se dedica a la venta de minutas de todos los sabores fresa, tamarindo, piña, menta, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en este negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa en las ventas; comercia de forma ambulante en diferentes zonas de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; Salomón es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante desea aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presenten para así poder alcanzar el éxito;  una de sus más grandes metas es hacer crecer su negocio pero necesita de capital para la compra de insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar jarabes de sabores, leche, tamarindo, vasos, cucharas, etc. Salomón Antonio es muy responsable y con capacidad de pago tiene la certeza que cancelara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia la vida que se merecen.

loans.use: jarabes de sabores, leche, tamarindo, vasos, cucharas

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia nació en la provincia de La Convención pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 43 años de edad es soltera, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosita de Lima” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es la distribución de productos energéticos como por ejemplo Red Bull, Burn, Maltin Power y entre otros. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos energéticos. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member was born in the province of La Convención but she lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco.  She is 43 years old and single. She belongs to the communal bank “Santa Rosita de Lima” which belongs to the Asociación Arariwa.

Her main business activity is the distribution of energy products such as Red Bull, Burn, Maltin Power and others. She has been involved in this business for two years and it is going very well. On this occasion, Maribel needs the loan to purchase more energy products. Maribel is grateful to those who, by means of these funds, enable her to fulfil her aspirations, and she promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy more energy products.

loans.name: Mayita Tatiana

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Tiene 11 años laborando en este negocio, debido a que desde siempre le ha gustado la costura.  Trabaja todos los días y cuando tiene mucho por hacer, su hija le ayuda con sus labores.  Al momento está separada del papá de sus hijas.  Tiene 4 hijas, la mayor es casada y las demás tienen 17, 15 y 14 años.  La segunda hija va a la universidad y las otras 2 asisten a la escuela fiscal de su sector.  A futuro le gustaría que su taller de costura sea más grande, expandirse más y ser reconocida; asimismo, desea que sus hijas puedan desarrollarse profesionalmente.  Ahora necesita invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de telas, hilos y demás artículos de costura.
texts.en: This client lives in the city of Portoviejo.  She’s been working in this business for 11 years because she’s always liked to sew.  She works every day and when she has much work to do her daughter helps her with the work.  At the moment she’s separated from her daughters’ father.  She has four daughters.  The oldest is married and the others are 17, 15 and 14 years old.  The second one attends university and the other two the local public school.  In future she’d like to have a larger sewing workshop, to expand more and to become well-known.  Also, she wants her daughters to develop professionally.  She needs to use the loan money  to buy fabric, thread and other sewing supplies.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 47-year-old year old married man with eight children all attending different schools. He is a farmer who works five days a week and six hours a day. He is motivated by the profitability of the business.

He is also a cattle trader. From this business, he gets additional income to support his family and has been in this business since 1993. He usually sells his agricultural products to fellow traders in Kalisizo and Bulinda trading centre and surrounding areas. He hopes to use the loan acquired to buy more cows for fattening. However, he faces a challenge of untrustworthy customers who take goods on credit and delay payments.

He is described as a hardworking and honest man and is appreciative of the services offered.  He is hardworking and optimistic that his business will boom in the long run.

loans.use: To buy baby cows that he will fatten and later sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a young student that is studying engineering. She sells make-up to her community and her fellow students in order to finance her education. Her parents are also microentrepreneurs but they have very modest businesses and they do not make enough to cover all of Daisy’s costs. She started this business with only $100 of her own savings. After a year she has done well and has also begun to sell women’s clothing.

She is seeking a loan because she wants to further invest in her business. She is a good saleswoman and sees that she could sell more if she could afford to buy larger quantities of her product. Her goal is to be self sufficient and attain her college degree.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and women\\\'s clothing in bulk

loans.name: Suluama

texts.en:
Suluama lives in the village of Faleasiu, where she was born and raised, with her husband and five children, four of which are in school and one is a one year-old baby.

She has always dreamed of having a business of her own, and her dream has now come true with the help of the SPBDF.  She believes that her business will grow in the future by satisfying her customers by providing them with the best service and products.

Suluama is assisted by her husband and two brothers who help her run business by planting cabbages, tomatoes and pumpkins, and by weeding and picking up small stones.

She is applying for a loan of $900 in order to purchase piglets and repair their pigpens.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, and improve the pigpens

loans.name: Celina Amador

texts.en:
I have been making and selling tortillas for four years. I have two school-aged children. My best customers are my neighbors.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Mi negocio es la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años. tengo dos hijos en edad escolar y mis mejores clientes son mis vecinos de la comunidad

loans.use: To buy corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 40 years old and is married to Victor, who is 44 years old. They have 1 daughter who is 15 years old and studies in the national school in their area. We are told that their daughter is one of the best pupils in the school and she always fills them with priD. and happiness. The family live in a rural area 45 km from the city of Encarnación. They produce fruits and salad vegetables. Their production system is manual and her husband has 3 helpers who care for the products like lettuce, cabbage, tomatoes, beans, mandioca (a popular Paraguayan root) and fruits such as oranges, mandarins, lemons and bananas. Margarita is the one who sells these products in the central market of Encarnación on Thursday, Friday and Saturday every week. They would like a loan to enlarge their production area so that they can meet the increase in demand for their products in the market. The money will be invested in seeds and products of the care of lettuces, onions and potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Margarita tiene 40 años D. edad y está casada con el Sr. Víctor D. 44 años, tienen una hija D. 15 años, quien estudia en el colegio nacional D. la zona, ella nos cuenta que su hija es una D. las mejores alumnas D. su colegio y siempre les llena D. orgullo y alegría. La familia vive en un área rural distante a 45 km D. la ciudad D. Encarnación, se dedican a la producción D. frutas y hortalizas en general. Su sistema D. producción es manual, su esposo con tres ayudantes se encargan del cuidado D. los cultivos, como ser: lechugas, repollos, tomates, zapallos, choclos, locotes (morrones), porotos, mandioca (raíz muy consumida en el Paraguay), y frutas como: naranjas, mandarinas, limones y bananas. La Sra. Margarita es la encargada D. comercializar la producción en la feria municipal D. la ciudad D. Encarnación, los días jueves, viernes y sábados D. todas las semanas. Solicita el crédito para ampliación D. su área D. cultivo, debido al aumento D. las demandas D. sus productos en la feria, el dinero será invertido en la compra D. semillas e insumos para el cultivo D. D. lechugas, cebollas, papa y choclos.

loans.use: To buy seed and ingredients for planting lettuce, onions etc/Compra de semillas e insumos para plantación de lechugas, cebollas y choclos.

loans.name: Olga Elias

texts.pt:
Olga is married, currently separated. She has 4 children, who are all in school. She used to be a Bank clerk. She now works in a security company and owns a small store where she sells basic products. Olga’s husband left her and moved to the north region. She is requesting this loan in order to increase the stock of her small store. Olga’s children are all in school, and she is working hard to support them after her husband left. She has been able to repay the loans she requested before and invest in her small business.

She joined the Women Development Funds in 2005. She has been able to improve her home. Olga is also very good at managing her business and has been making payments in a timely manner.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga e casada mas de momento esta separada do marido. Ela tem 4 filhos e todos estao a estudar. Outrora ela foi funcionaria de um banco Comercial. Agora trabalha numa empresa de Seguranca. Ela tem uma pequena loja onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. O marido abandonou-lhe e foi radicar-se na zona norte do Pais.. Ela quer tomar este emprestimo para adquirir mais produtos paraa sua lojinha que se situa num dos bairros limitrofes da cidade.. Todos os seus filhos estao a estudar e ela consegue sustenta-los apesar de o marido ter-lhe abandonado. Ela conseguiu pagar dividas que ele tinha contraido e ainda conseguiu fundos para aplicar na lojinha.

Ela entrou para o Programa de credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2005. Ela tem uma casa melhorada e consegue gerir muito bem o seu negocio. Ela paga pontualmente as suas dividas.

loans.use: Olga is requesting a loan to purchase products for her grocery store

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza is a young mother who lives in a little dwelling with her baby and her beloved husband. She began to work thanks to the help of her mother-in-law, because she couldn’t find work and wanted to contribute to the household income, which put a lot of pressure on her and worried her a lot. She began her culinary journey by initially helping in the kitchen with the preparation of the exquisite dishes typical of her city. She learned very quickly thanks to the dedication of her mother-in-law and with the help of her husband, who suggested the brilliant idea of selling her exquisite vegetable stews in her workplace. In this way, little by little she began to see the results of her work and the well-being that her work gave her family. Due to the popularity and good flavor that she offers in her exquisite dishes, she now needs to buy kitchen utensils, just as the most important thing is a kitchen supplied with a gas canister so she can keep her clients who support her daily sales. Maritza hopes that she can count on our support to continue improving her service and work toward progress for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Maritza es una joven madre, habita una pequeña morada con su pequeño y su querido esposo.Comenzó a trabajar gracias a la ayuda de su suegra ya que no conseguía trabajo y el deseo de contribuir con la economía de su hogar la apremiaba y preocupaba mucho. Inició su travesía culinaria inicialmente ayudando en la cocina con la preparación de los exquisitos platos típicos de su ciudad y aprendió en forma muy rápida gracias a la dedicación de su suegra y con el apoyo que contó de su esposo debido a que le sugirió la brillante idea de repartir los exquisitos potajes en su centro de trabajo; así poco a poco empezó a ver los resultados de su trabajo y el bienestar que generaba su desempeño a su familia..Debido a la aceptación y buen sabor que ofrece en sus exquisitos platos, se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar utensilios de cocina, así como lo más importante que es una cocina provista de un balón de gas para cumplir con sus clientes ya que respaldan sus ventas diarias.Maritza espera contar con nuestro apoyo para poder seguir mejorando su servicio y trabajar por el progreso de su familia.

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 30 years old with 4 children and is married to a subsistence farmer who can hardly grow enough food for the family. She started a small business with her meager savings from the farm products. She later obtained a loan from SMT and spent part of the loan on farming and part was invested in the business to enable her to pay back the installments on a monthly basis.

Mabinty is proud that the family has increased their rice harvest because of the loan. She is requesting another loan to increase her business stock to generate more income to be invested in the farm in the coming season in April.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of food items so that she can cook more and sell more

loans.name: Mohammad Ali

texts.en:
Mohammad Ali lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and a very talented young man. He lives with his own family and has a retail shop where he works part-time.

He would like to expand his business so he wants to take out an individual loan to buy extra inventory such as baskets, powders, shampoos, and different food items to attract more clients and make a good monthly income to support his family. This will assure him and his family of a brighter future. He is very happy to have the opportunity to get this loan.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like baskets, powders, shampoos

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las Divinas , or The Divine Ladies, is the name of this Community Association in Villa Tejada, and for more than a year and a half they have worked constantly to make their businesses prosper.

They are a total of seventeen women whose occupations vary from creating fine artwork to selling vegetables and running grocery stores to running a hostel and preparing fast food.

All these activities demand great sacrifice on the part of these businesswomen, given that their income and earnings are minimal throughout the year, and they must take advantage of those parties that bring in large crowds. For example, the parties of Carnaval bring in many consumers as well as tourism, which in the case of the businesswoman who runs a hostel represents a big opportunity to bring in income that will keep her business afloat.

Unfortunately, the competition in this field does not allow our associate to earn enough to be able to invest in improving and remodeling her hostel, much less to be able to expand the facility and be able to bring her guests greater comfort.

For this reason, these businesswomen need cash to invest in their businesses so that they can compete in the market that will be created by the Carnaval parties and other parties throughout the year.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Las Divinas, ese es el nombre de la Asociación Comunal de Villa Tejada, que hace más de un año y medio trabajan constantemente con el fin de prosperar con sus negocios.

Un total de 17 mujeres cuya ocupación varía, desde la elaboración de artesanías, pasando por la venta de verduras, tiendas de abarrotes, hasta la atención de un hostal y preparación de comida rápida.

Todas estas actividades demandan gran sacrificio de parte de estas socias, puesto que sus ingresos y ganancias son mínimas durante el año, y deben aprovechar aquellas fiestas que mueven grandes masas. Por ejemplo las fiestas de carnaval generan gran movimiento consumista, y al mismo tiempo generan turismo, lo que en el caso de la socia que posee su hostal representa una gran oportunidad para generar ingresos importantes para mantener vivo su negocio.

Lastimosamente la competitividad en el rubro no permite que nuestra socia genere los recursos necesarios por no poder invertir en mejoras y refacciones a su hostal, menos en la posibilidad de ampliación de infraestructura, mucho menos en gastos que generen mayor comodidad a sus huéspedes.

Por tal motivo, las socias precisan de capital para poder invertir en sus negocios y de esta manera competir dentro del mercado que se va a generar en las fiestas de carnavales y otras que se dan durante el año.

loans.use: Invest in their business for the high season during the parties of Carnaval

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more equipment and hire more employees

loans.name: Željana

texts.en: Željana is from Štrpci, a small village near the town of  Prnjavor. She is not married and she works in a coffee shop which she owns. Željana can earn about US$ 400 monthly. This is her first loan in the amount of US$ 500. Željana will use it  for  supplies.  Her wish is to expand what she offers in her coffee shop  in order to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: for supplies to expand her little cafe

loans.name: María Gisela

texts.en:
María Gisela has been cooking for more than eight years in the Don Gregorio community of San Cristobal; her hometown. Her breakfasts and lunches are just delicious and the customers are very satisfied with her professionalism and the good quality of her dishes. María Gisela remembers that it was an uphill struggle to position herself as one of the best cooks in the community because of the rough competition. Currently, she has a well established clientele and her business keeps on growing.

With her loan, this entrepreneur will buy more chairs and tables in order to allow people to enjoy their food comfortably. María Gisela’s husband passed away four years ago, so she has to support her five children on her own.

loans.use: Purchase some tables and chairs for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a responsible and very loving woman. Day to day she eagerly manages her small general store, in which she sells groceries to the members of her community in order to earn income and her family’s wellbeing. Her ongoing commitment and kindheartedness has brought her much satisfaction. She now wishes to improve her business space in order to offer her customers greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha, es una mujer responsable y muy amorosa. Día a Día se desenvuelve muy contenta y con mucho ahínco en su pequeña tiendita de abarrotes desde donde oferta sus productos a los miembros de su comunidad para obtener ganancias en bienestar de su familia. Su continuidad y amabilidad le han dado muchas satisfacciones y ahora desea mejorar su espacio para brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Expansion of business space for greater customer comfort

loans.name: Adriana Asunción

texts.es:
Sra. Adriana Asunción G. M. was born in the town of Bluefields. She is 30 years old and is married to Sr. Carlos Bladimir Obando who is a construction worker. The minimum wage he earns does not cover the cost of basic necessities. They have two young children.

For the last year Sra. G. has been the owner of a general store. Her customers are the people from the neighbourhood who like her store because of the variety of goods she offers (grains, juices, soups, soft drinks, natural fruit juices etc.) With the income from her business, she pays for her children’s education.

It should be noted that the products that she offers are in high demand. Right now she needs to buy 2 100K sacks of rice ($48 per sack), 2 100K sacks of sugar ($43 per sack), 1 drum of cooking oil ($40), and 1 100K sack of beans ($50). By investing in these products, Sra.G. will increase her income and satisfy her customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Adriana Asunción G. M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Carlos Bladimir Obando quien trabaja como obrero de construcción el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad.

La Sra. G. es propietaria de una pulpería hace 1 año teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer variedades de productos (granos básicos, jugos, sopas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, entre otras cosas) con el ingreso de su negocio paga los estudios de sus hijos.

Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no a disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 2 quintales de arroz a $ 48.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 43.00 dólares el quintal, 1 bidones de aceite a $ 40.00 dólares el bidón, 1 quintales de frijoles a $ 50.00 dólares el quintal, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, and soap for washing clothes.

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Agness has been selling clothes in Arusha for eight years. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children, ages 15 and 12. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and is able to generate a monthly profit of approximately $200.

Agness is taking out a loan to increase her inventory and expand her business. She will be sharing this loan with her four group members who also sell goods in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to increase her business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela de 32 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, vive con su madre, a quien acogió en su casa y quien también la apoya mucho. 
Ella estudió cosmetología, dentro de su vivienda puso su salón de belleza, donde brinda servicios de corte de cabello, manicura, pedicura, entre otras cosas. Viene realizando este trabajo desde hace 4 años, durante casi todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que las personas que acuden a ella se vayan satisfechas con trabajo que les hizo y le gusta conversar mucho con sus clientes. Lo difícil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado.   
Ella quiere mandar a construir en una parte de su terreno un local, para su salón de belleza y desde luego, dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estela is 32 and the single mother of two. She lives with her mother, who took Estela in and helps Estela a lot. Estela studied cosmetology as her home became her beauty salon, where she provides haircutting, manicures, pedicures and other services. She has been doing this work all day for four years. What she likes about the work is that the people who come to her leave her shop feeling satisfied with her work, and she really likes talking with her clients. The problem so far is that she does not have adequate premises. Estela wants to have a building constructed on part of her property for her salon so that she can give her clients a better welcome.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a better location for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Esta señora tiene un negocio de pulpería, inició vendiendo refrescos y helados, luego probó con otros productos como gaseosa y vio que ella podía producir para aportar a los gastos de la casa, pues su esposo no podía con todos los gastos y los niños son estudiantes y tenían gastos .Pensando esto decidió vender otros productos y así ella llego a tener la pulpería que hasta hoy tiene y que está ubicada en la carretera panamericana con rótulo grande para vender a los viajeros de la carretera. 

Decidió obtener un crédito con ADIM y así ofreció más variedad de product6os a los clientes, así ella con todos los financiamientos ha mejorado en la presentación del local que al día de hoy tiene un espacio seguro y a la par su calidad de vida para la familia. 

Está satisfecha con haber logrado salir a delante por su familia y sentir que es empresaria que puede seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Rosa runs a convenience store. She started out selling beverages and ice cream, then added other products like soft drinks and saw that she was able to help with household expenses; her husband couldn't afford them all on his own and their children are in school. With this in mind, she started selling more products and now has her store located on the Panamerican Highway with a big sign to attract travelers. She decide to obtain a loan through Kiva partner ADIM so she could offer a wider selection of merchandise to her customers, and with all the help, she has been able to improve her store's presentation, making it more secure and improving her family's quality of life at the same time. She's satisfied with having been able to make headway for her family and feels that her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her convenience store.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La joven Lucia Del Carmen Laínez A. tiene 25 años su estado civil es casada, ella tiene 2 hijos las edades de sus hijos son de 4 años la niña y el varón de 6 años, el nivel de escolaridad de sus hijos es el siguiente la niña se encuentra en 2 nivel y el niño en 1 grado de primaria, su esposo labora en la alcaldía municipal de león, los deseos que Lucia tiene son de conservar su financiamiento ya que con este tiene la necesidad de ir fortaleciendo y creciendo su negocio de igual manera satisfacer la demanda que sus cliente le proporcionan en su venta otras de las cosas es  ahorrar un poco dinero que tiene para poder darles  a sus hijos una educación en un  futuro ya que estos se encuentran pequeños y  así estaría asegurando sus estudios, también dese poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vivienda, de esta manera brindarle un poco de condiciones  a su familia.


La actividad económica que ella tiene es una pulpería en la  que vende : golosinas, productos para el hogar y útiles escolares su negocio esta ubicado en león en un barrio llamado san Felipe , inicio su negocio hace 3 años, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos el cual lo cambio por un negocio fijo   al ver y sentir la necesidad de llevar el sustento de diario  a su hogar teniendo un hijo  que mantener y cuidar, por lo que se decidió montar su pequeño negocio en su casita sin descuidar el negocio primario que dio inicio a dicha actividad, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ella desea  aumentar mas su negocio y lograr ser mas competitiva con otras pulperías cercanas.
texts.en:
This young woman, Lucia Del Carmen Laínez A., is 25 years old, married, and has two children, a daughter who is 4 and in level 2 in pre-primary school, and a son who is 6 and in the first grade in primary school. Lucia’s husband works for the municipality of León. One way Lucia will use financing is to strengthen and build her business in a way that will satisfy the demands of her clientele. She also wants to save a little money to give her children an education now while they are little and to assure that they can continue their studies. She would also like to improve the condition of her house.

Her business is a “pulperia” (a convenience store) in which she sells candies, products for the home, and school supplies. Her store is located in León in a neighborhood called San Felipe and she opened it 3 years ago. Before that she had dedicated herself to marketing clothing and cosmetics, but seeing the necessity of earning a steady income to meet daily needs, she decided to make a change. Since she had a young son, she decided to work from home so that she could look after him. This financing will provide the working capital Lucia needs for expanding her business to be competitive with other pulperias nearby.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cereal from the rural areas and sell them in town

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en:
Fizuli Q. is a 45-year-old trader who has sold fruits and vegetables in his own store since 2000. He is married and has one son. From the income he earned during the last eight years, he was able to build his store last year. His store is located in a place where many people pass during the day.
