texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un ancien chauffeur de véhicule de transport de touristes.Il est à la retraite depuis un an et vit chez lui avec son épouse et ses 8 enfants.Tous ses enfants sont à l'école , les 3 sont des étudiantes à l'université.Actuellement, il exerce un élevage de poulets de chair et fait du maraichage dans son champs de 2 ha de surface.Il arrive, avec ses acivités, à prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.Afin de  réaliser une nouvelle opération, il sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un pret de 200000f pour acheter 100 poussins, de l'aliment et des produits vétérinaires. Son ambition est d'agrandir son élevage.
texts.en: This lender is a former driver of tourist vehicles. He has been retired for a year and lives together with his wife and their 8 children. All the children are at school, 3 of them are students at university. Currently, he has a chicken rearing farm and also a market garden in his 2 hectare field. With these activities, he manages to cover the family's living expenses. In order to start a new operation, he is seeking a loan of 200,000f from UIMCEC to buy 100 chicks, feed and veterinary products. His ambition is to grow his farm.

loans.use: to buy 100 chicks, feed and veterinary products

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose is from Kapalaran, Tambulig. She is 19 years old and married. 

To make a living, April Rose is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community. April Rose has been in her business for 2 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

April Rose is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2011, April Rose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Walter Paulino

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre muy trabajador, desde pequeño aprendió a trabajar ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica. Es así que luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su taller mecánico ya que siempre le ha gustado reparar carros y desde joven aprendió ha hacerlo; Walter le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; el cree que su negocio está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo es cuidadoso con su trabajo.

 Walter está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una compresora y de esta manera tener las herramientas necesaria para desempeñar su trabajo, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Walter’s a very hardworking man who learned to work when still small because his parents had few economic resources.  
Because of this he was only able to attend school up to fifth year of secondary school but he would have liked to have studied Mechanical Engineering.  This is how with much effort and saving he was able to open his own repair shop since he’s always enjoyed repairing cars and learned how to do so when he was young.  Walter works about ten hours daily and can see up to 10 customers per day.  He believes his business is turning out well because he’s very responsible and above all very careful with his work.

Walter is very grateful to Kiva lenders because of the support provided he will be able to buy a compressor and have the tools needed to do his work which will make it possible for him to improve his income and continue striving towards his greatest dream: to own a house.

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Kathy Katrina

texts.es: KATHY KATRINA: Es una señora trabajadora, que lucha día a día para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 38 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como ayudante en las embarcaciones. Desde hace más de 12 años se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, de esta manera cuenta con su propia fuente de ingresos, contribuye con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para mejorar la infraestructura, condiciones de los cuartos. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción. Su sueño es construir más cuartos, debido al incremento de la demanda y comercializar mariscos.

loans.use: para mejorar la infraestructura, condiciones de los cuartos que alquila

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah would like to buy animal feeds for her dairy cows

loans.name: Fono

texts.en: Unlike other farmers who only specialize in growing only one specific root crop or vegetable, Fono believes in multi-cropping. She grows a range of them from root crops to vegetables and fruits like mangos, cucumbers and cocoa for example. Despite not having any children to help, her extended family provides labor to assist her in growing and selling her produce. Fono’s normal income is one hundred tala in a  day depending on the sales. The money is used to expand her small businesss and for family commitments as this is the family’s main source of income. She is very thankful for the support from SPBD that has made all these things possible for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase Tiapula, fertilizer, piki, banana, cabbages(seeds)(HI)=cement, iron roof.

loans.name: Horacio

texts.en:
Horacio is an entrepreneur and very responsible. He’s married and has two children who are 28 years old. Twelve years ago, it was very difficult to find a job after he was made redundant due to downsizing. In order to cover living costs and pay for his children’s schooling, he decided to start his own business and opened a workshop where he repairs electronic appliances. His good service has allowed him to build up a rapport with his clients and maintain customer loyalty throughout this time.

Now, Horacio needs a loan of $925 dollars: he will use the money to buy spare-parts used in repairing domestic electrical appliances, so that he can carry on offering his clients a good service and expanding his business, as he has done up until now. You can play a crucial role in the growth of this business and bettering the lives of Horacio and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

Horacio es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 28 años de edad. Hace doce años le fue muy difícil encontrar un empleo después de que fue despedido por recorte de personal, para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, decidió iniciar su propio negocio y abrió su taller donde repara aparatos electrónicos, su buen servicio le ha permitido darse a conocer entre sus cliente y conservar su preferencia durante tanto tiempo.

En estos momentos, Horacio necesita de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de refacciones que utiliza en la reparación de los electrodomésticos, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio y continuar con creciendo con su negocio como hasta ahora. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar la vida de Horacio y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to further expand farmers' milk production

loans.name: John

texts.en: "My tyre business gives me hope of living a better life. I need additional business capital to boost my business, though," says Mr. John A., who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. John is 29 years old, married, and father of 2 children. He has been in this business since 2005 and is the secretary of his union. With the loan amount John intends to expand his inventory (i.e., buy more tyres for sale).

loans.use: To buy more tyres for sale

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
Benigna is 36 and the loving mother of four. Her husband, the father of her children, long abused her physically then abandoned her and the children without means of support. Since then she was worked tirelessly making small clay figurines of animals thought to bring good fortune in childbirth. Her children give her reason to live. The whole family helps with the enterprise and tries to put their difficult moments behind them and work for a better future. Benigna's greatest dream is to give her children a good education. She wants to increase production before Christmastime when she sells the most and is asking for a loan to buy clay. She promises to repay it within seven months. Benigna is counting on your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Benigna tiene 36 años de edad y es una cariñosa madre de cuatro niños. Durante mucho tiempo después de haber concebido nupcias con el hombre que se convirtió en su esposo y padre de sus hijos este la maltrató físicamente para luego abandonarla sin ningún amparo económico; desde entonces se dedica arduamente a la fabricación de objetos artesanales, trabajos en miniatura que realiza a base se arcilla (animalitos para armar el nacimiento) con apoyo de sus queridos hijos, quienes la motivan y se han convertido en la razón de su vida. Todos juntos tratan de olvidar los momentos difíciles que pasaron y luchan día a día para salir adelante.El mayor deseo de Benigna es ofrecerles una adecuada educación a sus queridos socios y para esto trabaja incansablemente, más aún en el mes de diciembre, época navideña, en el que recibe mayor pedido y demanda de los objetos que produce.Para hacer realidad sus sueños solicita un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en la compra de materia prima (arcilla) para la elaboración de sus delicados trabajos y con la venta de éstos generar mayor beneficio económico para ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y encaminarlos hacia un futuro prometedor. Benigna se compromete responsablemente a retornar el préstamo en un lapso de 7 meses y apela a vuestros generosos corazones para lograr lo que anhela.

loans.use: To buy clay for making figurines.

loans.name: Ni Putu Suantini

texts.id:
Ni Putu Suantini  tinggal di daerah pedesaan. Sebagai usaha yang dapat membantu pendapatan suami yaitu usaha beternak babi. Saat ini Ni Putu Suantini mempunyai 2 ekor induk 7 ekor penggemukkan dan 8 ekor bibit yang masih kecil-kecil.Untuk mencukupi pakan ternaknya Ni Putu Suantini membutuhkan biaya yang tidak sedikit apalagi harga pakan semakin mahal. Itulah yang menjadi kesulitan dalam usahanya.
Dengan menjadi Client Dinari, Ni Putu Suantini mendapat pinjaman dana dan pembinaan maupun penyuluhan mengenai ternaknya. Kebutuhan pakan ternaknya sudah dapat diatasi dengan ketersediaan pakan yang mudah bahkan sudah dibentuk depo pakan ternak di desanya. Untuk menambah jumlah ternaknya Ni Putu Suantini membeli satu induk  jenis Landrace. Kebersihkan kandang selalu dikerjakan setiap pagi dan sore hari. Penjualan dari bibit babi ini dilakukan setiap bulan dengan harapan ada pendapatan untuk keluarganya. Pendapatan bersih dalam setiap bulan dari hasil beternaknya dapat mencapai Rp.300.000,-.Usaha ini akan ditekuninya terus bahkan akan menambah jumlah induknya agar ketersediaan bibit  babi dalam setiap bulannya selalu tersedia.

loans.use: Membeli pakan ternak

loans.name: Asencia

texts.es:
For the last 28 years Asencia H. has dedicated her work to the sale of grocery items in the marketplace in the Villa Adela area. She began with very few products. Currently she also organizes games of chance but with the products she sells. In other words, they organize their own form of trades using clothing items and grocery items. She gets a small commission for organizing the events. Asencia lives only with her son, as she became a widow not too long ago. She lives in a home next door to two other tenants. She needs the loan to be able to increase her inventory and be able to buy items at wholesale prices, thus reducing her costs and increasing the income for her and her youg son.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Asencia H., hace 28 años que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un puesto de su propiedad en el mercado de la zona de Villa Adela, comenzó con muy pocos productos, pero los más importantes de la canasta familiar. Actualmente se dedica de forma paralela a organizar juegos de azar pero con los productos de su puesto, es decir que juegan una especie de Pasanaku con prendas de vestir y víveres, donde ella recibe una pequeña comisión por organizadora y aprovecha de vender su mercadería. Asencia vive con su hijo, puesto que enviudó no hace mucho, en una casa junto a dos de sus inquilinos. Ella precisa de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, comprar víveres al por mayor, lo que resulta una reducción en el gasto y un mejor ingreso para ella y su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Ella precisa de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, comprar víveres al por mayor, lo que resulta una reducción en el gasto y un mejor ingreso para ella y su pequeño hijo.   <b>She needs the loan to increase her inventory and buy at wholesale prices in order to decrease costs and increase income for her and her son.<b>

loans.name: Nanik

texts.id:
In 1990, Nanik started her business by selling “rujak” (Indonesian fruit salad). After observing the promising future of a hot food kiosk, she started to sell rice dishes. Her initial regular was her neighbor who lives in the Sidakarya area. Her daily profit can reach $10. Nanik is borrowing $100 loan to buy supplies for her kiosk. Nanik and her husband no longer have to support their two children because they are married. Also, her husband earns $120 a month, which covers their monthly household expenses. However, she needs to help with their monthly rent and their future savings.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Pada awal usahanya di tahun 1990 Nanik menjual rujak. Setelah melihat prospek yang menjanjikan dari warung makanan dia mulai menjual nasi. Langganannya adalah tetangganya yang tinggal di jalan Mertasari, Sidakarya. Keuntungan per hari dari usahanya ini mencapai Rp 100.000,00. Nanik meminjam uang sebesar Rp 700.000,00 untuk lebih melengkapi warungnya. Nanik dan suaminya sudah tidak memiliki tanggungan. Kedua anaknya sudah menikah. Selain itu untuk keperluan rumah tangga penghasilan dari suami sudah mencukupi. Suaminya memiliki pekerjaan yang bagus dengan penghasilan Rp 1.200.000,00 per bulan. Namun, dia juga harus memikirkan tentang biaya kontrak rumah dan masa depan mereka berdua.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the kiosk

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is 28 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 16 and 10 years.  Salma owns a small food vendor store  and she also began selling soap and clothes in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.  Salma now hopes for a loan to buy more  items for her business.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María Z. is 28 years old and has been married for 8 years to Alexis Gómez, who is 36. The couple have two children; one is 6 years old and in 1st grade in a school in the city and the younger one is a year old.

For the past 4 years Alexis has been working in Spain and comes once a year to visit his family. María says that this is a painful situation as she struggles to raise her two small daughters by herself. Alexis sends money from his job every month. He emigrated to Spain in search of work since there were few job opportunities in Paraguay and he was forced to take extreme measures to get ahead.

With the money her husband sent, María set up a general store in her house. In this way she generates extra income without having to leave home and without neglecting her children, who are still small.

Since the income from the store is good, María would like to invest more into it and for this reason, she is asking for a loan with which to buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise, such as: handbags, candles, wallets, toys, shoes, jewelry, cushions, vases, sheets, and other things that her customers have requested on various occasions.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Z. de 28 años de edad esta casada hace 8 años con el señor Alexis Gómez de 36 años, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos, uno de 6 años que ya va a al 1er. grado en una escuela de la ciudad y el otro más pequeño de 1 año.

Hace 4 años Alexis está trabajando en España, y viene una vez al año a visitar a su familia, María cuenta que es muy dolorosa esta situación, pues ella sola debe luchar con sus hijas pequeñas para salir adelante. Alexis le envía mensualmente dinero de su trabajo, el emigro a este país en busca de trabajo pues la escasez de fuentes de trabajo en nuestro país lo obligo a buscar medidas extremas para conseguir salir adelante.

Del dinero que le envió su marido, María monto una despensa en su casa, de este modo genera un ingreso extra sin salir de su casa, y sin descuidar la crianza de sus hijos que aún son muy pequeños.

Como el margen de ganancias es muy interesante, María desea invertir más en su despensa y es por ello que ella solicita un crédito con el que podrá adquirir una mayor cantidad y variedad de mercaderías como: carteras, veladores, kits de billeteras, juguetes, zapatos, bijouterie, almohadones, jarrones, sábanas, entre otras cosas que sus clientes ya le han solicitado en varias ocasiones.

loans.use: Buy handbags, candles, wallets, toys, shoes, jewelry, cushions, vases, sheets and other goods.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal K. is only 22 years old, but he's already run a barber shop in Imishli, Azerbaijan, for four years. The money he earns from his business is the sole source of income for his family, which includes his parents and younger brothers and sisters.

He has requested a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars to make repairs to his store and buy new equipment. He's confident that he will be able to repay it, because he has plenty of regular clients who appreciate his work. Vusual says he's very hardworking and eager to learn, and he hopes to earn more profit to support his family.

loans.use: To fund repairs and buy equipment for a barber shop

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Thanks to their preparation and experience, Karina and her husband decided to enter the dental-health field to help the thousands of people in their beautiful city. Now, they lend their services daily from a comfortable office, and the requests for extractions and false teeth have increased thanks to the quality service they provide. They wish to keep improving their workspace and acquire higher-quality resin and equipment so they can continue satisfying the demands of their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Gracias a su preparación y a la experiencia que adquirieron Karina y su esposo decidieron incursionar en el campo de la salud dental en beneficio de miles de personas de su bella ciudad. Ahora prestan sus servicios a diario desde un cómodo lugar y las extracciones y encargos de dentaduras postizas se han incrementado gracias a la buena atención que prestan en conjunto. Desean seguir mejorando su espacio de trabajo y adquirir mayor cantidad de resina y herramientas para seguir satisfaciendo las exigencias de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase resin and dental equipment / Compra de resina y herramientas dentales.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida is a member of the community bank Mujeres Valientes (Courageous Women), located in the the street Coronel Portillo, in the Callería district of the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 35 years old and is the mother of 1 daughter. Because her income is insufficient for her expenses, she decided to start a business selling beauty products with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) .

Nelida now lives from the beauty products business she started. She rises at 7 in the morning in order to prepare breakfast for her daughter, and then spends the day selling her beauty products to her clients.

With this loan of 2,300 soles which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy perfumes, colognes, deoderants, earrings; necklaces, shampoos, rings, miscellaneous accessories, etc.

Every day Nelida has to invest lots of effort in order to have clients and sell her beauty products. Her sacrifice is reflected in her earnings, which are the direct result of the effort and perserverance she puts out each day, with one objective: moving her daughter ahead in life. She is very happy and very proud of herself.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelida pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Coronel Portillo 836, el Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 1 hija, pero sus ingresos económicos son insuficientes para sus gastos, es así que Nelida con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos de belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de su hija, de allí se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró perfumes, colonias, desodorantes, aretes, collares, shampoo, anillos, chilindrinas, etc.

Nelida a diario tiene que esforzarse para poder tener clientes y vender sus productos de belleza, su sacrificio se ve reflejado en sus ganancias, pues son propios de la lucha y perseverancia que a diario realiza ,con el fin de salir adelante con su hija. Esta muy orgullosa y feliz de si misma.

loans.use: Buy beauty items and accessories.

loans.name: Naghagurueghian

texts.en: Naghagurueghian U. is a farmer. She plants plantains, pepper, and pineapples on her farm. She is 58 years old and married with 8 children. She lives at Okohuo, Edo State, Nigeria. After harvesting, she sells the farm produce at the community market. This, she says, has yielded her more profit. She has been farming since 2003.She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more plantain suckers for planting and also for the clearing of her farmland.

loans.use: To clear her farmland and buy more plantain suckers for planting

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is 33 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She is an exercise instructor on a gym for the last 4 years, she also offers her services as instructor on several health institutions, she works everyday per hours, except weekends. Her work consists on guide the movements to burn fat, she also sells health products that offers to the clients that go to the gym. Vilma feels being gym instructor is her vocation and thanks her father that always inspired her to practice sports, she also helps people with nutrition because she graduated as a nutritionist. She has some land where she would like to build her own gym and improve the equipment she has, this is why she is soliciting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Ella es guía de ejercicios en un gimnasio, tiene este negocio desde hace 4 años junto a un socio, también ofrece sus servicios como instructora de ejercicios a diversas instituciones de salud, atiende todos los días por horas, excepto los fines de semana, su trabajo consiste en orientar los movimientos corporales para quemar grasa, adicionalmente vende productos de salud, los ofrece a sus clientes que van al gimnasio, Vilma siente que ser instructora de ejercicios es su vocación y agradece a su padre que siempre la motivó a realizar deportes, además de contribuir con la salud de las personas en temas de nutrición porque es de profesión ingeniera en industrias alimentarias, especializada en nutrición. Tiene una extensión de terreno en la que invertirá construyendo su propio local de gimnasio y también en mejorar el equipo de gimnasio que posee, para ello, es que solicita este préstamo.

loans.use: Improve the equipment at her gym and invest in construction of her own space / Mejorar el equipo para gimnasio que posee e invertir en la construcción de su propio local.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinaldo tiene 45 años, esta casado con la Sra. Elva y tienen 3 hijas todos menores de edad.

El Sr. Reinaldo se dedica a la compra y venta de teléfonos móviles nuevos y reacondicionados, y accesorios para los mismos. Anteriormente era empleado en una empresa y hace ocho años tiene su puesto en el mercado de San Lorenzo.

El Sr. Reinaldo solicita este crédito para la compra de nuevos aparatos celulares y accesorios, ya que la tecnología avanza cada día y la demanda de aparatos nuevos y más modernos es cada vez más alta.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 45 years old and is married to Elva with whom he has 3 kids who are all young.

Reinaldo buys and sells new and reconditioned cellular phones and accessories. He used to be employed by a company and he has now had his stall in the San Lorenzo market for eight years.

Reinaldo would like this credit to buy new cell phone parts and accessories, as technology advances each day and the demand for new and more modern parts is higher all the time.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones and accessories/Compra de teléfonos celulares y accesorios.

loans.name: Miguel Jeronimo

texts.es:
El nombre de este señor  es de Miguel Gerónimo T. R. el tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es de soltero, tiene 1 hijo con la edad de 6 años recientemente cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida es ama de casa, los propósitos que don Miguel tiene es de poder proporciónale mejoras a su vivienda debido a que siempre que llueve pasa por incomodidades  en su vivienda, otros de sus deseos es poder mantener siempre el ritmo que tiene su venta ya que esta representa una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, otros de sus deseos es poder ayudar a su hijo en sus estudios universitarios ya que el expresa que no desea que su hijo  en un futuro no pueda defenderse por sus propios medios.

Don Miguel tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general como lo es: venta de ropa, zapatos y  ropa para caballeros, el tiempo que Don Miguel  tiene  de tener este negocio es de 10 años y explica que la forma como empezó fue que su esposa ofrecía la mercadería  y le ayudaba, de así el empezó a poner mas interés por el negocio y  fue como  dio inicio a  la idea de empezar su propio negocio, el financiamiento lo necesita para capital de trabajo realizando sus compras en Managua y  comprar los productos que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Miguel Gerónimo T. R. is 41 years old, single, and has one son who is 6 years old and is in primary school. His life companion is a homemaker. He wants to make repairs to his home to keep out the rain. Another desire of his is to always be able to maintain the rhythm of his sales as this represents his main source of income. He also wants to help his son to study at the university because he wants his son to be able to support himself in the future. Don Miguel’s business is selling clothes, shoes and men’s clothing. He has run this business for 10 years. He explains that the way he started the business was that his companion offered the merchandise and helped him get set up. He needs financing to shop in Managua for the products that his customers need.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, who is married to a good man and blessed with five obedient children, cooks and sells rice cake (or the famous "bibingka") in the Philippines.  She has been in this business which she enjoys for almost ten years now.  Her enjoyment is brought about, aside from the income, by the good remarks of her customers, i.e. she "cooks deliciously". She roams around their community going from one house to another to sell rice cake. Her income is at a minimum of Php100.00 a day.  

Aside from her daily house-to-house selling of the tasty native food, she is also able to get orders during special occasions like birthdays, fiesta, Holy Week and All Souls Day. But the highest demand for this native food is during the month of December, or the Christmas season, because it is the tradition of the Filipinos to eat this delicacy combined with ginger tea after attending the "misa de gallo" or the night (or early morning) mass held from December 16 to December 24.

With the Christmas season fast approaching, and to meet the expected high demands for rice cake, Anita wants to avail of a loan of Php 5,000.00. She wants to be prepared for the blessings that this season will bring to her.
	
She hopes that her request will be granted so she can continue improving her business and helping her husband in meeting the needs of their family, and eventually realizing their dreams.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa S. is a trader. She sells maize and gari (cassava) at Abrobeano, which she has been doing since 1999. She is married with five dependents; her husband is a fisherman. She has received no formal education.

Adwoa will use this loan to buy more goods for sale at the market. The profit she gets will be used to support her children’s education.

In front of Adwoa in the photo is a bowl of maize to represent what she sells.

loans.use: To buy more maize and gari for sale at the market.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hùy năm nay 50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1994Gia đình chị có ba người con đều đã trưởng thành. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều đang chăn nuôi, trồng và kinh daonh cây cảnh tại nhà. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hùy  mong muốn được vay 16.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và kinh doanh cây cảnh.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hùy, 50 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1994. She has three grown children. Currently, in addition to raising animals, she and her husband grow and sell ornamental potted plants from their home. This is the main source of earnings for the family, whose total income is about 5,000,000 VND (289 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Hùy hopes to borrow 16,000,000 VND (925 USD) to invest in raising animals and their ornamental plant business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ornamental plants and raising animals

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mamadou D. intervient dans la vente et la réparation des pneus à Grand Dakar.
Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité qui est rentable. Grâce aux services qu'il offre, il arrive à nourir sa famille et appuyer les parents restés au village.
texts.en:
Mamadou D. works selling and repairing tires in Grand Dakar.

He is requesting this loan to bolster his business which is remunerative. Thanks to the services he offers, he is able to feed his family and support his relatives back home in the village.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale and repair of tires

loans.name: Dao Xuan

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị Thuỷ  năm nay  43  tuổi. Năm 2008 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào cửa hàng cắt may. Hiện tại ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ cửa hàng cắt may hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương hưu của chồng với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. 
  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000đ để đầu tư mua vải về cắt may  nhằm phục vụ  nagỳ càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của bà con địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi T. is 43 years old. In 2008, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in a tailor shop. Currently, in addition to the income from the tailor shop her family also receives pension of her husband. The income of her family is VND3,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND8,000,000 to buy more textiles for tailoring to serve the needs of the local community.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy textiles for tailoring

loans.name: Irma Concepcion

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Bancomunal Las Rosas del valle.
Irma es casada tiene 60 años, dos hijos que son mayores.
Irma desD. joven se dedico a coser aprendió empíricamente, por la necesidad económica que había en casa, pero con los años  lo dejo por su edad, y empezó hacer para vender chocolatería, triples los reparte por las tiendas por su barrio, también se dedica a la  venta artesanía D. trupan, los coloca en  las tiendas, ofrece a sus vecinas.
DesD. que está en Finca aprendió a ahorrar, recibió charlas que le han ayudado  a mejorar su negocio, le gusta el compañerismo que hay entre las socias del Bancomunal.
Irma necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, para comprar pinturas, pinceles, resinas, barnices.
El sueño D. Irma es poner una tienda bazar, para estar más tranquila, y no estar correteando D. casa en casa.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the communal bank called Las Rosas del Valle. She is 60 years old and has two grown up sons. From the time she was young, Irma has worked as a seamstress to earn income. But over the years as she got older, she stopped sewing and began sellling handicrafts to the local shops and to her neighbors. Since she has been working with the communal bank, she has learned how to save more money, receiving education that has helped her improve her business. She likes the comraderie between the members of the bank. Irma needs a loan to buy paints, resins, varnish and other materials needed to make her handicrafts. Her dream is to be able to set up a small shop so she can run her business without having to sell door to door.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paints, resin, varnishes and other materials needed to make her handicrafts

loans.name: Magalelei

texts.en:
Magalelei O., 42, is married with 8 children. Her husband is a fisherman and he also does the farming.

Magalelei has five years of experience in the taro, banana and taamu business. She sells to the village people and public one day a week. This is her second request for 1500 with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala. 

SPBD loans are Magalelei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use some of the loan for school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay her kid’s school fees and purchase more tools and fertilizers for the plantation.

loans.name: Sujayla Del Rosario

texts.es: La Joven Sujayla del Rosario A. M. tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casada. Sujayla tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Sujayla es la elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella hornea todos los días de la semana y sale a entregar sus productos al mercado municipal a sus clientes, por lo que tiene que regresar de nuevo a recoger su ganancia. Por lo que sus propósitos son de mantener a sus clientes ya que ellos son la base para que su negocio continúe. Sujayla no posee ayudantes y trabaja sola por su propia cuenta. Es por eso que solicita financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la inversión de materia de prima como azúcar, huevos, mantequilla y harina. El deseo de Sujayla es establecer una panadería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sujayla del Rosario A. M. is 39 years old, married and has 3 children who attend school.

Sujayla started a baking business over 7 years ago. She bakes every day of the week and delivers her products to her customers in the municipal market. She has to return to receive payment. She wants to maintain this customer base to keep her business going. Sujayla works alone without any assistants.

This is why she is requesting a loan for working capital to purchase basic ingredients like sugar, eggs, butter and flour. Sujayla’s wish is to establish a bakery in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin N. is a 40-year-old woman whose business deals in selling clothes and used shoes at the market. She requests a loan to stock more clothes and used shoes to sell in order to enhance her business. N. has four children since her marriage: three are girls and one is a younger boy. Two of her children attend secondary school at Supiri, one attends primary school and the youngest one doesn't go to school. With the extra profits from her loan in future, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek S., 44, has been a policeman since 1980. He typically makes US$5 per day. He lives with his wife and three of his children in Phnom Penh city. His wife, pictured here, sells clothes and makes US$5 per day as well. Three of their children are in school.

Ek S. would like to take out a loan to increase the clothing inventory for his wife and the rest will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and renovate house.

loans.name: Fahed

texts.en:
Fahed is a young man who is married and has two children. Fahed has been working in baking for ten years and currently has his own bakery, where he makes bread, Ka'ak, and sweets.

Fahed's business is growing, and there is strong demand for his products since he has an excellent reputation and the bakery is located at the entrance of Bethlehem's old city.

Fahed requested a loan of 1,000 USD from FATEN in order to renovate the bakery and buy some supplies.

Fahed appears on the picture organizing his products

loans.use: Improve the bakery and buy new goods

loans.name: Jenette

texts.en: Jenette R. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Jenette owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Jenette joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Jenette is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for the tuition of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda M. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 46, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilfreda owns & operates a blacksmith business. Her main source of income comes from manufacturing & selling iron products to local businesses and community members. Wilfreda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Wilfreda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfreda repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Wilfreda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Wilfreda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for blacksmith business

loans.name: Silvia Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Isidora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas II”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02  hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Silvia Isidora, es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz de cumplir lo que se proponga, nos cuenta que poco a poco ha ido logrando algunas de sus metas y sueños que quería realizar,  en la actualidad se dedica a venta de colchas para dormir y le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes que la conocen y saben de su negocio.
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 650.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su mercadería de colchas para la temporada de  frio.
Ella manifiesta que siente mucho orgullo por ella misma, por lo que logró y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me da  Manuela Ramos  de  contar con los  préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia Isidora is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Optimistas II” (Optimistic Women II), which is located in the District of San Hilarión, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children.

Silvia Isidora is cheerful and persistent woman who keeps her promises. She sells bedspreads. Although it has taken some time for her to achieve her goals, Silvia Isidora is doing very well at the moment because she has customers who know her and are aware of her business. Her strong will and persistence have helped her grow as an independent woman. She is very proud of her achievements.

Her loan of 650 soles will be used to buy more merchandise to add to her inventory of quilts and bedspreads for the cold weather season.

Silvia Isidora believes she has been able to achieve much because of her enthusiasm and optimism. She told us, “I appreciate the opportunity Manuela Ramos has given me through this loan because it has helped me grow as a woman and as a small entrepreneur.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to increase inventory

loans.name: Aïssatou Ibra

texts.fr: Aïssatou Ibra D. est une femme de 58 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait du commerce et  vend des draps et des tissus. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses capacités d’autofinancement. Avec ses revenus elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou Ibra D. is a 58-year-old woman who is married and the mother of one child.  She has a business and sells bed sheets and cloth.  She's requesting this loan to bolster her ability to self-finance.  With her revenues, she wishes to improve her family's health and living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in bed sheets and fabrics

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan B. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Joan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joan owns and operates a business of making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Joan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Joan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Joan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Kim Nhor's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim Nhor P. is a group leader of five members who all live in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she has a problem because her field is infertile soil which it is a bad to affect to her crop. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make more crops productive. Mrs. Kim Nhor P. is 32 years old widow with a child who is too young to work or study. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make more crops productive.

loans.name: Flora Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Flora Áreas de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora con deseo de ayudar a su familia para que tenga una mejor por venir, desde hace veinte años palmea tortilla y hace nacatamales para vender, y poder tener sus propios ingresos, vive en Batahola Sur en la capital de Managua, procreo cuatro hijos los cuales están casados, su esposo es cadete de taxista y su horarios son de 6 de la mañana a las dos de la tarde, y cambian los horarios de la cooperativa, con este crédito desea comprar maíz en quintales, leña, frutas, verduras para variar los productos y vender mas, ya que como planes quiere hacer mejora a su vivienda. Contenta con la institución por financiamiento.
texts.en:
Flora Áreas is 48, and she is a hard-working woman. She wants to help her family have a better future. For twenty years she has been making tortillas and “nacatamales” (a type of Nicaraguan tamale) to sell in order to be able to have her own income. She lives in Batahola Sur in the capital of Managua. She has four children, and they are married. Her husband is a taxi driver. His hours are from six in the morning until two in the afternoon. The cooperative’s schedule changes. With this loan she wants to buy corn by the quintal (100 pounds), wood, fruit, and vegetables to vary the products and sell more. Her plan is that she wants to improve her home. She is happy with the financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, wood, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Faith's Group

texts.en:
Faith N. is the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is a friendly and hard working lady with a retail shop business in Sabwa that she has owned for 20 years.

Faith says that when she had just started there was very limited competition in her business, hence she made more money from many sales, but now due to a lot of competition her profits keep on deteriorating and this is why she takes loans.

She would like a loan to help increase her stock of goods in her shop so that it could become a one-stop shop for her customers. Perhaps in future she can turn it into wholesale. She would also like to build rental houses for future developments.

Faith is a married lady who takes care of 12 children aged 28 – 13 years, as she takes care of her siblings. She would like to ensure that she educates all of them. Her previous loans have helped her keep a steady supply of goods in her shop and to pay school fees for her children on time.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is 50 years old, married and has eight children. She has been with LAPO for years with a good repayment record. She buys yams by the river and sells them nearby. She has been managing the business for eight years and with it sustains her family. With the increase in demand for the goods, she is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more yams in order to satisfy her customers' demands and also make more profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy and her husband Baltazar reside in the village of Barangay Capatan Tuguegarao, City. Their main source of income is a motorcycle transport business. Additionally, Cristy is also engaged in farming, while her husband Baltazar is a tricycle operator in their village to earn extra income. 

In order to further develop his transportation business, Cristy is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 from the KIVA lenders. He hopes that this loan request will be approved so that he can maintain his motorcycle transport and have his business grow and earn more of a profit.

Cristy and Baltazar are blessed with only one child namedLucky 24 years old, college graduate. He is now working as a Traffic Enforcer in Tuguegarao, City.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Nury

texts.es:
La señora Nury es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 10 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta de coca y cigarro.
Nury nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar coca y cigarro.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la reunión con las socias.
texts.en:
Nury has been a member of the "Gran Poder" community bank for the last 10 years in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 49 years old, a single mother, and has 1 son. She did not complete primary school, and she buys and sells coca and cigars. Nury says her with first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 300 nuevos soles she was able to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles with which she will buy more coca and cigars. Her future wish is to improve her business. What she likes the best about her organization are the savings and the meetings for the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coca and cigars

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis B. O. is 39 years old, married and has two children. Both his children are boys, aged four and two years. His wife is a business lady and they hope to purchase a plot and build rental houses some day. His business is located at Lake market in Kisumu, a very beautiful town that has the biggest Kenyan lake. The business is situated in the Central Business District, which puts him at a great advantage to serve so many local people. He engages in selling compact disks, computer accessories and also does computer services. He has the challenge of many people doing the same business as his. He is using his loan to purchase a printer to grow his business and in the future, he dreams of opening a cyber cafe. He is a hardworking and ambitious man.

loans.use: To purchase a printer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 26 years old and married to Peter Ndung'u, a businessman. They live in Ruaka from where she operates her beauty salon. Joyce's main customers are from the neighborhood.

Joyce has never borrowed from other sources and this is her first loan with KADET. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and she is among the founding members of her group. When she gets this loan, Joyce plans to expand the salon business and buy stock for a boutique she is creating in her salon. 

Joyce hopes and plans to operate an even bigger salon and a boutique.

loans.use: to expand the salon business and open a boutique

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.en:
Adriana is the coordinator of her group, La Fe (The Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally.

Adriana’s group is located in El-Seybo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longtime partner and their two children.

Adriana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and built her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business with a mobile stand that sells the essentials such as chicken, rice, oil and vegetables which she will purchase with this loan.

Adriana will use the profits to invest in her home by refinishing the floor and purchasing food for her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice, oil and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Good Will Group

texts.en:
Nancy K. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Goodwill'. She is single with 2 boys aged 9 and 16 years old; their educational levels are 2nd and 3rd grade.  She could not continue her education through 12th grade due to poverty.
 
Nancy's business is the sale of foodstuffs such as rice, seasonings and peppers. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail on a table in the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia.  She has been running this business for 5 years and hopes to grow her business.  Nancy is very friendly, which encourages people to keep buying from her.

Nancy started selling with 3000 Liberian Dollars as working capital and now operates with 4000 Liberian dollars. She says that it’s hard for her to save money because she has to feed her children and send them to school.  Nancy will use this loan to purchase additional rice, pepper, and seasonings for resale.  She dreams of giving her children a good education and medical attention when needed.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Nancy is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice, peppers, and seasonings for resale

loans.name: Neddy

texts.en:
Neddy is 51 years old and married with seven children. They range in age from 17 to 33 and her three youngest children are currently enrolled in school.

Neddy owns and runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over twenty years. She operates a kiosk at the market where she sells fruit, vegetables and maize as her primary source of income.

There are a number of challenges that Neddy must overcome and she cited issues such as price fluctuation and the seasonal aspect of farming making income inconsistent.

Neddy recently completed her first loan with Juhudi Kilimo, and has now requested this loan for Kes 51,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow, and to expand her stock of poultry. She says that the extra income from this loan will help support her children through the rest of their education.

Neddy also wants to help her daughter open a business as a hair stylist, as she recently completed the necessary training. In the future, Neddy would like to keep expanding her business as she now has access to more capital.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and to expand her poultry stock

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en: Tenneh V. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Our God Is Able”. She is 40 years old, single, and has three children who range from 8 to 17 years old. Tenneh could not continue her education through 7th grade due to lack of financial support. In the photo, Tenneh is the one holding the sign. For five years, Tenneh has been selling foodstuffs such as rice, sugar and peanuts at the VOA Junction in Northern Monrovia, Liberia. She encourages her customers to continue to come and buy from her, which keeps them returning. Tenneh plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice, sugar and peanuts. Her goal is to grow her business to a shop and help her children have a good future. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and peanuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to boost his business

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mr. Khoeurn K., 37 years old, is a villager who lives in Peam Sala village in Kandal province. He is a fisherman who can earn a small income to support his family. In order to support this business, Mr. Khoeurn K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a boat and a boat machine to support his fishing business. His wife, Mrs. Pov Chim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows crops. This couple has five children; one is a grass seller, while the others attend the local school and also support their parent's business. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and a boat machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth for sewing

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Carmen L.  convive actualmente con el padre D. sus 5 hijos 3 D. ellos aun menores D. edad, tiene 42 años es una D. las 8 integrantes  del grupo D. Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto  conformado por socios que se dedican a distintas labores.
Carmen  comenzó a vender productos  AVON  (productos D. belleza como son perfumen, talco, colonia, entre otros) tardo aproximadamente 1 año para poder ganar clientes, al transcurrir ese tiempo su ingreso mejoro y con L. necesidad D. poder  comprar más productos para su venta tuvo L. oportunidad D. participar por intermedio D. una amiga  en  Edaprospo, su primer préstamo lo invirtió en L. compra D. más productos  AVON.,  en L. actualidad venD.  comida , golosinas, gaseosas, en un puesto que alquilo dentro D. un Colegio D. Educación,  al igual que todo  negocio  empezó con pequeñas cantidades D. mercadería pero  al poco tiempo su ingreso mejoro  por L. venta regular que obtenía. Este actual préstamo lo invertirá en L. compra D. su mercadería como es  3 cajas D. gaseosas, cajas D. galletas, caramelos, chicles,  embutidos  y cajas D. Yogurt.
Los planes que trae en mente son  D. poder inaugurar un Restaurante en una zona transcurrida por el público  y desD. luego ofrecerle una mejor vida a sus hijos
texts.en:
Carmen L. currently lives with the father of her 5 children, 3 of whom are still minors. She is 42 years old and is one of 8 members of the Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto group comprised of members that engage in various types of work. Carmen began selling AVON products (beauty products such as perfume, talcum powder and cologne). It took approximately 1 year for her to gain customers, during which time her income improved, and needing to buy products to sell, she had the opportunity to participate for the first time in Edaprospo, through a friend. She invested her first loan in buying more AVON products. She now sells food, sweets and sodas at a place she rented in a College of Education. Like with all business, she started with small quantities of merchandise, but her income soon improved due to regular sales. This current loan will be invested in the purchasing of merchandise: 3 cases of soda, boxes of cookies, candy, gum, sausages and boxes of yogurt. She has in mind plans to open a restaurant in an area where the public passes by and of course to offer a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3 cases of soda, cookies, candy, sausages and yogurt

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is very supportive of her family. She embroiders handkerchiefs and dresses which she sells at markets to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband is a security guard and one of her sons works in a factory. Khursheed couldn’t get an education because of her parents' poverty but she wants to give her children the best possible education. That is why she works very hard to be able to afford their school fees. 



She is applying for a loan to expand her embroidery business. She will make embroidered dresses and handkerchiefs in larger quantities to fill larger orders. She is hopeful that her good days are near and, with the help of investment in her business, her family will be able to live a better standard of life.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Faïssatou

texts.fr: A. Faïssatou est née le 29 Avril 1968 à Sakété, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Faïssatou est mariée à AMOUSSA Deen et est mère de deux enfants,tous scolarisés. Faïssatou vit depuis onze ans au quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Faïssatou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Faïssatou vend divers produits vivriers (maïs, farine de manioc, pâtes alimentaires, riz, conserves, tomates fraiches, etc.) à Abattoir, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Faïssatou achète ses produits à l'intérieur du pays. C'est la deuxième fois que Faïssatou sollicite un appui financier de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'élever le niveau de son activité. Faïssatou a bien remboursé le premier crédit reçu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Faïssatou A. was born on April 29, 1968 in Sakété, in the Department of Ouémé. Faïssatou is married to Deen Amoussa and they have two children who are in school. Faïssatou has lived in the Dandji quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, for the past eleven years, along with her husband and children. Together, the couple provides for the needs of the family. Faïssatou did not go to school. To meet her needs, Faïssatou sells assorted foodstuffs (maïze, manioc flour, pasta, rice, canned food, fresh tomatoes, etc.) in Abattoir, in the Sèmè-Podji commune. Faïssatou buys her stock in the interior of the country. This is the second loan that Faïssatou has requested from ALIDé; she wants to increase her working capital in order to finance an expansion of the business. Faïssatou repaid the first loan she received from ALIDé on time.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy maïze and manioc flour.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
A sus 28 años, Fernando se desempeña como presidente del grupo, el tiene una bodega donD. venD. diferentes productos, que le permiten aportar con los gastos en casa, Su objetivo es  alquilar un local más granD. donD. poder exhibir más productos.
Alicia es L. tesorera del grupo, y al igual que Fernando atienD. una bodega, además venD. cosméticos por catalogo, ElL. está embarazada y tiene que cuidar otro hijo, pero eso no es impedimento para que trabaje, Es por eso que se levanta temprano a atender su bodega y a su familia.
Nuestra secretaria Asucena es conviviente y tiene un hijo D. 4 años. Se dedica a L. venta ambulatoria D. diferentes rubros como comida y ropa en distintos lugares, Las ganancias obtenidas le permiten pagar sus gastos en casa. ElL. tiene como objetivo aperturar un tienda en casa, y obtener mayores ganancias. Los socios son responsables y puntuales con sus pagos y eso lo demuestran en su historial crediticio.
texts.en:
At 28 years old, Fernando has the role of president of this group in the communal bank. Fernando has a small market where he sells various products. The income from his business allows him to cover his household expenses. His goal is to rent a larger space where he'll be able to sell more products. Alicia is the treasurer of the group, and like Fernando she runs a small shop. She also sells cosmetics through catalog sales. Alicia is currently pregnant and also cares for her other child, but this is no impediment to her work. Every day she gets up early to tend to her business and her family. The group's secretary is Asucena. She lives with her husband and their 4 year old son. Asucena sells food and clothing in various locations around the city. The money she earns from her business helps her cover her household costs. Asucena would like to be able to open a shop in her home and grow her business and income. The members of the group are responsible and punctual with payments, which they've demonstrated with their good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in their respective businesses to help increase their sales and income

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: La señora Yanet A. se desempeña como Diseñadora de alta costura profesión que aprendió de su madre y estudios que realizo para poder perfeccionar sus trabajos. Ella cuenta con su propio taller al que le esta faltando una maquina con el nombre Recta para que sus trabajo queden mejor. Ella hace costuras de todo tipo como vestidos, pantalones, subir bastillas, poner cierres y más. Yanet y su esposo tienen una hija por la que quieren que tenga un mejor patrimonio y un buen estudio.
texts.en:
Yanet A. works as a high fashion designer. She learned this profession from her mother. She also studied to be able to perfect her work. She has her own shop. She needs a Recta sewing machine so that the clothing she makes fits better. She does all types of sewing like making dresses and pants, hemming, putting in zippers, and more. Yanet and her husband have a daughter, and they want her to have a better legacy and a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Touch C., 41 years old, has been selected as the group leader by 14 people seeking a group loan. The group is located in Kampong Luong village, Takeo province. Each member of the group will use a portion of the loan for a different purpose; all members will use the proceeds from the loan investment to support their families. Mrs. Touch C. and her husband, Mr. Ly K., are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice, which they sell. She also breeds pigs. Since her pig breeding is going well, she wants to expand. To improve her business, Mrs. Touch C. is applying for a loan to buy more pig food. She is the mother of four children: one is a farmer, while the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: El  Sr. Manuel de Jesús H. H.  él  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene  cuarenta y cinco años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales para la siembra de granos como maíz, sorgo, etc.  Los cuales  los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús H. H. works in agriculture. He has dedicated himself to this activity for 45 years. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL, and he has used them to buy supplies for planting grains such as corn, sorghum, etc. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited him greatly, because they have allowed him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for planting: urea, balanced fertilizer, a field plow

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Mr F. Adama est né le 27 Septembre 1967 à Aného. Il est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il entreprit de petites activités génératrices de revenus mais s’adonne finalement à la culture maraîchère, domaine lucratif dans lequel il arrive à s’en sortir. Il sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son jardin et aussi acheter des intrants agricoles. Ce qui lui permettra de donner de bons rendements et de disposer de revenus conséquents pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr F. Adama est né le 27 Septembre 1967 à Aného. Il est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il entreprit de petites activités génératrices de revenus mais s’adonne finalement à la culture maraîchère, domaine lucratif dans lequel il arrive à s’en sortir. Il sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son jardin et aussi acheter des intrants agricoles. Ce qui lui permettra de donner de bons rendements et de disposer de revenus conséquents pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et le bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: agrandir son jardin et aussi acheter des intrants agricoles

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita S. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Carmelita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rabbcan

texts.en: Rabbcan R. is currently in the business of selling food items at the market. She sells onions, tomatoes, cassava etc and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of onions to sell.  Rabbcan is 22 years old and widowed. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To stock more bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Diego Manuel

texts.es:
DIEGO MANUEL T. P., Trabajo como Contador en la facultad de Economía de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua
es padre de familia de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion ya que va ha cambiar el techo de su casa de habitcion.
texts.en:
Diego Manuel T. P. works as an accountant in the Economics faculty of the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.

He is father to two school-age children.

The loan which he is requesting will be used to buy building materials since he needs to replace the roof of his house.

loans.use: To improve his house by replacing his roof

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia Del Socorro tiene 52 años, su actividad es la venta de comida y transporte. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy satisfactorio para ella obtener un medio de ingreso para mantener a sus 4 hijos. Inicio por medio de su Mama quien era que tenía a cargo el negocio, con el paso del tiempo le enseño a Marcia todo lo necesario para que ella aprendiera a administrar su actividad, todos los días se esfuerza por proporcionar el mejor servicio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, verduras y leña.
texts.en:
Marcia Del Socorro, 52, sells food and provides transportation services.  She has had this business for over 11 years.  It has been a very satisfactory way for her to obtain a source of income to support her four children.

Her mother was the original owner of the business and as time went by she taught Marcia everything she needed to learn to run it.  Every day she makes the effort to provide better service.

The reason for the loan request is to buy basic grains, cooking oil, vegetables and firewood.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cooking oil, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
la señora Marcelina B. F. tiene 54 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de productos de plastico como ser platos, soperas, pailas, coladores, cucharas, baldes, vasos entre otros,  tambien vende ropa nueva. todos estos productos los vende en la ciudad de Nacaome y aldeas cercanas a esta ciudad. 
la señora Marcelina utilizara el credito para la compra de mercaderia y asi poder tener su negocio bien surtido para la epoca de navidad y asi poder mejorar sus ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, Marcelina es una señora de edad y esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcelina B. F. is 54 years old.  She sells plastic products such as plates, soup tureens, dishes, colanders, spoons, buckets, cups, etc.  She also sells new clothes.  She sells all her products in the city of Nacaome and nearby villages.

Marcelina will use her loan to buy merchandise and thereby have a well-stocked business for the Christmas period.  This will enable her to improve her sales.

Marcelina needs the profits from her business to cover her household expenses.  She is an older lady and this is is her only source of income.

loans.use: To buy clothes, sandals and plastic cooking utensils

loans.name: Marlene Yesenia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate.

Aquí conocimos a Marlene, ella tiene 32 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres en la cual vive en compañía  de tres hermanos. Estudia párvulo en una Universidad los días sabados y domingos. Trabaja en una guardería de lunes a viernes.

Además de esto se dedica a elaborar manualidades,  adornos y sorpresas  navideñas, estos productos los elabora a base de fomix, telas, esponja y otros productos, ella entrega pedidos de sus productos a la organización Plan Internacional y a personas en particulares. Trabaja de lunes a sábado en las noches ya que en las mañanas trabaja en la guardería.

Con este crédito  va a  comprar esponjas, pinturas, escarchas, fomix y otros materiales necesarios para elaborar sus productos. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la ayuda que brindan a personas como ella para sacar sus negocios adelante. Sus sueños son incorporarse, obtener un nombramiento de maestra y tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Virgen de Monserrate" meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds. 

Here we met Marlene who is 32 years old. She is single and lives at her parents' house with her three siblings. She studies child care at a university on Saturdays and Sundays and works at a nursery from Monday to Friday. 

She also does crafts and makes Christmas decorations and surprises. She makes these products using craft foam, fabric, sponges and other products. She delivers the orders for her products at the organization "Plan Internacional" and to individuals. She works from Monday to Saturday in the evenings since she works at the nursery in the morning. 

With this loan she will buy sponges, paints, glitter, craft foam and other materials necessary to make her products. She is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because of the help they provide to people like her to help their businesses succeed.
