Her dreams are to incorporate, obtain an appointment as a teacher and to have her own company.

loans.use: Buy sponges, paints, glitter, craft foam, etc.

loans.name: Charbel

texts.en: Charbel is a 43-year-old married man and father of one kid. Charbel has owned a restaurant since Jan 2010, with 15 years of experience in this field. Charbel made a good step by opening his own business in this unstable political and financial situation. His restaurant is located in an important tourist region, where clients visit him from different regions every day.  Charbel is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for some of the restaurant furniture such as refrigerators, chairs and tables. Charbel hopes to expand his business to an important and successful chain business and hopes his family will be satisfied with what they get.

loans.use: To pay for the restaurant furniture

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia E. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Efia sells palm oil at Abrafo near Abura, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a driver. Efia uses her income to pay for the needs of her family, together with her husband. She contributes to the paying of school fees, books and uniforms for their children who go to school. Efia will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits needed for the preparation of the oil she then sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efia plans to increase the well-being of her family. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education. Furthermore, she will reinvest some of the money back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to make palm oil.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman who lives in E.B. Magalona, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 4 business ventures: buying and selling dry goods, a general store, a piggery, and a farming business. Her husband Eugenio B., who is 61 years old years old, receives income from a pension.  They have 3 children between 25 and 33 years old – all are married. 

Martha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Martha has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Martha's previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks to sell so that she can continue to save for her family's future needs. Martha is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: María Geovana

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de cuatro y un años de edad. El marido trabaja en una fábrica de madera.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lleva cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que más vende son los perfumes.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal hace ya ocho ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son terminar su casa que aun la tiene inconclusa.
texts.en:
In a neighborhood known as "Las Piedras," in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank "Las Piedras" meets every 15 days.  Portoviejo is known for its cultural traditions, for the happiness of its people, and its San Pedro and San Pablo festivals.

Here we find Maria, who is 24 years old and who is in a common-law marriage from which she has 2 children, aged 4 and 1.  Her husband works in a wood factory.

She is a housewife who, in order to generate her own income, sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women.)  She works 3 days a week; she sells her products on credit and collects every week or every 15 days, according to her customers' wishes.  She has been doing this work for 5 years.  She receives her products in her house, and what she sells most are the perfumes.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products.  She has been with her communal bank from the start, for 8 loan cycles, and she likes it because of the additional benefits that the institution offers.  She dreams of finishing her house, which is still incomplete.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: 'in God We Trust' Group

texts.en:
Patricia M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'In God We Trust'. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children, 3 and 13 years old. Patricia holds an associate degree in Accountancy.

Patricia has been selling used clothes on Water Street, in Monrovia, Liberia, for 5 years. She plans to use her 8,000 LRD portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to buy more used clothes to resell. Patricia describes herself as a jovial woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta is a married woman who lives in Madredijos, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store and buying and selling dried fish. Her common-law husband Vergelio, who is 49 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  She has three children who are between 23 and 32 years old. Marieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Marieta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Alain Francis Ludovic

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alain Francis est âgé de 30ans, célibataire avec 1efant de 8ans qui s’appelle Grâce. Avec son niveau 3em, il se lance dans la vente des divers au marché en 1993 avec un capital de 5000F.
Il vends des produits suivants :bissap, farine, huile végétale, sucre , levure, sucre vanillé, colorants, sachets pour sky et glaces, arômes, maïs pour pop corn.
Ses ventes journalières sont  comprises entre 40.000F et 75.000F.
Avec le prêt, il va renforcer son activité en achetant :
1sac de bissap, 1sac de sucre, 1bidon d’huile, 1carton de différentes senteurs d’arômes, 5paquets d’emballage, 5bocales de différentes couleurs de colorants, 1sac de farine, 1/2sac de maïs pour pop corn.
En voulant toujours resté dans ce commerce, il veut devenir fournisseur et vendre les sacs de bissap et le maïs.
En gros afin d’être capable de prendre un prêt plus important à l’avenir et s’occuper valablement de son fils Grâce.
texts.en: Mr Alain Francis is a single 30 year old with one eight-year-old son called Grâce. He attended school up to fourth grade of secondary school, and began selling miscellaneous products at the market in 1993 with starting capital of 5000F.  He sells the following products: hibiscus, flour, vegetable oil, vanilla sugar, flavourings, and corn to make popcorn. His daily revenues are between 40,000 and 75,000F. He is aiming to boost his business by buying: one bag of hibiscus, one bag of sugar, one can of oil, one box of various flavourings, five packs of wrapping, 5 jugs of food colourings, one bag of sugar, 1/2 a bag of corn to make popcorn.   He would like to remain in the same line of work by becoming a wholesaler and sell bags of hibiscus and corn. He would like to take a larger loan out in future and look after his son Grâce.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar, flour, corn, hibiscus, flavourings, and packs of baking flour and vanilla sugar

loans.name: Viviana Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Viviana, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos niños de 12, 10 años  y un bebito de apenas 8 meses de nacido, los dos mayores están en escuela. Su marido es mecánico automotriz.
 
Ella es una gran madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos que ocasionan sus hijos y la familia se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa, en estos últimos meses mas a vendido en su casa ya que como su bebé esta pequeño no ha podido salir mucho pero a pesar de esto sus clientes la visitan. Su mercadería  la compra en Guayaquil y lleva cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal tres años y le gusta la ayuda y las facilidades que les otorga el  banco.

Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que vive arrendando.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Viviana in this place. She is 28 years old, in a common law relationship, and has two children (ages 12 and 10) and an eight month old baby. The two older children are in school. Her husband is an automobile mechanic.

Viviana is a good mother and homemaker who helps her husband with the expenses incurred by their children and their family by selling all types of clothing. She sells door-to-door and also from her home. In recent months, she has sold more from home because her baby is still little and she is not able to go out frequently. Despite her situation, her customers come to visit her. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil and she has been in this business for five years.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Viviana has been with the Communal Bank for three years and enjoys the assistance and services that have been provided. Her dream is to have her own home because she currently lives in a rental property.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Norie Belen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norie Belen works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling of "nipa" (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair).  Norie Belen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

 Norie Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that all her hard work will help her to attain her dream of having a fishing boat.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
Sustainability matters a lot in business and Katlyn R., 27, understands its importance. Being an entrepreneur at a relatively young age, Katlyn strives to do her best to improve her business and to provide for her two children who depend on her. One of her children is studying in elementary school, and the younger one is not yet of school age. Katlyn lives with them in Munting Ilog, Silang, Cavite.

Katlyn runs her own sari-sari (variety) store seling to people in her community.  She is able to balance both being an entrepreneur and a single mom. She also manages to attend weekly fellowships and trainings in CCT* as a community partner. Through her sari-sari store, Katlyn is able to serve her community by meeting their needs with quality and affordable products. Every month she earns around Php 7,000.

Because she is in need of help to empower her in sustaining her business, Katlyn decides to seek a loan Php10,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase quality brands for her store. She intends to buy sacks of rice, boxes of canned goods, instant noodles, and soft drinks which are sought after by customers in the hot weather of the country. Katlyn acknowledges that this loan will greatly help her in sustaining not just her business but also her family.

Like many micro entrepreneurs, Katlyn struggles with customers who do not pay their debt. But because her goal is to grow and become sustainable, she works on ways to handle this difficulty. Most of all, it is her ultimate goal to be able to provide schooling for her children up to college. 

As a CCT community partner, Katlyn faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional items for her variety store

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is from the village of Gampis, Sindangan. She is 58 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is still studying. 

To make a living, Magdalena has a dried fish business. She sells the dried fish herself, in the public market or to a buyer of dried fish. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Magdalena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, with which she will finance her dried fish business. 

This will be the fourth loan taken out by Magdalena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 
   
About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
   
Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to finance her dried fish business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Ana, es  comerciante, con más de nueve años en la venta de ropa y cosmético, gracias  a sus ventas a ayudado a su familia, a tener mejores condiciones económicas. Su esposo labora como conductor. Y su hijo menor cursa la primaria.
Ana inicio este negocio, con iniciativa propia y con poco capital, lo que vino a mejorar y aumentar con financiamiento que Afodenic, ha otorgado en cuatro ciclos. Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de ropa variada y cosmético, siendo de mucha demanda, el cual tiene pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is a merchant with more than nine years experience selling clothes and cosmetics.  Thanks to her sales she’s helped her family have better economic conditions.  Her husband works as a driver.  Her young son is in elementary school.

Ana started this business on her own initiative and with little capital that she improved with loans from Afodenic that she’s gotten in four cycles.  She will use this new loan to buy assorted clothes and cosmetics which are in high demand and for which she has pending customer orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Coparimiga Group

texts.fr: François est  agri-éleveur né au Rwanda. Il est membre du groupe COPARIMIGA. Il est marié, il  a 52 ans, il a 4 enfants entre 20 ans et 35 ans, il a 1 enfant va  à l’école,  il n’a aucune personne en charge. Il  a quatre ans des études primaires. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les engrais chimique  et payer la main d’œuvre. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’étendre le terrain cultivé pour augmenter la production. Sa vision il voudrait devenir le grand producteur du riz. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le frais du minerval pour son enfant et  payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en: François is a Rwandan agricultural producer.  He is a member of the Coparimiga Group.  He is married, 52 years old, and has four children between the ages of 20 and 35, of whom one attends school.  He does not look after any others as part of his household.  He has four years of primary education.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB and has not had any non-repayment troubles with his first loan.  He is going to use this loan to purchase chemical fertilizers and to pay labor costs.  His strategy for growing his business is to enhance the soil in order to increase production.  He would like to be become a large rice producer.  For his family he would like to pay the school fees for his child and pay his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a resident of Eldoret, North Rift Kenya where he has been doing his farming with the help of one other farmer. He has been in farming for 3 years producing maize, beans and milk. He also gets additional income from his formal employment. 

Wilfred has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Kiva's partner, Juhudi KiL., to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy business will generate more income to enable him to build a strong foundation for his family. He is focusing on buying better quality breeds and expanding his farm acreage. However he mentions poor market prices as the biggest challenge facing the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando, oriundo de Jorochito de Santa Cruz, no es casado pero tiene su pareja, tiene un solo hijo, su actividad es de draguero, saca del rio arena y piedra, para luego vender a las personas que venden material de construcción, su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que necesita de todas sus fuerzas, el sr. Orlando ahora el quiere incursionar en otro negocio para esto esta solicitando el  crédito para la compra de Patos y poder tener una granja de patos,   esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo para poder invertir en otro negocio que es en la crianza de patos obteniendo así otra fuente de ingreso y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is from Jorochito, in Santa Cruz.  He is not married but lives with his partner and has one child.  He works as a 'dredger', removing sand and stone from the river to then sell to people who sell construction supplies.  His work is very demanding as he needs all his strength.

Orlando would like to make inroads into another business.  For this reason, he is requesting this loan to buy ducks and set up a duck farm.  He is grateful to our institution for having placed our trust in him and given him the support he needs to invest in another business (raising ducks).  This will be another source of income for him and will provide him with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a duck farm

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 37 years old, married to a businessman and they have two children twelve years old and seven years old. She runs a retail shop in which she sells an assortment of goods including handkerchiefs, caps, belts, wallets and toys. She has been in this business for five years and has one employee. She says that the business is profitable and her major challenge is financial constraints.
 
She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy stock of handkerchiefs, caps, belts, wallets, toys etc. She hopes to grow her business, open other shops and provide employment opportunities to people. She also hopes to give her children quality education to the university level. She describes herself as honest and committed to her work.

loans.use: Handkerchiefs, caps, belts, wallets, toys etc

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is married with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sauda is 57 years old and has one child who is in school.

Sauda has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Sauda requested a 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

Sauda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Sauda would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a young man who is 23 years old. He operates a phone accessory shop, he has been in the business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD as his first loan and hopes to use the money to purchase more phone accessories. The profits will be used as savings for future investment.

He dreams of growing his business, even owning a wholesale accessory shop and improving his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories for his shop

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is married and stays with her husband and five children. Her husband is a farmer. She attended senior high school. Anita sells rice water (rice porridge) and meat pie at Krofofordo, which she has done for some time now. Anita supports her husband to feed their children. Anita will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar, flour, and other items to promote the sale of the food. With the new earnings, Anita plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, and other items for food sales

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en: Aqil is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and look after his cattle. He usually resells grown cattle for a profitable price at the livestock bazaar. His wife is a cleaner and her salary is too small to contribute to the family. Cattle breeding is the only source of income in his family and it brings in 250 USD per month. Aqil wishes to expand his business by purchasing calves and fodder for them. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan of 500 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase one calf and fodder

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Julieta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es: La señora Marcia es empleada, trabaja  en una empresa de telecomunicaciones como mensajera y como portera; con esta actividad cubre sus gastos. El crédito lo requiere para el pago  de estudios universitarios, pues necesita pagar la matricula y las mensualidades. Vive en las mismas instalaciones de su trabajo, donde existe un pequeño departamento, que queda ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casada y  tiene dos hijos. Marcia es cliente de Impro desde el año 2010 y esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcia is employed at a telecommunications company where she works as a messenger and as the building superintendent. This job helps to cover her expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for her university studies. Her tuition and monthly fees are due. Marcia lives on the company property where she has a small apartment. She resides in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. Marcia is married and has two children.

She has been a client of IMPRO since 2010 and this is the second time that her loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmela; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y pollos, ella los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como gallinas y chanchos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmela is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Carmela divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs and chickens. After the animals are grown and fattened, they are sold at the different fairs throughout Urubamba. Carmela works from 7am to 5pm. Through this business, she is able to grow her enterprise. She is requesting a loan to buy animals at wholesale, such as chickens and pigs.

Carmela is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
This is Redentor, 37, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is a widowed father of one child who is now studying in high school. By the grace of God, Redentor has managed to support his child’s schooling. He is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Redentor operates a tricycle transportation business. He has one tricycle (motorcycle with side car) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. His regular customers are his neighbors and members of the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 everyday.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for the maintenance of his tricycle and for the tricycle registration renewal. He expects a boost in income as he expands his business. 

Redentor dreams of sending his child to college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the bible he studies.* 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To maintain his tricycle and renew its registration for his business.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза мать-одиночка. Она разведена. Имеет на воспитании одну дочь. Для воспитания своей дочери она старается создать все условия, также  для хорошего обучения. На протяжении 10 лет она занимается купле- продажей мужской одежды. Товар она привозит из местных рынках. Сама имеет току на рынке. Бизнес востребованный, но для расширения бизнеса и дополнения новым товаром ей нужен займ. Она обращается к вам за помощью и надеется в вашей поддержке. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1700$ США для расширения товарооборота. Она надеется на помощь и благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a single mother. She is divorced and has one daughter in foster care. For her daughter's upbringing, she has been trying to create all of the conditions for a good education. For 10 years she has been engaged in buying and selling men's clothing. She obtains her goods from the local market. She has a stall in the market herself. Her business is in high demand, but in order to grow her business and add new products, she is requesting a loan. She is turning to you for help and hopes for your support. She would like to receive a loan of $1700 to grow her inventory. She is hoping for help and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Purchase new goods

loans.name: Devota

texts.en:
Devota is a married woman with 4 school going children. Her husband is an engineer who contributes to the family's  basic needs. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Devota has operated a water selling business for the past 4 years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of damaged pipes sometimes causing water loss. 

With a Kshs 50,000 loan Devota wants to purchase a water tank and construct another water storage facility for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and construct another water storage facility for her business.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling food in a hotel in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Achol has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 34 years old and is married to Martha. The couple has three children. For the last four years, Edward has been working as a carpenter and he earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his fourth loan. Edward has repaid his previous loan on time.

Edward is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy timber and more grooving, planing, and joining machines and to help educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase timber and carpentry machinery

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida is 59 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Placida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Placida requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Placida has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Placida would like to save enough money to build a grocery store in a public market.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 62 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 2 children. 
Editha is engaged in fish vending business and earns approximately PHP5,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan to be used in purchasing additional fishes to sell. 
Editha has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Editha hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional fishes to sell

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir runs small business importing clothing from Istanbul and selling it from a little building in the center of his town. He takes care to arrange everything into attractive displays. The business is going well, but Vladimir has decided to move his operation to a nearby town where he could use a building owned by his mother and thus save on rent costs. There he hopes to also offer a greater variety of items, but first he says he will see how things go with what he sells now. He needs a loan to make the move and re-stock his inventory.

loans.use: Moving business to a new location

loans.name: Sauaso

texts.en:
One of the major products from plantations in Samoa is cocoa. Most families in Samoa use cocoa beans daily to produce cocoa for tea. In most households, Samoan cocoa is a delicacy, which is served at breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Due to the high demand for cocoa in the daily lives of Samoans, Sauaso specializes in manufacturing cocoa from cocoa beans. She caters to local residents as well as the overseas market. 

Sauaso is dedicated and has talent, but she is unable to increase the size of her business because she lacks financial resources.  She is applying for a loan of $800 to expand her inventory of cocoa beans.

loans.use: to purchase more cocoa beans for upgrading her stock.

loans.name: Rogayah

texts.en: Rogayah is 35 years old and is married with two children; the eldest is a boy, while the younger one is a girl. Her husband, Amir is a pedicab driver, earning $2 a day. To supplement her husband’s income, Rogayah runs a business selling Indonesian traditional salad called “gado-gado” in the morning and also selling various snacks in the afternoon at her small kiosk. Rogayah can earn revenue of $7 a day. Rogayah has been member of MBK for almost two years. She needs additional working capital of $100 so that she can expand her business, and thus more or less double her income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: "I am delighted to be engaged in the sale of WAEC scratch cards, forms and rechargeable cards for people through wholesale. With this business, I was able to pay my child's school fees and take care of myself,"says Christy O..  She is 45 years old, married, and has one child. She hopes to expand her business with the above loan, i.e., buying more rechargeable cards and scratch cards. She is from Benin City, Edo State.

loans.use: To buy WAEC scratch cards, forms and rechargeable cards

loans.name: Lisandra

texts.en:
Lisandra is 23 years old and has a four-year-old son. She lives in Carapeguá, Paraguay with her partner Jorge Avalos,with whom she has lived for the past 5 years. Jorge contributes to the family income by selling household appliances.

When Lisandra was a younger, her tough family situation compelled her to leave Paraguay and her family in search of work in neighboring Argentina. After 1 year she decided to return and form a family of her own. For two years, with the help of her partner Jorge, they have run a store where they sell clothing and footwear. They have begun to sell their goods around the town on a moving stand. Today Lisandra has established a formal client base with whom she meets on a weekly basis.

This business was formed as part of a group of micro-enterprises called New Hope. The organization is run out of Carapeguá. Here they are able to generate a saving of 10% of what is earned on money borrowed. Lisandra has asked for a loan to purchase new stock for her business including seasonal clothing and footwear.

loans.use: To purchase new stock for her seasonal clothing and footwear business.

loans.name: Adozinda Luis

texts.pt:
Adozinda Luis X., 35 years of age, holder of ID Card No. 110032261P, a native and resident of Maputo in the Magoanine neighborhood, 9th Quarter, House no. 45, unmarried but living with a partner, has 3 children and lives in her own home. She entered the program on March 29, 2006, and is in her 3rd cycle. She started as part of a group, taking an initial loan of 1,800 MT. She left the group and is now seeking an individual loan of 6,000 MT to be repaid in 5 months. She sells wrap skirts and blouses. She plans to use the loan to expand the business by purchasing more products, clothing, purses, etc. She is a traveling saleswoman.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Adozinda Luis X. , de 35 anos de Idade, Portadora do BI nº110032261P, natural de Maputo Residente na Cidade de Maputo no Bairro Magoanine Quarteirão 9 casa nº 45 ,não casada mais vive maritalmente, tem 3 filhos, entrou no projecto a 29/03/06 vive em casa propria esta no 3º ciclo e entrou primeiro como elemento de um grupo tamando no principio 1800 e sai do grupo agora toma individualmente vai tomar 6000 para pagar em 5 meses ela Vende capulanas , Blusas , Com o valor ela pretende Ampliar o negocio comprando mais produtos roupas , carteiras etc.o seu tipo de Negocio e Vendedora Ambulante.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina Manani de Gutiérrez is married and a mother of 4 children. She belongs to the Buen Corazon of Villa Adela Association. She sells food. She prepares all types of native dishes. She has 20 years of experience in this field. She learned to cook from a very early age. She used to help her mother prepare all sorts of delicious dishes.

At this time, Justina attends the local fairs that take place in the various towns across the state of La Paz. One of her main objective is to attend specialty fairs such as Andean tourist fairs and seafood fairs, etc.

Justina would like to purchase all the food ingredients necessary to make her delicious dishes so that she is able to attend these specialty fairs. This is her only way to make money and pay for her bills.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Justina Manani de Gutiérrez, casada y madre de 4 hijos, pertenece a la asociación Buen Corazón de Villa Adela, es comerciante de comida, prepara todo tipo de platos de la gastronomía nacional. Ya son más de 20 años de experiencia en el rubro, este es un oficio que aprendió desde muy chica, cuando ayudaba a su madre en la preparación de tanta variedad de platos. Hoy en día, Justina tiene presencia en las principales ferias de especialidad, que se llevan a cabo en distintos pueblos y provincias del Departamento de La Paz. Uno de sus objetivos es participar de las ferias turísticas andinas, y en distintas ferias tanto del pescado, como de otras especialidades. Para este objetivo Justina precisa de capital, para poder costear los gastos de participación y compra de insumos, solo de esta manera podrá generar los ingresos necesarios y consolidar convenios importantes.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Kireka A3(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Miriam Nanonjo. She rears poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to purchase more poultry feed. Miriam is a 44-year-old widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 11 to 28 and her children go to school. Each week, Miriam makes approximately UGX 40,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her childrens' education. Miriam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400,000, which she invested in her business. The loan was paid back on time.

Miriam is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Safina N., Sofia N., and Nulu N.. Prossy N. makes and sells food in a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to expand her canteen business. Safina N., Sofia N. and Nulu N. sell charcoal and are requesting loans of UGX 500,000,UGX 400,000 and UGX 600, 000 respectively to add stock to their businesses.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business

loans.name: Wandema

texts.en: Wandema  is 28 years old and is married.  Wandema began selling soft drinks in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $ 270 from her sales.  Wandema now hopes for a loan to buy more  items for her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Koudzo

texts.en:
Mr. Koudzo A. is 33 years old and the father of 4 children. He runs a general store in Aventonou, a small village about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. This proximity to the capital facilitates frequent trips back and forth to restock his store.

Mr. A. hopes to use this loan to buy 15 bags of rice, 10 bags of powdered sugar, 10 bottles of cooking oil, 15 cartons of milk, and 20 cartons of canned goods to resell in Aventonou. He hopes that these purchases this will help to boost his sales so that he can support his family and provide for his community.

loans.use: To buy 15 bags of rice, 10 bags of powdered sugar, 10 bottles of cooking oil, 15 cartons of milk, and 20 cartons of canned goods

loans.name: Sabra's Tujiwunjane Moyo Group

texts.en:
Sabra, aged 23, is single and runs a charcoal and chapati business, where she sells these items from 6am to 6pm daily. From this business, which she started in February 2007, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $27.

Sabra hopes for a loan to purchase more charcoal and chapati ingredients. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members belong to the group, Tujiwunjane Moyo. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and chapati ingredients

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen has had a workshop for making footwear for 20 years. The idea was her husband’s, who takes charge of the production of the shoes.

In their workshop which makes use of diverse machines, Carmen and her husband have 3 employees who manufacture around 20 dozen shoes per week. She is dedicated to distributing them to the markets.

The loan that she has requested will serve to buy leather, threads, and linings, among others basic materials, for the making of shoes.

Carmen would like to enlarge her workshop, to sell in more provinces and to improve the quality of her shoes.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen tiene un taller de confecciones de calzados desde hace 20 años. La idea fue de su esposo, quién se encarga de la fabricación de los zapatos.

En su taller implementado con diversas máquinas, Carmen y su esposo tienen 3 empleados quienes fabrican alrededor de 20 docenas de zapatos a la semana. Ella se dedica a repartirlos a los mercados.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado han servido para comprar cuero, hilos, forros, entre otros materiales básicos para la confección de zapatos.

Carmen quisiera agrandar su taller, vender en provincias y mejorar la calidad de su zapatos.

loans.use: To buy materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som S. makes Cambodian cakes and then sells them in her village, earning approximately $2.50 per day. Her cakes are popular so her business is growing. Her husband is a construction worker as well as a motorcycle taxi driver and makes about $5 per day. They have six children and live in Khsom Village, Kandal Province. 

Transportation is difficult so she is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for use by her family. The loan will allow the family to reduce their expenses. The picture is of S.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for use by her family

loans.name: Lourdes Lucila

texts.es:
Lourdes’ merit is that she is always looking for business opportunities, and more than a year ago she noticed the necessity for milk among her neighbors, and therefore she contacted a person who owns a milk cow to buy milk and resell it from house to house, and now she has clients who consume one liter daily and due to her honesty and service she is constantly increasing her clientele. She is very pleased with her income; she sells up to 30 liters daily, preferably in the afternoon. Her motivation is to improve in order to fulfill her children’s needs. It is her dream to open a dairy store and therefore she requests a loan to buy more milk and other dairy products to sell to her customer.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes tiene la cualidad de estar buscando constantemente oportunidades de negocio, hace mas de uno año percibió la necesidad de leche entre sus vecino, por lo cual, se contactó con una persona que tiene una vaca lechera, le compra a ella y luego reparte la leche de casa en casa, logró así adquirir clientes fijos que consumen diariamente un litro de leche, la honestidad y calidad con que ella atiende le permite adquirir cada vez más clientes. Está muy contenta porque ha logrado obtener las ganancias requeridas, vende hasta 30 litros diarios, preferentemente en las tardes, su motivación está en superarse para que sus hijos tengan lo necesario. Su deseo es abrir una tienda en donde venda exclusivamente productos lácteos, por ello, solicita un préstamo, para obtener mayor cantidad de leche y comprar otros productos lácteos para la venta.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of milk sold and purchase other dairy products.

loans.name: Bertha Oralia

texts.es:
Bertha started her business because she wanted to feel like a useful person and give herself the opportunity of experiencing new challenges and obtaining an extra income that would allow her to take good care of her son. She divorced his father, and the money they had didn't cover all of their expenses. She had to opt to start a business that would allow her to obtain an extra income to give her son better living conditions and at the same time improve herself in a personal manner.

She started selling cosmetics in the month of April, 2005, thanks to the invitation of a friend that organized a demonstration of skin care products in her house. She liked the products and started to sell them among her friends and neighbors. Currently she is a consultant with more experience, but her goal is to become a director, to be in charge of various consultants, and to be able to earn incentives like trips and cars that are offered to those who reach certain goals.

She needs a loan of $775, which she will repay in 5 months, to be able to supply her clients' orders and to continue satisfying her product needs in an opportune manner. With your support, Bertha will accomplish her goal!

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Bertha inició el negocio porque quería sentirse una persona útil y darse la oportunidad de experimentar nuevos retos y obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que se divorció del padre de su hijo y la pensión que les daba no les alcanzaba para todos los gastos, por lo que tuvo que optar por iniciar un negocio que le permitiera obtener un ingreso extra para darle a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida y al mismo tiempo superarse de manera personal. Comenzó con la venta de cosméticos en el mes de Abril de 2005 gracias a la invitación de una amiga que organizó una demostración de los productos en su casa acerca del cuidado de la piel. Le gustaron los productos y empezó a venderlos entre sus vecinas y amigas, en la actualidad es consultora con mas experiencia pero su meta es llegar a ser Directora y tener a su cargo varias consultoras y poder ganar los incentivos que le ofrecen como viajes y carros a los que cumplen con determinadas metas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $775 que pagara en 5 meses para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y seguir satisfaciendo sus necesidades de productos de manera oportuna. Con tu apoyo Bertha lograra alcanzar su meta!!.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur (his relative is pictured) is single man. He was born in 1981. Zaur and his relative have been in the business of building houses for 6 years. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary materials for building the houses.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for building the houses

loans.name: Francisca Diojana

texts.es:
Francisca A. se dedica desde hace 22 largos años al negocio de venta de queso el cual comercializa con mucho entusiasmo en el mercado central de Chinandega donde es originaria.

Sus inicios fueron muy duros por lo qeu vendía pocas cantidades de queso y por ende poseía poca cantidad de ingresos. Sin embargo desde que comenzó a hacer uso de los créditos brindados en Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su situación y hoy en dia se ha perfilado como excelente comerciante en el mercado. Una vez mas acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera mejorar la condición de su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca A. has worked for the past 22 years selling cheese which she sells with great enthusiasm in the central market of Chinandega, her native town. Her first years were very difficult as she sold very little cheese; therefore, she earned very little income. However, once she started to make use of the loans available through Ceprodel, she has been able to improve her situation and now she stands out as an excellent salewoman in the market. Once again, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan in order to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy products

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
With his skills in carving and carpentry, Edgar started up his own furniture shop.  Since their community is situated in a mountainous place, soft woods which he used in making furniture are available.

For almost ten years in his business, he always makes his customers satisfied with his work.  Most of his finished products include wooden chairs, tables, cabinets, drawers, dining tables, living room show cases and other wooden sets. 

To further improve his business, he is hoping to borrow Php5, 000.00 as additional working capital.  He intends to buy soft woods, varnish, sandpaper that he needed in making furniture to meet the orders of his customers not only in their community but also in other places. 

According to Edgar, he considers every piece of furniture as a masterpiece of his skilful hands. He always gives his best to improve the quality of furniture he is offering to his customers.  He dreams that through his business, he can support the education of his four children until they reach college.

loans.use: Additional working capital (buy soft woods, varnish, sand paper)

loans.name: Anani Latévi

texts.fr:
Monsieur L. Anani Latévi est né en 1970 à Aného, il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Son rêve est de devenir le plus grand des menuisiers de sa localité. Aujourd’hui le manque  de bois et de planches reste un handicap sérieux à la réussite de cet homme plein d’ambitions. 
Aussi voudrait-il commander de bois et de planches lui-même afin de répondre aux nombreuses sollicitations des clients. Les moyens financiers faisant défaut, il demande un financement pour passer cette commande dans les fermes et villages environnants afin de fidéliser ses clients actuels et rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Anani Latévi L. was born in 1970 in Aného. He is married and the father of four children. His dream is to become the primary carpenter in his neighborhood. Today, this ambitious man's success is hindered by a lack of wood and boards. He would like to order wood and boards himself in order to address the numerous requests of his clients. Since financial means are lacking, he is requesting a loan to place orders in surrounding farms and villages and earn the loyalty of his current customers, thus making his business more profitable.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wood and boards for carpentry

loans.name: Firpuz

texts.ru: Зайниддинов Фирпуз житель Вахшского района. Возраст 22 года, но несмотря на это имеет шестилетний стаж работы в сфере животноводства. Покупает молодых бычков  , откармливает их и затем продает на рынке. Весь процесс занимает около 50 дней . Бизнес дает неплохой доход, но сейчас в связи с зимой цены на животных упали и он хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить бычков подешевле , а весной он сможет их выгодно продать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Firpuz Z. lives in the Vahshad region. He is 22 years old and despite a young age has six years experience in the animal husbandry. He buys young calves, feeds them and then resells on the market. All this process takes about 50 days. This business provides good income, and at this time due to winter the prices for cattle have fallen and he wants to get a loan to buy calves at a cheaper price. In the spring he will be able to sell them and make profit. He will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Francisca Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Teresa G. C., integra el Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Cursó hasta el tercer grado de primaria, no continuó estudiando porque no tuvo apoyo familiar.
Se casó de 25 años y tiene 3 hijos, los que son independientes, los tres trabajan fuera del hogar.
Francisca trabaja vendiendo cerdos, los compra y los vende, también elabora tejidos los que vende en tiendas grandes de Trujillo.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en la compra de cerdos.
Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en la compra de un cerdo y lana para tejer.
Francisca desea tener un centro de comercio muy grande.
texts.en:
Mrs Francisca Teresa Gomez C., is member of the community bank Jesus Nazareno of the Agallpampa district in the Otuzco province of the department La Libertad Peru. She attended school through the third year of primary school and did not continue because she did not have support from her family. She married at 25 years of age and has 3 children, who are independent and work outside the home. Francisca works in the sale of pigs, she buys and sells them, and she also makes knitted items which she sells in the large stores of Trujillo. Her first loan was of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, and which she invested in the purchase of pigs. This loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, will purchase one pig and knitting yarn. Francisca wishes to have a large commercial establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs for her business and also knitting yarn.

loans.name: Carmen Martha

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Jesús D. Praga.
Carmen es casada, tiene 47 años, tiene cinco hijos 31, 29, 27,  23 y 17 años que estudia ingles.
Hace cinco años Carmen y su esposo tienen un puesto D.  ferretería en el mercado  asociación señor D. justicia por pista nueva, allí venD. toda clase D. herramientas, su esposo D. Carmen brinda servicios D.  gasfiteria.
Carmen necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para la compra D. herramientas D. segunda. 
DesD. que esta en Finca pueD. comprar mas mercadería, aprendió a ahorrar, ha no gastar mas D. lo que no tiene. 
El sueño D. Carmen es que su negocio crezca y abrir una bodega
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank Jesús D. Praga. Carmen is married and she is 47 years old. She has 5 children that are ages 31, 29, 27, 23 y 17. Her youngest child studies English. Five years ago Carmen and her husband started selling tools at a stand in a marketplace. There they sold all types of tools. Her husband also offers plumbing services. Carmen needs a loan of $500 (1,600 Soles) to be able to purchase secondhand tools to sell. Since Carmen has been in the group Finca she has been able to buy more merchandise and she has learned to save and to no spend more that necessary. Carmen's dream is that her business grows and that he is able to open a store.

(Translated by Serena of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carmen needs a loan of $500 (1,600 Soles) to be able to purchase secondhand tools to sell.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.es: Asteria tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos quienes le ayudan mucho. Se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo en un puesto de uno de los mercados de su ciudad, en esta actividad ya lleva un periodo de 18 años, y su trabajo siempre lo desempeñó sola, ya que no cuenta con ayudantes. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que sus clientes confían mucho en ella y en la calidad de la carne que vende, además le es muy rentable porque aparte ofrece presas de pollo sazonadas y listas para la parrilla a algunos recreos turísticos de su zona, y está contenta con su negocio porque le va muy bien. En el futuro Asteria quiere tener un local propio y vender tranquilamente como hasta ahora, pero ahorrando el gasto por el alquiler de su puesto. Este es su 11avo préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque tienen mucha comunicación y los problemas que se presentan siempre se resuelven con diálogo y siguen adelante. Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos, además de pagar algunos gastos de la educación de sus hijos, a quienes quiere ver profesionales.
texts.en:
Asteria is 45 years old, a single mother who lives with her two kids who help her a lot. She dedicates herself to selling chicken from a stall in one of the markets of her city. She has been doing this for 18 years and she has always done it alone as she does not have any assistants. What she likes about her work is that the clients trust her and the quality of meat that she sells a lot, as well as the fact that it is profitable because she also offers seasoned chicken pieces ready to be grilled in the touristy area, and she is happy because her business is going well. In the future Asteria wants to have her own store and to sell at her own pace as she does now, but saving up the money she would be spending on rent. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she likes working with her communal bank group because they communicate a lot and the problems that come up are always resolved by speaking about them and moving forward. She will invest the solicited money in buying chicken in bulk, as well as paying some of her kids' educational costs, as she wants them to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: Mamlakat B., 39, married with three children, lives in Khhujand where she has sold a good assortment of menswear and shoes procured from Istaravshan for the past four years.  She is now requesting a loan of 1200 STJ for one month to replenish her stock and to import the new seasonal wares.  Mamlakat thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To import new seasonal wares.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 49  años, es viuda y vive con 2 D. sus hijos. DesD. su niñez se dedica al cultivo D. la tierra, siempre ayudó a sus padres en estas tareas, y en la actualidad sigue trabajando, pero con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Rebeca se alegra porque esta actividad mantiene unida a su familia a pesar D. que es un trabajo duro, pero es recompensado, y con las ganancias mantiene los gastos D. su familia. Para Rebeca lo más importante es la unidad familiar, y seguirá con sus planes a futuro D. impulsar, poco a poco, un negocio  más rentable. Es la segunda vez que Rebeca tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete una vez más, a trabajar para que las relaciones interpersonales D. su grupo sean armoniosas y solidarias. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra D. sacos D. abono para la preparación D. sus tierras D. cultivo en la próxima campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a 49-year-old widow who lives with two of her children. She has been working in agriculture ever since childhood. She always used to help her parents in farming, and she is still in that business today, but she now has the help of her children. Rebeca is happy because this business keeps her family united. Despite the fact that it is hard work, it has its rewards; with her earnings, she is able to cover the family expenses. For Rebeca, the most important thing is family unity, and she will continue with her plans to promote, little by little, a more lucrative business. This is the second time that Rebeca requests a loan from MFP, and she is committed to once again work hard so that her group can have harmonious and supportive interpersonal relationships.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Dorjdagva

texts.en:
Dorjdagva S. lives with his wife and three sons in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest son is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and the other two sons are local high school students.

With his wife, Dorjdagva runs a small business bartering clothes. He often drives and visits herder families in the countryside and trades women's and men's clothing in exchange for animals such as sheep and goats. He tries to select clothes and household items that are in the greatest demand. Once he has successfully traded for the animals, he slaughters them and his wife sells them in small pieces at the local market. Sometime he buys animals for cash. In the future, he would like to open a wholesale section at the local market for animals and meat-related products. He requests a loan to purchase animals at cheap prices.

loans.use: To purchase animals

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling metal and metal-related products in the local community. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They live in the city of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Grace has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Grace is now requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional metal products to sell

loans.name: Jesús Misericordioso Group

texts.en:
Nilsa V. started this committee and invited her friends and neighbors to be part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs.  

 1	 Silvia V. - Cake sales
 2	 Digna Ramona V. - Food sales
 3	 Rocio Rosalina R. D. - Small grocery store
 4	 Norma Beatriz O. - Clothing sales
 5	 Mirian Estela S. - Toy and clothing sales
 6	 Sandra Catalina M. - Nursery
 7	 Maria Graciela S. - Silver jewelry sales
 8	 Maria Teresa P. - Small grocery store
 9	 Lucila S. - Vegetable and cosmetics sales
10	Clemencia P. - Vegetable sales
11	Natalia S. - Cosmetics sales
12	Maria Isabel O. - Cosmetics sales
13	Maria Fatima V. - Purse sales
14	Antonia Catalina G. - Clothing sales
15	Angelina F. - Fruit sales
16	Martha R. - Clothing sales
17	Benita F. - Cosmetics sales

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell or of raw materials

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
“Through sacrifices and patience we are able to improve our way of living,” said Elma O., who is now 53 years old and is happily married to Erwin O.. Elma manages a little store that is commonly called a “sari-sari store”. Aside from that she sells salted eggs by going to the houses of her neighbors to further generate income. 

Elma is grateful because they are blessed with two loving children namely: Erma - 30 years old and now working abroad; and Sherwin - 22 years old who just graduated from a vocational course.

Wanting to increase the commodities available in her store, she decided to request a PHP 5,000 loan from Kiva. She is hoping that Kiva will help her to reach her dream which is to make their living better.

loans.use: To increase the commodities available in her store

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo K. learned the skill of distilling white wine from her grandparents. In 2005, she used her skill to begin making wine to earn a living. She can make around 10 liters of wine a day which sells at 2,000 riels per liter. In addition, she uses the remaining rice after distilling wine to feed a few pigs to sell.

Mrs. Keo K. is married with one lovely young daughter who studies in primary school. She is looking for capital and requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to be used to buy additional rice for distilling wine.

loans.use: To buy additional rice for distilling wine

loans.name: Erma Yrene

texts.en:
Erma is 42-years old and married with four children. Three of them are now independent. Erma dedicates herself to a variety of business ventures including selling drinks and cooked food from her home, and also selling clothes which she brings from the capital Lima. Erma’s husband works in the Army Intelligence Service.

Erma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Dalinas II.” She used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) for her food business. Erma plans to use this loan of 1,600 soles for two purposes. She will invest part of it in purchasing clothing for sale. She will use the remainder to buy a special cart for making “salchipapas” (hot dogs and french fries), which she will sell from the front porch of her home in the evenings.

Thanks to the help of loans from Manuela Ramos, Erma has not only been able to invest in her business ventures, but has also finished constructing her home. Erma’s goal is to someday have her own soda fountain.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and a special cart for making "salchipapas" (hot dogs and french fries)

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 54-year-old married woman with 4 children.

Fatmeh has been working as a home-based tailor since 1990 to help her husband in the household and provide better life conditions for her children.

Today, Fatmeh is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise and tools for her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and tools.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia C. is from the city of Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Lucia owns and operates a transportation business operating a pedicab. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao H., age 40 (available in the picture with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Sophea Chea, age 40, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn City. They have been married since 1999 and have four children: one son who has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. And three daughters, two of them are in school and other one is still young.
 
Mao just started her business-selling fruits for one month. Her husband has been a chef for seven years. Mao is asking for her first loan of $500 to repair her motorbike and connect electricity from an electricity service to use in the family.

loans.use: To repair her motorbike and connect electricity from an electricity service to use in the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Railway Quarter A 2 Rajab Nusura Group

texts.en: Rajab N. is a hardworking businesswoman, and a widow with four children.  Two of her children attend school and she also supports the schooling of two orphans. She operates a restaurant and has been doing so for over seventeen years. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional supplies for her restaurant. She really wants to increase her daily profits. She is active and her dreams are to grow her business, educate her children, and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Joepet Jade

texts.en:
Joepet Jade D. is from the city of Las Aguadas, Ozamiz City. He is 25 years old. Joepet Jade is single. To make a living, Joepet Jade owns and operates a business providing motorcycle passenger transport as a "habal-habal" in the local community. Joepet Jade has been in business for mor than one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Joepet Jade joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joepet Jade is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used purchase spare parts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joepet Jade from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Peterscott

texts.en:
Peterscott is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom are attending school. He is a water vendor in the Kayole area of Nairobi. He's been in business for over three years and has three employees. He also earns some income as a caretaker. He requested his first loan from Faulu for Kes. 30,000 to buy handcarts and jerry cans. 

He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious and says that he hopes to increase his current business and expand into farming. In the future, he hopes to be a big farmer.

loans.use: Buy a handcart & jerry cans

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 10 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la elaboración de panes.
Julia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar harina, azúcar, manteca y leña.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave, mejorar su negocio y tener su horno propio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the communal bank "Gran Poder" for 10 years. She is from the Llave district in the El Collao district of the Puno department. She is 26 years old, married, and has 2 children. She completed her primary education and is a baker.

She is requesting a loan of S/. 2,000 ($700) with which she will buy flour, sugar, butter and firewood.

Her dream for the future is to have her own house in Llave, improve her business, and have her own oven.

What she likes most about the communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, butter, and firewood

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FAtou D. est âgée de 58 ans, elle est divorcée et mère de 06 enfants dont elle a l'entière charge. Elle est membre de Banc Village depuis le 25 août 2001. Elle fait du commerce de poisson frais; elle achète son produit en gros et revend au détail dans son village. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge la nourriture, la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 58-year-old divorced mother of six children of which she is the sole caregiver. She has been a member of the Banc Village since August 25, 2001. She sells fresh fish; she buys her product wholesale and then retails them in her village. Her earnings allow her to pay for the food, education and healthcare of her children.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her fish-selling business

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum T. is 59 years old and lives in Trapeang Reang village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a piece of land for cultivating rice. On the farm, they now face a problem because they do not have cows to plow the field. Mrs. Sum T. decided to apply for 2,400,000 Riel to buy two cows to support the field. 

Mrs. Sum T. is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory while another is a waiter in the restaurant and the youngest one is a student in local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Leonida's Group

texts.en:
Leonida B., age 61, is from the village of Manaring. She is married and has children. Leonida is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered through ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Leonida's name is the official name of this borrowing group.

To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling breads, cakes, and cookies to members of the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Leonida is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her baked products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked products for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. sells toiletries, provisions, and soft drinks at Elmina. Esi has received a senior-high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a fisherman. Esi has been selling toiletries, provisions, and soft drinks for some time now. She supports her husband in the payment of accommodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy pork and other meat as additional goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to complete her building.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy pork and other meat as additional goods to sell

loans.name: Elhadji

texts.fr: Elhadji est une homme de 45 ans, marié avec 2 enfants. Il habite a Ziguinchor, la plus grande ville dans la region de Casamance, au Senegal. Elhadji est une vendeuse de bois, une métier il a fait pour les dix dernieres années. Le bois qu’il vend est tres bon pour les meubles, les portes et les fenetres. Avec ce prêt de Kiva il voudrait stocker plus de bois et grandir son affaire
texts.en:
Elhadji, aged 45, is married and the father of two children. He lives in Ziguinchor, the largest city in the region of Casamance in Senegal. Elhadji is a retailer of lumber, a job he has done for the past ten years. The lumber he sells is perfect for furniture, doors and windows. Elhadji will use his Kiva loan to stock up with lumber and expand his business.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Palmier Plus Group

texts.en:
Jean Jacques N. is the leader of the 37-member group named “Palmier Plus” which means “Palm tree” in English. The group has formed in order to apply for  Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
