Jean Jacques has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1996. He runs a drugstore in the west of Kinshasa and has acquired solid experience in this area. He works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large drugstore in his community. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that currently earns him $200 per month. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts to achieve his goals. Mike is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having received and correctly repaid four loans. He will increase his stock of medicines with his next loan, re-selling them at a profit. Jean Jacques is 39 and married with six children, two of them in school.

loans.use: increasing the drugstore’s stock by buying medicines reselling them at profit.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a businesswoman. She has a piggery where she rears pigs for commercial purposes. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children and she is 55 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more feed to boost her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more feed to boost her business

loans.name: Koumba

texts.fr:
Madame Koumba B.  est une femme marée de 35ans qui vit  dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses quatre  enfants  dans le quartier Est de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région administrative de la république  Mali. 
Koumba fait de l’achat stockage vente de céréales. 
Pour augmenter son capital et faire plus de stocks, elle décida  d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Après dix  prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés, elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 400  kilogrammes de petit mil, 1000  kilogrammes de mil. 
Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de Kolondièba les jours de foire et revend aux grossistes venant de Bamako et Sikasso, au comptant.
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour renforcer le capital de l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs Koumba B., aged 35, is a married woman who lives in a monogamous family with her husband and her four children in the eastern outskirts of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Koumba buys cereals, then stocks and resells them. She wants to increase her working capital and her inventory, which is why she joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having repaid on schedule her previous ten solidarity loans, she applies now for her first individual loan. She will use her loan to buy 400 kilograms of small millet and 1000 kilograms of regular millet. She gets her supplies at the market in Kolondièba and resells for cash to wholesalers coming from Bamako and Sikasso. Koumba expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs which she will reinvest in her business to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Georgie

texts.en:
Georgie E. S. is from the village of San Jose. He is 49 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell and has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years. He earns approximately $200 a month from these activities.

In 2005, Georgie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Georgie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be his 10th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase her cultivable land and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina B., 44 years old, is from the city of Tagbilaran. She is married and has eight school-aged children. Her husband is a carpenter and a Barangay Official. To make a living, Celerina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $115 a month for these activities.

Celerina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 2nd loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Eleda

texts.en:
Eleda is 53 years old and has four children.  The youngest are in school and the eldest are married.  She has cattle and sells milk and a few foods, such as beans, that she gets from her garden.

Eleda works with her husband. She has been in this business for over 20 years. With the loan, she hopes to expand her milk business and buy more food products to sell. She plans to work hard and make enough profits to buy a house.

loans.use: Expand milk business and buy more food to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI IV  est composé 10  de femmes mariées du village de  Ziekan de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 7 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ziekan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
ALIMA D. compte utiliser pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI IV is a group of ten married women from the Ziekan village located in the San prefecture, in Ségou, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families. They average 35 years of age and seven children, and they grow peanuts. Eager to make their farming businesses profitable, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI three years ago. Having repaid their two previous loans without incident, they are seeking a third campaign loan. D. ALIMA plans to use the loan to purchase a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small farming equipment and input materials at the main market in Kimparana. After the rainy season, the crops will be stored for a while so that their value may increase before being sold in Kimparana, M'peresso and neighboring markets at retail (often wholesale), for cash, usually to customers from the big cities. Once their products are sold, the group members expect to each make a profit of 25,000 to 45,000F CFA, which will be used to cover the loan interest and the families’ daily expenses.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small farming equipment, inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda L. is from the village of Promiseland, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Linda is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Linda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products like home-made sausages or longganisa in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Linda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Linda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food products for sale

loans.name: Khalida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Khalida Perveen is 40 years old lady who lives in a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore in a three room brick house for the last 17 years with her husband and a ten years old daughter who is studying in 2nd grade. 
She is a house wife and does her household tasks by staying at home. She takes care of her husband and daughter very well and has a reputation among her family as a great wife and a caring mother. 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who operates a rice dish stall in the market. He sells a special dish made of rice, which is called Biryani, a very popular food here in Pakistan. He is famous in the market for the great taste of his rice dish and has a good client base. With the loan amount he will buy rice, chicken, spices and cooking oil in large quantity which helps him to make Biryani of larger quantity for selling through his stall to make more income.  
Khalida perveen is confident that by using his ten years of experience in this business, her husband will be able to get the desired results from the help of this investment.

loans.use: To purchase required items for Biryani sellling business.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Mrs. Pho Y., 39, (shown in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Sithon Sang, 46, live in a small village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have seven children, three sons and four daughters. Two of her daughters weave silk at home and the other children are in school.     

Pho has been a silk weaver for twenty years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a construction worker for fifteen years. 

Pho is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She will also use a part of her loan to pay for her house building fees.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and pay for her house building fees.

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en:
Galbadrah L. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Both of his children attend attend a local kindergarten while his wife is currently unemployed. 

Galbadrah operates an iron/metalwork business by producing a variety of stoves and welding work. He has been engaged this business for past 12 years and has built a stable operation. He is a very hardworking man and is requesting a 2,100,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to purchase a large amount of steel plates at a wholesale price for making stoves.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of steel plates

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling pork meat in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose Jorge

texts.es:
Jose Jorge F. A. tiene 53 anos. Es soltero y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos de 28 hasta 11 anos.  

Jose es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios. 
 
A Jose se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva soya y cacao. Hace las compras y ventas de sus productos en la provincia mismo. Solicita el crédito para comprar chanchitos. Ya tiene 2 chanchos, pero le gustaría ampliar un poco más. Con el apoyo del préstamo, podría tener más chanchos. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es mantener el hogar y que su hijo estudie. 

Se dedica a ayudar en la casa y le gusta jugar el fútbol.
texts.en:
Jose Jorge F. A. is 53.  He is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.  He has 4 children whose ages range from 11 to 28.

Jose is a member of the communal bank "El Placer de Ser Amigos" (The pleasure of being friends), which is located 20 minutes from the San Jose del Tambo parish.  There are 15 members total in the group, and the majority makes a living by either growing cocoa or by owning their own small businesses.

Jose makes a living through agriculture.  He grows soy beans and cocoa.  He buys and sells his products in his same province.  He is requesting this loan to buy piglets.  He already has 2 pigs, but he would like to expand his business a little more.  With the help of this loan, he could have more pigs.  His dream for the next 5 years is to support his home and to have his son go to school.

He also helps around his house, and he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Ángel Jonathan

texts.es: Ángel Jonathan M. es soltero labora para UPONIC como profesor de danza y ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL, este crédito lo solicita para comprar ropa y zapatos para un evento. Agradece a CEPRODEL  por la oportunidad.
texts.en: Ángel Jonathan M. is single and works for UPONIC [The People's University of Nicaragua] as a dance instructor.  He has taken out two loans through CEPRODEL.  He is requesting this loan to buy clothes and shoes for an event.  He thanks CEPRODEL for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for an event

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is married to M., who is a government employee on a meager income. He also runs a grocery store part-time in the market, from where he sells daily use items like cooking oils, spices, sugar and tea to his customers. Perveen is also a government employee, and runs her household very well.

She lives with her family in Khanewal, Pakistan. She has lived in a two-room brick house in an area named Christian colony for over 26 years. She has a son and daughter. Her son left school after 10th grade and started a job. Her daughter is in 9th grade. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to sell in his store. He has had this business for the past four years. Perveen is hopeful that an investment will bring better profits for her husband and her family will be able to enjoy a better life. 

She is a regular borrower of Asasah--this is her fourth loan application. In previous years, she has maintained a good credit record and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Lina Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Lina, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de  esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno ya es mayor de edad y los otros  de 16 y 9 años, todos estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela, su esposo trabaja en otro país.
 
Tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo donde también vende artículos de bazar, remedios y otros productos de papelería. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00, en su trabajo le ayudan su mamá y sus hijos cuando ellos pueden y no están estudiando. Los productos los recibe de distribuidores que le llevan hasta su local.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar más productos como: arroz, azúcar, enlatados, detergentes, carnes, pescado, remedios y otros.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años y le gusta por la facilidad para cancelar las cuotas y por la ayuda recibida. Su sueño es tener un negocio mucho más grande.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso (Hope & Progress) community bank meets twice a month in Montecristi, a region known for its rich precolonial culture and for the traditional that are made here and known around the world.

One of the bank's members is Sra. Lina, 40.  Lina is married and has 3 children, one grown, and two others, 16- and 9-years old, respectively.  All of the children are in school: university, high school and elementary school.  Her husband is working in another country.
 
Lina has a shop where she sells everyday commodities, medicines, paper supplies and other miscellaneous merchandise.  She works every day from 6:00am to 10:00pm.  Her mother helps her with the business and her children, too, when they aren't studying.  She gets her merchandise from distributors who deliver right to her shop.

Lina will use this loan to buy the merchandise she sells: rice, sugar, dairy products, detergents, meats, fish, medicines, etc.  She has been a member of the community bank for 10 years and appreciates the ease with which she can repay the loans.  Her goal is to own a much larger business.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Gelacia

texts.es: Gelacia, de 48 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que Gelacia realiza, es el cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca, todas las mañanas junto al mayor de sus hijos, sale a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del buen cuidado que les brinde dependerá la calidad de los productos que llevará a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y darles el cuidado necesario, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos de productos que lleva son muy pesados. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en la limpieza de sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Gelacia is 48 years old.  She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her 3 beloved children who she wants to provide with a better quality of life.  Gelacia's business is growing cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  She does this every morning together with her eldest child.  She works on her land and knows that the quality of the produce that she will take to sell in the city of San Francisco depends on the good care that she takes of her land.

Gelacia has been in this business for 20 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce since the sacks that she carries are very heavy.  Over time, she would like to buy more land to increase her production.

This is Gelacia's third loan with MFP and she is saving so that she can make her repayments on time since she doesn't want to inconvenience the other members of her community bank where she feels very happy.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to invest in cleaning up and weeding her coffee plantations.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help her clean up and weed her plantations

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells cooked food. She prepares local dishes like Banku (corn dough) and boiled yam with different types of sauces for sale at Ankaful near Abura. Esi has received no formal education.  She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a mason.

Esi has been selling cooked food like Banku and boiled yam with sauce for 4 years now. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the upkeep and other financial responsibilities of the home.

Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs and a few other ingredients to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the food business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and a few other ingredients to cook for sale.

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
Albino, de 38 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, está casado con Rómula, de 38 años, y viven en su propia casa junto a sus 3 hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El trabajo al que Albino se dedica es el cultivo de café, cacao y hoja coca. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus tierras, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Él vende sus productos en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la cosecha, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido frutos. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde su chacra hasta el punto de secado. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para aumentar su producción.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidaria con ellos.
Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Albino, 38, is a very happy and hardworking man.  He's married to Rómula, 38, and they live in their own house with their three children who are the prime reason for all their efforts.

Albino cultivates coffee, cacao, and coca leaves.  Early every morning he goes to work his fields because he knows the money he makes for his products depends on the quality of the harvest.  He sells in the city of San Francisco because that's where the prices are best.

What Albino likes most about his work is the harvest, because it makes him feel like all those months of labor have born fruit.  He's been doing this for eight years and considers the hardest part to be transporting the products from the farm to the drying area.  Later on he would like to obtain more fields to increase production.

This will be Albino's third loan with MFP and he feels like the money will really help him take his business forward.  He is very well-loved by the other members of his village bank because he is very tight with them.  He plans to use the 1000 soles he is seeking to buy more fertilizers to improve the quality of his fields.

loans.use: Compra de abono y fertilizantes

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
34-year-old Marilyn lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is married and has three children aged 15, 13, and six. All of her kids go to school. To make a living, Marilyn plants and harvests rice for sale. Marilyn wishes to have a more stable business.

Marilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This 4,000 Philippine peso loan is Marilyn's first loan from CEVI, and she intends to use the proceeds to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rositas Del Ocho Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Rositas del Ocho, eligieron este nombre porque las señoras viven en el barrio ocho y les gustan las rosas D. castilla. Este grupo está ubicado en el estado D. México. La comunidad se caracteriza  porque, la mayoría D. los habitantes se dedican a la crianza  D. borregos. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. Elizabeth López S. es integrante del grupo y tiene 27 años, estudió hasta la preparatoria,  es ama D. casa y comerciante, comenta que su negocio es parte fundamental para salir adelante y contribuye con los gastos D. su familia; ella tiene dos hijos varones. La señora Elizabeth  se dedica a la venta D. tacos D. carnitas D. cerdo que venD. los días lunes en el tianguis, ella lleva 8 años con el negocio. Su dedicación ha permitido que sus clientes la prefieran por su buen servicio y trato que les brinda a los clientes. Este préstamo le ayudará a comprar alimento para los cerdos que cría, así como condimentos que utiliza para la preparación D. las carnitas. Ella sueña que algún día pueda tener un establecimiento más granD. para poder satisfacer la demanda D. su producto.
texts.en:
This group is called “Rositas del Ocho” (The Little Roses of the Eight). The members chose this name because these ladies are from neighborhood #8 and enjoy Damask roses (otherwise known as roses of Castille). Most of the residents raise sheep. This group consists of eleven members.

Elizabeth López S. is one of the members of this group. She is 27 years old and completed her education through the preparatory level. Elizabeth is a housewife and merchant and says that her business is fundamental to her ability to move forward and contribute to her family’s expenses. She has two sons. Sra. Elizabeth sells roasted pork tacos at the flea market every Monday. She has been in this business for eight years. Her dedication has resulted in her customers choosing her because of the good service she provides. This loan will help her buy feed for the pigs that she raises, as well as condiments she uses for preparing pork tacos. She dreams of someday having a larger establishment so that she can satisfy the demand for her product.

loans.use: Purchase pig feed & condiments for preparing pork tacos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Nhem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of nine members. Mrs. Nhem, a married woman, was born in 1981; she is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this group will use their money to achieve their different goals. 

Nhem and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow corn and rice. In order to support this farming, Nhem would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing crops. Aside from being a farmer, her husband is also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. This couple has two children: one is attending a local school and the younger one is only four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing crops.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo T. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la reparación y ventas de llantas para automóviles.  
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta maquinaria mas moderna y mercancía, pero en esta momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que su negocio requiere y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo T. now has over three years of experience repairing and selling automobile tires.  The business needs a more modern machine and merchandise.  

However, he does not now have the money needed for the investment that his business requires.  He does not want to decapitalize the business because it is the source of income that he has for his family.

loans.use: to invest in machinery, equipment, and material for his business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 46 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a business planting harvesting taro to sell and has many years of experience in this business. Sylvia is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 188 USD weekly) to improve and expand.

Sylvia joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services. This is her second loan with SPBD. Most of SPBD’s clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel A. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. He is 43 years old. Ariel is married and has eight school-aged children. To earn an income for his family needs, he engages in a transportation business operating a motorcycle. Being in the business for 5 years, Ariel already has many customers thus making him earn at least 4000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Ariel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ariel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. Ariel is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Ariel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is a 27-year-old married man who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. He is a farmer and has been growing rice for 15 years. Benjie also opened a sari-sari store to help augment his family's income. His wife is the one managing the store.

Benjie applied for a loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Benjie hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Mrs. Va is the mother of two who has been working as a farmer since 1999. She and her husband work together in their farm field and earn a daily profit of approximately 5 USD to provide for expenses such as food, education, and utilities. 

Mrs. Va says she has a problem with meeting her family’s traveling needs. When they need to travel they must hire a motor taxi. To reduce this expense, Mrs. Va is requesting a loan through Kiva to buy a new motorbike. She plans to use the motorbike for traveling and also to start a motor taxi service to make extra income.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Benkadi  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi IV est composé  de femmes mariées du village de NIAZEKAN de la sous-préfecture de KIMPARANA relevant  de la préfecture de SAN, région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et au moins 9 enfants.
Elles cultivent essentiellement de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Benkadi IV ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel  de NIANCHO sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits équipements et des intrants pour mieux rentabiliser sa récolte d’arachide. Les achats se font  au grand marché de KIMPARANA. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de KIMPARANA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Benkadi IV comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 12500 à 65000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI IV group is made up of married women from the village of NIAZEKAN from the sub-prefecture of KIMPARANA, which comes under the prefecture of SAN, SÉGOU region, fourth administrative district of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional extended families. They are on average 44 years old and have at least 9 children.They essentially grow peanuts.

Wishing to make their farming ventures profitable, the members of the group Benkadi IV decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their preceding loans, they are on their fourth rural (seasonal) loan.

NIANCHO's new loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small equipment, and entrants to make her peanut crop more profitable. The supplies are bought at the big open-air market of KIMPARANA. After the rainy season, the harvest is stockpiled for a certain time to become valuable before being sold at the big market of KIMPARANA and the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele coming generally from the big towns.

After the sale of their crops, each of the members of this BENKADI IV group expects to earn a profit of 12,500 to 65,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and for current family expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants, seed, and small equipment.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní.
El comité que se denomina San Cayetano esta en el sexto Ciclo con 10  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser sus integrantes mujeres muy unidas, solidarias y responsable.
Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, creativo y responsable.
La Sra. Rosalia es una criadora de animales, desde muy pequeña se dedica a eso, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada. Por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido darle el sustento a su familia y a todos los suyos.
Solicita el credito para la compra de animales para criar y tambien para los alimentos de estos, cree que con esta ayuda podra progresasçr y generar un poco más de ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano committee was formed by several neighbors from a community in the city of Santaní.

The San Cayetano committee is in its sixth loan cycle and has ten members.  It is a group which is well noted in its neighborhood because all the members are very united, supportive and responsible.  The group members have a great entrepreneurial, creative and responsible spirit.

Rosalia raises animals.  She has been doing this since she was very young.  She considers herself to be a very hard-working and self-sacrificing woman.  Through her work, she has been able to support her whole family.  She is requesting this loan to buy animals to raise and also feed for the animals.  She believes that, with this help, she will be able to make progress and make a little more income.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 31 years old and married. He has one child.  

To earn a living, he runs a pharmacy. He also owns a retail shop that he operates with his wife's assistance.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and he earns more profit.

He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy a microscope and medicine.

loans.use: To buy a microscope and medicine.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe tiene veinte años  de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo de tres años de edad de nombre Rodrigo  Ángel y viven en la localidad de Ajilho.

     Ella es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo en fundación realidad, y es para invertirlo en la compra  de materiales para la elaboración de bordados de mantas, así como también en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes  y comenta que se dedica a estas dos actividades para  que mejor sea sus ingresos en su hogar.

    Su motivo esta actividad es que  ella es una mujer sola con un hijo  pequeño y desea darle lo más necesario, y con estas actividades trabajar para tener un mejor ingreso económico para comprar cosas que le hacen falta su hijo.

      Lo que más desea  es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda tener sus propios ahorros para que con  ellos siga trabajando y así salir adelante con su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe lives in Ajilho.  She’s 20 years old and the single mother of a three year old son named Rodrigo Ángel.

This will be her second loan through Fundación Realidad and she will use the money to invest in embroidered blankets and also other merchandise to stock her grocery store.  She tells us that she is involved in these two businesses so that she can improve her household income.

She does this because she is a single mother with a small son and she wants to provide for his needs and doing this type of work provides her with a better income so that she can buy her son the things he needs.

What she wants the most is to be able to have her own savings though these activities and continue to work to get ahead with her small family.

loans.use: to buy blankets and inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Prossy has a music studio, which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sound speakers for music. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Prossy hopes to expand her business. Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase sound speakers for music.

loans.name: Chynarkan's Group

texts.en:
Chynarkan is the leader of this group. She is 50 and married to a hospital attendant, who is also engaged in livestock breeding. Three years ago Chynarkan bought three goats for 1500 soms and since that day the family has been breeding livestock to make additional money to meet their daily needs. With the money from this loan Chynarkan wants to buy more livestock for breeding, fattening, and resale. In the future she wants to improve the family's living conditions and wishes to build a big house for her children.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Jacinto Inocente

texts.es:
Jacinto Inocente tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Jacinto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz, fréjol y comprar  semillas,insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para los posterior venderlos a un buen precio.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio, comprarse una finca y maquinaria para poder producir más.

Le gusta practicar el deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Jacinto Inocente is 32 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their children of 11 and 7 years old in Cantón Pueblo Viejo which is in Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

The members of V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS are located in El Marañón by Parroquia Puerto Pechiche which is in Cantón Pueblo Viejo. This service point does short-season agricultural work and grows corn, rice, and beans.

Jacinto grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his products from Karlita Agricultural Supply and sells them at Castillo market. 

He is asking for a loan to play corn, rice, and beans and to buy seeds, agricultural products, fertilizer, urea, and manure to keep his crops in good condition to later resell at a good price. The support of the loans will help him financially meet his needs. He faces challenges like pests, illnesses, and the changing weather. His dream is to expand the business, buy a farm and equipment to allow him to grow more. 

He likes to play sports and listen to music.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice, and beans and to buy seeds, agricultural products, fertilizer, urea, and manure.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 32 years, married and blessed with two children. He has been operating a cafeteria for one year. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow financially. He also does farming to earn extra income for his family.  
His desire is to grow his business and meet his customer’s demands. He needs a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy solar cooker for personal use.

loans.use: To buy a solar cooker

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 35 years old, married and has for the last four years supported his family of eight by selling soft drinks. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 and is applying for a loan for KES 20,000 to buy 20 bags of soy drinks to sell to his customers. This is his second loan, which he is applying for after having repaid his first loan fully and on time. He dreams of owning a large store someday and earning enough money to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of soy drinks to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is a 25-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan with three children.

Maram makes dairy products from goat milk and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase raw materials needed in making these products.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her project.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: El señor Zenón es agricultor y trabaja como mecánico en la ciudad de El Alto y su esposa e hijos lo ayudan con los trabajos de agricultura y producción de tubérculos. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba así mejorar el riego y la producción de tubérculos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia 	Aroma; es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Zenón is a farmer, but he also works as a mechanic in the city of El Alto. His wife and children help with the farm work and with growing tubers. The money from this loan will cover the cost of a water pump so that he can improve the irrigation and production of tubers. Zenón lives in his own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. He is married and has two children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for improving irrigation.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 42 years old and livers in the Saint Paul area. She is married and has five children between 14 and 25 years old. All of them live with her and are presently in school. For the past nineteen years she been selling rice and oil in the local market. Her business helps her to pay her children's school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and oil  for her business. She hopes to build  a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and oil  for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old. He lives with his pensioner parents and his wife in Ijevan City.

Since 1996, Robert has been engaged in a clothes trading business with his mother. He rents a stall in the clothes market in Ijevan City. Robert buys clothes in wholesale markets in Yerevan and resells them in his stall in Ijevan City. He sells only men's clothes: suits, trousers, sweaters, and tracksuits. 

This is Robert's second loan from Kiva and third from Nor Horizon. Thanks to his first Kiva loan, Robert increased his business merchandise assortment and made a good profit, which allowed him to buy furniture for his house.
 
Now Robert is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian dram to buy winter clothes for Christmas and New Year resale.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes for Christmas and New Year resale.

loans.name: Sofiya

texts.ru: София прекрасная хозяйка. Она на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Муж глава семьи работает колхозником. Семья трудолюбивая. Они все вместе стараются для создания лучших жилищных условий и получения образования. Несмотря на свой возраст она не сидит на месте. На рынке она продает молочные продукты. Она закупает продукцию на селе продает в городе. Её продукция очень востребована. На полученный доход они и живут. Для закупа еще больше товара нужны средства. Поэтому она хочет получить займ в размере 3000 сомони. Она обращается к добрым милосердным людям за помощью. Надеется получить займ и расширить свой товарооборот.
texts.en: Sofiya is a wonderful housewife. She is raising five children. Her husband the head of the family works as a farmer. Their family is hardworking. Together they try to make better living conditions and provide education. Despite her age Sofiya does not sit still. She sells milk products on the market. She buys the products in the village and sells in the town. Her products are in high demand. They spend the profit on daily living. She needs more money to buy more milk products. This is why she wants to take out a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni. Sofiya is asking kind and merciful people for help. She hopes to get the loan and increase the commodity turnaround.

loans.use: to buy milk products.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié sans enfants.Il exerce dans l'informatique et tient un cybercafé dans sa localité.Il entretient sa petite famille avec les revenus tirés des services qu'il offre à sa clientèle. Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un prêt de 200000f pour acheter des accessoires informatiques ( cd, disques dur, écran...).Son ambition est d'élargir son activité aux localité environnantes de sa ville.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who has no children. He is active in the computing business and has a cybercafé in his town. He looks after his small famiL. with the income he makes from the services he offers to his customers. In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 20,000 francs to buy computer accessories (CDs, hard disks, screens..). His ambition is to expand his business to areas surrounding his town.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories (CDs, hard disks, screens..)

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben was born in 1962. He lives in Ijevan city with his family, which consists of his mother, his wife and his three children. Ruben’s mother is a retiree, his wife is a teacher in Ijevan School, his daughters are pupils, and his son attends kindergarten.  
 
In 1986 Ruben graduated from Yerevan State Medical Institute, where he specialized as a therapeutist. He has been working in his specialty till now and simultaneously he has been engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. He is raising two cows, three calves, some poultry and four bee colonies as well. Also he has a vegetable garden and an orchard. Most of the agricultural produce is used for Ruben's family's needs, but he sells the remainder on-site. With income from his agricultural occupation, Ruben covers part of his family’s needs. 

Ruben is seeking a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy one more cow and to increase number of his bee colonies.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and to increase the number of his bee colonies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks of cereals, sugar, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Hellen

texts.es: Hellen de 35 años de edad es un a mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 5 a 10 años, con quienes vive al sur occidente de la ciudad, donde tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende mercancía variada, como ropa femenina y masculina, calzado y accesorios, desde hace 5 años, cuando con el fin de apoyar el bienestar de su hogar, decidió poner en marcha su idea emprendedora, con la que hoy ha logrado su objetivo. Hellen vende a sus clientes mercancías varias, mediante un sistema de crédito distribuido en cuotas, que oscilan entre semanal y mensual,  de acuerdo al plan de pago, que negocia previamente con ellos. Sus principales clientes se encuentran en los alrededores de su barrio y también son empleados de diversas empresas. El sueño  de Hellen, es convertir su negocio en una gran distribuidora de productos,  donde la gente encuentre todo lo que necesita y ella poder vender al por mayor,  a personas  que distribuyen día a día, como lo hace ella hoy. En la actualidad, planea aprovechar la temporada de fiestas de final del año, para aumentar sus ventas y generar mucho mas ingreso, porque sus clientes han hecho pedidos a los cuales desea responder y no tiene el suficiente capital de trabajo para hacerlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará adornos navideños, vestidos elegantes, juguetes y calzado, para responder a las solicitudes de sus clientes y darse el gusto de verlos felices y bien elegantes recibiendo el nuevo 2012.
texts.en:
Hellen is 35 years old. She is a married woman and has 3 children who are between 5 and 10 years old. They live southwest of the city where she has a business selling varied merchandise, such as clothing for women and men, shoes and accessories. She decided five years ago, in order to help with the financial welfare of her home, to launch her entrepreneurial plan, which she has successfully done. 

Hellen sells general merchandise to her customers, through a credit system whereby they make payments, ranging from weekly or monthly, according to the payment agreement that she negotiates with them before the sale. Her main customers live around the neighborhood and also are employed by various companies.

Hellen’s dream is to turn her business into a large distributor of products where people find whatever they need and she can sell it at wholesale, for people to resale every day, as she is doing today.

At this time she plans to take advantage of the holiday season at the end of the year to increase her sales and to earn much more income, because her customers have made requests to which she wants to respond but she does not have enough cash flow to do it. This is the reason for which she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first financial funding under the wing of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy Christmas decorations, party dresses, games and shoes in order to respond to the needs of her clients and give herself the pleasure of seeing them happy and very elegant when receiving the 2012 New Year.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations, party dresses, toys, and shoes

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de una de las comunidades de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas ellas tienen  sus propias actividades, pero también realizan actividades en grupo, para que de esa forma puedan fomentar su compañerismo.
Nilda es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella al igual que la mayoría de sus compañeras se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser cerdos y pollos. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y trabajoso, ya que debe de estar pendiente las 24 hs de sus animales, para que estos estén bien. Su meta es tener una gran granja para poder tener un mayor número de animales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de lechones y pollitos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo. Además de eso desea poder comprar alimentos para sus animales. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por esta oportunidad de progreso que estas le dan.
texts.en:
The “La Esperanza” (Hope) arose when several neighbors from one of the communities in the city of Santaní joined together.  All of them have their own activities but they also carry out group activities to strengthen their companionship.

Nilda is one of the group members.  Like most of her fellow group members she raises animals like pigs and chickens to sell.   She comments that her work is very demanding and hard because she must be watchful 24 hours a day so that her animals will be well.  Her goal is to have a big farm in order to have a larger amount of animals.

She is asking for the loan to buy piglets and chicks so that she can continue growing.  She also wants to buy feed for her animals.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity to progress they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a resident of Litein in South Rift Kenya.  She is married with 6 children who are between the ages of 26 and 11 years old, with the last five still in school.  She has been in farming for 8 years and currently produces maize, milk and eggs for the local market.

Joice has requested a loan of  20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and to improve the poultry business.  She says her experience  with poultry farming in the business will boost her income and help her take good care for her family.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for faster loan processing .

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Gajabayani Group

texts.en:
For the development of house hold some extra income is wanted. So one of the women Saraswati from Bargaon located in the M.Rampur, Kalahandi, Odisha, India. Concerned women and her village’s some self dependent women stepped out and decisive to build a secure life for future and their families with their contributions. They formed a group named “Gajabayani” to avail appreciation from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing business and develop their social life. Saraswati is the leader of the group who is standing in the front middle person of their group in the photo is Saraswati. 
She has about 46 years old and lives with her husband and only one son. Saraswati’s husband engaged with barber work, since last 9 years. From their occupation the total earning capacity is about Rs.6, 000/- per month. From concerned income, this is not sufficient to maintaining thier family in a smooth way. With this limited earning capacity which is out of maintaining the personal expansion & social livelihood. 
So she planned to borrow the loan from Mahashakti Foundation .Which loan can help to develop herself and her family members as well as can maintain the good social livelihood. After disbursement of loan they will purchase more and more stock on barber items and related items as well as they planned for hire another cabin for saloon which will help her to away from rented cabin. Saraswati wishes to grow her business and save enough to educate her child. 
Other 10 members of the group are also engaged with different Diary, popped rice business, Vegetable, fast-food shop, tailoring and battle shop respectively and they also can improve after loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase Mirror, scissors, after save, saving cream, Hair dryer

loans.name: Kosilanta

texts.en:
Kosilanta is 42 years, married with ten children,3 go to school and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a market stall where she deals in buying and selling of rice on top of cocoa trading. She started the business 10 years ago to earn a living where she reaps good profits. She is hard working and plans to expand the business, but faces challenges of competition which affects her returns. 

Kosilanta has requested for a loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionicio vive con sus padres  y hermanos, él trabaja como chofer y estudia por la noche, es una persona muy dedicada que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus derechos de exámenes, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios. Él tiene como meta poder ser un profesional útil no solo para sí mismo sino también para los demás.

loans.use: Pagar derechos de examenes

loans.name: Galia

texts.en:
Galia M. is 44 years old. She is single and lives with her old mother and looks after her. Galia is an invalid from birth. One of her legs is shorter than the other. She receives a disablement pension but it is too small and three years ago she has decided to open a stall for coffee, soft drinks and refreshments.

She has the experience because she has worked as a store seller for more then fifteen years. The money she earns of this stall helps her to look after her mother.

Now Galia M. needs $ 500 to supply coffee, soft drinks, mineral water, candies.

loans.use: To supply coffee, soft drinks, mineral water, candies

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: I am a father of 3, aged 34 years. I am a painter. I also take care of my parents.  . I wish to earn more by diversifying and advertising my business to the building industry.

loans.use: Purchase working tools

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow and has one grown son. She recently retired from one job, however she was forced to continue working in order to support herself. Eight years ago she decided to start her own business so she could be self-sustainable. By concentrating on a fairly narrow market niche to avoid a head-on collision with bigger competitors, Valentina has developed a successful business selling lightweight bathrobes, pajamas and slippers in the local market. Her inventory is characterized by the finest fabrics, warmth and comfort which attracts many customers to her kiosk.

Valentina trusts the Lord with her venture. She prays often about it and is very committed to its success. Presently, she has about $1,000 in inventory. Her gross revenue is about $1,300 per month and her net profit amounts to around $320 a month.

Valentina has requested a loan for $800 to re-stock her inventory. She would like purchase a good supply of simple, elegant bathrobes and an assortment of slippers that come in a variety of colors and are one-size-fits-all. She is confident that they will sell well and bring her additional income. We believe that Valentina’s flexibility, ability to respond quickly to changes and her knack for providing personalized service will help her continue to succeed in her market.

loans.use: Valentina would like to to re-supply inventory for her lounge-wear store.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Aged 22, Miss Akouvi A. had to abandon the classroom to learn to sew. Her parents left to live on a farm and she has to live in the village with one of her brothers, a master tapestry-maker, in order to pursue her apprenticeship. She has just finished but does not have the means to buy sewing machines and open her own workroom. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy a sewing machine and rent somewhere to use as a workroom. This will allow her to take advantage of her craft and help her parents.

Agée de 22 ans, Mlle A. Akouvi a du abandonné les bancs pour apprendre la couture. Ses parents sont partis rester dans la ferme pour l’agriculture elle est obligée de rester chez l’un de ses frères de village un maître tapissier afin de poursuivre son apprentissage. Elle vient de terminer et les moyens lui manquent pour s’acheter des machines et ouvrir son atelier. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $600 pour acheter une machine, louer un local qui va lui servir d’atelier. Ceci lui permettra de profiter de son métier et en faire profiter ses parents.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and open a workroom

loans.name: Anarosa

texts.en: Anarosa is 32 years old has three children. She was unemployed until she decided to start her own barbeque business to provide for her family. She enjoys running her own business, because of her skill at cooking and her interest in cuisine. Her first loan of $300 was spent on purchasing the meats needed to run her business. She would like another loan to purchase a gas oven to replace her old charcoal cooker, which would make serving her clients much easier. She is extremely appreciative of the aid she has received that helped her begin her own business.

loans.use: Buying meats for the business.

loans.name: Elvira De Jesus

texts.es:
I have owned a little grocery store for the last 8 years ago. I opened this business when I became jobless. I require the funds in order to buy the following products: rice, sugar, corn, bread, eggs, carbonated beverages, soaps, churros (fried bread) and other items. I am in urgent need of it, since I have to supply my business in order to offer better service to my customers. With my earnings, I support my family since my husband doesn't make much of an income and we have many expenses because of our children.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo tengo una pequeña pulperia (grocery store) hace 8 años. Este negocio lo abrí cuando me quede sin trabajo. El dinero lo necesito para hacer las siguientes compras: arroz, azúcar, maíz, pan, huevos, sodas jabones churros y otros. Me urege ya que tengo que surtir mi negocio para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes. Con las ganancias sostengo a mi familia porque mi esposo gana muy poco y tenemos muchos gastos con nuestros hijos.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, rice, dishwasher soap, quintals of corn, churros (fried bread), cookies, bread and other items.

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Mrs. Oghogho Uyi is 37 years old, is married with six children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells wood (planks) to people. She has been in this business since 1998 and she is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more wood to sell.

loans.use: Oghogho would like to buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Yangi

texts.en: Yangi T. is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells rice, sugar and flour in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. She has been selling these items for over ten years now but due to a lack of business capital, she has been unable to improve her business significantly. With her previous loans, Yangi expanded her business to some degree. She is now able to pay her children’s school expenses without difficulty and can meet other family expenses. Yangi would like to earn more profit by diversifying her business and is therefore requesting a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: Diversify her business by selling additional food items to attract new customers

loans.name: Kira B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hasifah N.. She runs a small tailoring business and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to expand her business. Hasifah is 32 years old and a single mother of two children aged 6 and 9. Her children go to school. Each week, Hasifah makes approximately UGX 60,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her childrens' school fees.

Hasifah has taken a previous loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 400,000 to invest it in business and the loan was paid back on time. Hasifah is joined in her small group by Rose N., Sartine K., Agnes O., and Molly N.. Rose N. runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to increase her stock. Sartine K. sells milk and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more milk cans. Agnes O. runs a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to open another salon in a diferent location. Molly N. sells food in a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to increase her stock in the canteen.

loans.use: To expand a tailoring business

loans.name: Nassuti A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane K.. She is currently in the business of farming and is requesting a loan to add to a cattle business. Jane is 42 years old and is married. She has 8 children ranging from age 12 to 28 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business.

Jane is joined in her small group by Prossy W., Monica M., Ruth M., and Milly N.. Prossy W. has a business in farming and wants to add to the business. Monica M. is currently operating a maize business and wants a loan to purchase more maize. Ruth M. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand to bulk selling. Milly N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy more cloth fabric.

loans.use: To purchase more animal feed and purchase more cows

loans.name: Cira Asteria

texts.es:
Ciria Asteria Gómez R. is 53 years old; she studied as far as second grade in primary school. She has six children but only three are still her dependents. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

Every Saturday and Sunday she works as a traveling vendor at the Otuzco market, selling vegetables such as: carrots, green onions, coriander and others, as well as medicinal plants and flowers. During the week she works on her farm, where she raises small amounts of grains and potatoes; part of this she consumes and the rest she sells.

She is a member of the "Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" community bank, where she obtained her first loan with which she bought all types of vegetables. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy carrots, onions, coriander and flowers.

Her greatest dream is to buy land where she can build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Cira Asteria Gómez R. tiene 53 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Tiene seis hijos en total pero solo tres aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Ella vende los días sábados y domingos en condición de ambulante en el mercado de Otuzco, vende verduras como: zanahoria, cebolla china, culantro y otros; así también plantas medicinales y flores. Entre semana se dedica a la chacra en la cual cosecha un poco de granos de cereales y papa parte de estos productos los consume y la otra parte los vende.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro verduras de todo tipo. Con el préstamo de S/. 400.00 el cual lo pagara en un periodo de cuatro meses comprará 4 arrobas de zanahoria, dos cientos de cebolla, un paquete de culantro y también flores.

Su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno para construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase carrots, onions, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.en:
Miline Palveuts is a 25 year-old woman who lives with her 5 children (ages: 9, 7, 6, 4, 6 months) and husband in the small community of Imbert in the Dominican Republic. To support her family, Miline sells used clothing in the street. She is on her feet 10 hours a day, which is exhausting. Miline hopes that one day she'll be able to afford to rent a store near her home.

That is why Miline and 14 other women--all of who emigrated form Haiti in the hopes of finding a better life--have applied for a collective loan of $2,225 U.S. dollars.

In her free time, Miline enjoys going to church and reading her Bible. The entire group would like to thank every Kiva lender and tell them God bless.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha Lorena M. is a very hardworking woman, dedicating herself to her agricultural business for several years now with the aim of improving her living conditions and concurrently provide a better education for her three school-aged children.

Since she started her business, she has always had in mind improving her status of living and investing to generate a better income for her children who hope to continue their studies.

The need she currently has occurred because she does not have electricity in her home, given that she lives in a very isolated area. For this reason, she has reached out to CEPRODEL for assistance in obtaining a loan to pay for installation of a solar panel. Upon receipt of the loan, she must be very responsible and cancel her debt so that she can get ahead along with her kids who rely on her a great deal.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Lorena M. es una mujer muy esforzada en su negocio agropecuario dedicándose a esta labor desde hace varios años con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y de igual manera de brindarles las mejores condiciones de estudio a sus tres hijos en edad escolar.

Desde que inició su labor siempre ha tenido en mente mejorar su status de vida invirtiendo para obtener mejores ingresos para sus hijos con el propósito de que logren estudiar.

La necesidad que actualmente atraviesa es que no posee energía eléctrica en su hogar por vivir en una zona muy alejada. Por esta razón es que ha solicitado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito oportuno para el pago del panel solar debido que al haberlo obtenido tiene que ser muy responsable y cancelar esta deuda para que de esta manera logre salir adelante junto con sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe L., 44, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the barbeque foods business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has had 5 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Pepe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use the loan for home improvement by buying cement, timber and an iron roof. Her husband also works to help out with the family  needs.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and materials needed for food production such as meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 56 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a town close to Saida, in the south of Lebanon. He owns a grocery store and has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua for the past five years.

Mohamad is a very ambitious and motivated man. With the help of previous loans, he gradually expanded his business. He used the first loan of $1200 to purchase more goods for his shop. The second loan was to purchase a new truck to sell potatoes. Presently, he needs $700 to purchase a stock of juice bottles. Indeed, during the summer season there is an increased demand for such products and he needs to pay for the increase in inventory in cash to the supplier.

loans.use: To purchase stock of juice bottles

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly M. is 44 years old and lives with her father. She makes bricks to sell from her house. She works hard at her business and earns approximately US$5.96 per day. She is single and started her business in 2000. Her father is a rice farmer. She lives in Kean Sangkei Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Ly thought about her lack of capital to use for her business. She decided to request a loan of US$800 to stock clay for making bricks and to buy gas and wood to operate her business. The loan will increase her income, which will help her support her family and sufficiently cover their living expenses.

loans.use: To stock clay to make bricks and to buy gas and wood to operate her business

loans.name: Raufjon

texts.en:
Raufjon M. is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. Raufjon is a selfless father, and as a good head of household, he has in mind what he should do to support his family.

He decided to dedicate himself to raising livestock three years ago. He added everything he learned to the education his parents had instilled in him since he was a child. He plans to keep raising livestock and to acquire even more. This is why he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) that will allow him to purchase more fodder for the normal development and competitiveness of his cattle. He promises to repay the loan in 12 months. He thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
Al contar con 15 años de experiencia en la crianza y venta de chanchos, el señor Sebastián tiene más de 30 casado (su esposa es la que sale en la foto), junto con ella se ha propuesto conseguir una calidad de vida adecuada para sus próximos años puesto que su única hija ya está casada y en el mismo negocio independientemente. Con su vida entera dedicada al negocio y, a eventuales trabajos de carpintería y construcción, no le alcanza para tener un estilo de vida regular siquiera, pero la venidera temporada navideña le abren las puertas de la esperanza.

Debido a la alta demanda de lechones (chanchos pequeños, de entre 0 y 6 meses) por dicha campaña, es que requiere de 700 soles para poder financiar el alimento de sus lechones y poder venderlos a un precio justo para su inversión.
texts.en:
With 15 years of experience in raising and selling pigs, Sebastian has been married for over 30 (his wife is the one in this photo). Together, the couple work to achieve an appropriate quality of life for themselves over the upcoming years, due to the fact that their only daughter is now married and has her own business in this field. Sebastian has worked his entire life, raising pigs and doing odd jobs like carpentry and construction, but he has not yet achieved a normal standard of living. However, the upcoming Christmas season opens the doors of hope. Due to the high demand for piglets (between zero and six months old) during this season, Sebastian needs 700 soles to finance the food for his piglets and sell them at a fair price for his investment.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer
